S. to þe Corynthes he wryteþ, & seiþ, Breþeren, y prey ȝow by þe name of oure Lord Iesu Crist, þat ȝe suggen on þing, & þat þer ben none dyuysyones among ȝow; bote be ȝe parfyt in on wyt & in on cunnynge. For it is y-tolde me þat þer beþ stryuynges among ȝow. & y ne sugge bote þat, þat euerichone of ȝow saiþ, Ich am of Poule; & ych am of Apolloy am of apollo repeated in the margin, 1st corr. S.; & ich am of Petur; & ich am of Crist. Þanne is Crist departed? Wheþer Poule were y-don on þe cros for ȝow? oþer wheþer ȝe werenweren ȝe P. y-baptyzed in þe name of Poule? & y þonke God þat y ne haue noȝt y-baptyzed none of ȝow, bote Crispen & Gayen; lest eny man sugge, þat ȝe ben y-baptyzed in my name. Safe ich baptyzed Stephanies houshold, & y ne knewe no mo þat ych haue y-baptyzed. For Crist neom. P. sende noȝt me for to baptyze, bote for-to preche þe gospel: noȝt in þe wysdom of wordes, þat þe cros of Crist ne be noȝt y-voyded a-wey. For þe word of þe cros to þilke þat perescheþpercheþ P. An e in the margin, S. is foly; bote to þilke þat beþ y-safed, as to ous, it is þe vertu of God. For it is y-wryten, Ych wole dystruyedystroye repeated in the margin, 1st corr. S. þe wysdom of wyse men, & ych wole reprefe þe redynesse of redy men. WhereWheþer P. is þe wyse man? wherewere P. þe makere of þe lawe? where þe geteregretere P. of þe worldeworde P.? ne haþ noȝt God mad þe wysdom of þis world folye? & for þat þe world in wysdom ne knew not God þorowȝ wysdom, it wes
plesynge to God by foly of prechynge maken hem saf þat byleueþ. For Iewes secheþ sygnes, & Grekes secheþ wysdom: bote we precheþ Crist þat is y-crucyfyed, þat is sclaundreAn e in the margin, S. to þe Iewes, & foly to oþer mysbylefed men; bote to þilke þat beþ y-cleped, boþe Iewes & Grekes, we precheþ Crist þe wysdom of God, and þe vertue of God. For þat þat is folye of God it is wiser þan men; &om. P. þat is febel of God is strengere þan man. &, bryþeren, y-seoBefore seo erasure of y. The right half of o erased, S. ȝe ȝoure clepynge, for nouþer monyo in mony corrected from e, S. wyse men aftur þe flesch, ne mony myȝty men, ne mony nobel men: bote þilke þinges þat beþ foly of þe worlde God ches, to confounde wyse men; & febel þinges of þe worlde God ches, to confounde stronge þinges; & þilke þinges þat weren noȝt nobel, but dispised of þe worlde, God chees, and þilke þinges þat beþ noȝt, to distruye þilke þinges þat beþ: þat eferich flesch ne reioysche hym noȝt in his siȝt. Bote of hym ȝe beþ in Iesu Crist, þat is y-mad wysdom to ous of God, & riȝtfulnesse, & holynesse, & for|buggynge: þat, as it is y-wryte, He þat ioyeþ, ioye he in God.

Andiio in a late hand in the margin, S., bryþeren, whan þat ich com to ȝow, y ne come noȝt yn hyȝenesse of wordis ne of wysdom, schewenge to ȝow þe wytnesse of Crist. For ich demed þat y ne knewe no þing a-mong ȝow, bote Iesu Crist y-crucifyed. And ich wes a-mong ȝow in infirmyte, & in gret drede, & in quakynge. & my word & my predicacioun ne wes noȝt in semynge wordiswordis repeated in the margin, 1st corr. S. of mannes wysdom, bote in schewynge of þe spiryt & of vertu: þat ȝoure feiþ ne be noȝt in mannes wysdom, bote in þe vertu of God. & we spekeþ wysdom a-mong parfyt men: bote non wysdom of þis worlde, ne of þe princys of þis world þat beþ destruyed: bote we spekeþ þe wysdom of God in mysterie þat is y-hud, þe whuche wysdom God ordeynyd byfor þe worldes to oure ioye: þe whuche wysdom non of þe princes of þis worlde knew: for ȝif þei hadden y-knowe, þei nolde nefer haue crucyfyed þe Lord of blysse: but as it is
y-wryten, Þat þe eyȝe ne haþ noȝt y-seye, ne þe ere ne haþ noȝt y-herd, ne haþ noȝt y-styed up in-to mannes herte, þat God haþ y-ordeyned to þilke þat lofeþ hym. Bote to ous God haþ y-schewed hit by his Spiryt: for þe Spiryt sercheþ alle þinges, ȝe, & þe depe þinges of God. For what man knoweþ þilke þinges þat beþ of men, bote þe spiryt of man, þat is in hym? so þilke þinges þat beþ of God no man knoweþ, bote þe Spiryt of God. & we ne hafeþ noȝt vnder|fongen þe spiryt of þis worlde, bote þe spiryt þat is of God; þat we knowen þilke þinges þat beþ y-graunted to ous of God; þe whuche þinges we ne spekeþ noȝt in vntauȝt wordes of mannes wysdom, bote in þe techynge of þe Spiryt, tellynge to spirytual men spirytual þinges: bote þe bestyche in the margin S. man ne parceyfeþ noȝt þilke þinges þat beþ of þe Spiryt: for þei ne beþ but folye to hym, & he ne may noȝt vnderstonden, for he isded goslech in the margin, 1st corr. S. ded soþlyche follows, P. Cf. Vulg. quia spiritu|aliter examinatur. examyned spirytualyche. Bote þe spirytual man demeþ alle þinges, & he ne is noȝt y-demed of no man. For it is y-wryten, Whowho þat P. haþ y-knowe þe wyt of oure Lord, bote þe Spiryt of oure Lord, þat haþ enformed hym? & we habbeþ þe wyt & þe vnderstondynge of Crist.

And, bryþeren, y ne myȝte noȝt herbyfore speke to ȝow as to spirytual men, bote as to fleschlyche men, & as to smale children in Crist. Ich ȝef ȝow mylkmylk repeated in marg. 1st corr. S. to drynke, & noȝt mete; for þat tyme ȝe ne myȝte noȝt, ne ȝit nowAfter the w erasure of two letters, probably þe, S., ȝe ne mowe noȝt; for ȝit ȝe beþ fleschlyche: for whyles þer beþ enuyeenmye P. & stryuynge a-mong ȝow, ne be ȝe noȝt fleschlyche, & walkeþ after þe flesch? For whyles þat on saiþ, Ich am of Poul; & an oþer, Ich am of Apollo; ne be ȝe noȝt men? & what þanne is Apollo? & what is Poul? His serfauntes in whom ȝe habbeþ byleued, & to eferich man as God haþ y-grauntydy erased and expunged before grauntyd, S.. Y plaunted, & Apollo moysted; bote oure Lord ȝefeþ þe waxynge. & þerfore nouþer he þat plaunted is ouȝt, ne he þat moysted; bote he þat ȝefeþ þe waxynge is God. Bote he
þat plaunteþ & he þat moysteþ beþ on; & eferich man schal vnderfongen his mede aftur his trauayl. & we beþ Goddes helperes, & ȝe beþ Goddes erþe-tylyynge, & Goddes buyld|ynge. And aftur þe grace of God þat is y-granted to me, as a wys buyldere ich hafe y-sett a foundement; bote an oþer buldeþ abofe. Bote loke eferych man how he buyldeþ a-bofe. For no man may settensetten repeated in the margin, 1st corr. S. anoþer foundement þan þat þat is y-set, þat is Iesu Crist. & who-efer þat buyldeþ abofe þis foundement gold, oþer selfer, oþer precyous stones, treoo nearly erased, S., oþer heyom. P., oþer stubbel; eferich mannes werke schal ben openliche y-schewed; & þe day of oure Lord schal declaren it, for in fuyr it schal be schewed; & fuyr schal prefen whuch mannes werk. For whos werk þat is y-buyld a-bofe & dwelleþ stylle, it schal vndurfongen his mede. Bote whos werk branneþ a-wey, he schal suffre harmynge: bote he schal be safed; bote þat schal ben as þoroȝ fuyr. Ne knowe ȝe noȝt þat ȝe beþ Goddes temple, & þe Spiryt of God dwelleþ in ȝow? & who-efer þat defouleþ þe temple of God, God wole de|struyene in the margin, S. hym: for ȝe beþ þe holy temple of God. No man bygyle ȝow: ȝef þer seme eny man among ȝow a wys man in þis world, be he y-maad a fool, þat he be a wys man. For þe wysdom of þis world is folye byfore God. For it is y-wryten, Ich wole take wyse men in hure folye: & eftsones, God knoweþ þat þe þouȝtes of wyse men beþ veyn. & þerfore no man reioyesche hym-selfen a-mong men. For alle þinges beþ ȝouren; wheþer hit be Poul, oþer Apollo, oþer Petur, oþer þis worlde, oþer lyfþe lyf P., oþer deþ, oþer þinges þat beþ nouþe, oþer þinges þat schuleþ comen heraftur; for alle þinges beþ ȝouren; & ȝe beþ of Crist, & Crist is of God.

Bote þer is y-herd fornycacyoun a-mong ȝow, & such fornycacyoun as ne is noȝt a-mong mysbylefed men, in so muche þat summe of ȝow hafe his fadur wyf. & ȝe beþ y-blowe wiþ pruyde, & ȝe ne hafeþ y-mad no sorow, þat he be don a-wey from þe myddel of ȝow, þat haþom. P. y-do þis dede. & ich, þat am absent in body & present in spiryt, hafe y-demed
as present þilke þat haþ y-don so, in þe nome of oure Lord Iesu Crist, whan ȝe beþ y-gedered to-gedere in my spiryt, wiþ þe vertu of oure Lord Iesu, to take þilke man to Satanas in slauȝt of his flesch, þat þe spiryt be saf in þe day of oure Lord Iesu Crist. Ȝoure ioyynge ne is noȝt good. Ne knowe ȝe noȝt þat a lytel sowrdowȝdowȝ repeated in the margin, 1st corr. (?) S. schendeþ al-to-geder? Þerfore make ȝe clene ȝoure olde sowrdowȝ, þat ȝe ben a newe spryngenge to-gedere, as ȝe beþ þerf. For Crist is y-offred, oure astur-lombafter lomb P.: & þerfore ete we, not in þe olde sowrdowȝ, ne in sowrdouȝ of malyce, ne of wykkednes, bote in þerfnes of clernes & of trewþe. Y wrot to ȝow in an epystel þat ȝe ne medle noȝt wiþ lecchoures, ne wiþ none lecchoures of þis world, ne wiþ coueytous men, ne wiþ rafeneres, ne wiþ hem þat serfeþ mawmetes; for wharto schulde ȝe elles haue y-gon out from þe world: & now ych hafe y-wryte to ȝou þat ȝe ne medle noȝt wiþ hem; & ȝif he þat is y-cleped a broþer of ȝow is a lecchour, oþer a coueytous man, oþer serfynge to maw|metis, oþer a mysseggere, oþer dronkelew man, oþer a rafeyner; ne ete ȝe noȝtne ete ȝe noȝt repeated in the margin, 1st corr.(?) S. wiþ such a manere man. & what is þat to me for-to demen of þilke þinges þat beþ wiþouten-forþ? Ne deme ȝe noȝt ofof inserted above the line, S. þilke þinges þat beþ wiþinne-forþ? For þilke þat beþ outen-forþ God schal deme. Doþ a-wey þat þing þat is efel from ȝow-selfen.

And dar þer any of ȝow, þat haþ any þing a-ȝeyn oþer, ben y-demed to-fore wikked men & noȝt to-fore goode men? Wheþer ȝe ne knowen noȝt þat goode men habbeþ to demen þis word? & ȝif þis world schal ben y-demed in ȝow, be ȝe noȝt worþi to demen þe leste þinges? Ne knowe ȝe noȝt þat we schulleþ demen angeles? How muche more þanne wordlyche þinges. & þerfore ȝif ȝe habbeþ wordlyche domes a-mong ȝow, þilke þat beþ y-left worþi a-mong ȝou, ordeyneþ hem for to demenFor for to demen P. has to comen.. To ȝoure schame y sugge it. Is þer no wys man of ȝow þat may demen by-twene hym & his broþer, bote on broþer st[r]yueþ in dom wiþ his broþer, & þis is a-mong mysbylefed men?
& now algates þer is sunne a-mong ȝow, þat ȝe han domes a-mong ȝou. Why ne suffre ȝe noȝt raþere wrong? Why ne suffre ȝe noȝt raþer gylynge? Bote ȝe doþ wrong in gyle also to ȝoure bryþeren. Wheþer ȝe knowe noȝt þat wykked men ne schuleþ noȝt haue þe kyngdom of heuene? Ne erre ȝene erre ȝe repeated in the margin, 1st corr. (?) S. noȝt: for nouþer lecchoures, ne þilke þat serfeþ false goddis, ne spouse-brekeres, ne sodomytes, ne þefes, ne coueytous men, ne dronken men, ne glotones, ne curseres, ne rafeneres, ne schulleþ not owe þe kyngdom of God. And ȝe weren suche: ȝeom. P., bote ȝe beþ now y-wasche, & ȝe beþ y-halewed, & beþ y-iustyfyed in þe name of oure Lord Iesu Crist, & in þe Spiryt of oure God. Alle þinges beþ lefful to me, bote alle þinges ne beþ noȝt spedful to me. Alle þynges ben lefful to me, bote y ne schal noȝt ben ybrouȝty om. P. aȝeyn vnder no mannes powere in the margin, S.. Mete to þe wombe, & wombe to þe mete: & God wole distruye boþe þe body & þe mete. & þe body ne is noȝt to fornycacyoun, bote to oure Lord: & oure Lord to þe body. & God haþ rered up oure Lord, & he wole areren us up by his verteu. And ne knowe ȝe noȝt þat ȝoure bodyes beþ membres of Crist? schal me take þanne Cristis membres, & make hem þe membres of an hore? God for|bede. Ne knowe ȝe noȝt þat he þat draweþ hym to an hore ys y-mad on body wiþ hure? For he seyde, þei schulleþ benben (expunged) follows, S. tweyn in on flesch. Bote þilke þat draweþ to God beþ on spirit. Fle ȝe fornycacyoun. Eferech synne þat a man doþ it is wiþ-outen þe body, bote he þat doþ fornycacyoun synneþ in-to his body. Wheþer ȝe ne knowe noȝt þat ȝoure membres beþ þe temple of þe Holy Gost, þat is in ȝou, whom ȝe han of God? & ȝe ne beþ noȝt ȝoure owne; for ȝe beþ y-boȝt for a gret prys: & þerfore glorifye ȝe God & bere ȝe hym in ȝoure body.

And þo ilke þinges þat ȝe wryten to me, þat it is good for a man þat he ne touche no womman. Bote, for forny|cacioun, eferich man hafe hishis in a later hand above the line, S. a P. wyf, & eferiche womman hure
housbondehusbond repeated in the margin, S.. & þe housbonde ȝelde his dette to his wyf; & þe womman also to hure housbonde. Þe womman ne haþ noom. P. power of hure owne body, bote þe housbonde haþ: ne þe housbonde ne haþ no power of his owne body, bote þe womman haþ. Ne bygyle ȝe noȝt to-gedere, but it be toom. P. a certeyn tyme of ȝoure boþe assent, þat ȝe ben occupyed in preyynge, & afturward turne ȝe aȝeyn to þe same doynge, þat þe defel ne tempte ȝow noȝt for ȝoure in-contynence. Bote þese þinges y sugge to ȝow ȝefynge ȝou lefe, & noȝt comaun|dynge. For ich wole þat alle men ben as ich myselfe. Bote eferyche man haþ a propre ȝifte of God, on man so, & an oþer man so. & y seye to þilke þat beþ vn-weddyd & to wydewes, It is good for hem to ben so, ȝif þei dwellen stille as ych do. Bote ȝif þei mowe noȝt ben contynent, ben þei y-wedded: yt is betur to ben y-wedded þan to ben y-brent. Bote to þilke þat beþ yweddedy weddeþ P. to-gedere ych comaunde, & not ych, bote oure Lord, þat þe wyf nene be P. departe hure noȝt from hure housbonde, & ȝif heo doþþ erased after the o, S. doþ P., dwelle he[o]sche inserted in later hand on erasure, S. he P. stille vn-wedded, oþer elles turne heo a-ȝeyn to hure hous|bonde, & þe housbonde ne lefe noȝt his wyf. To oþer men y seye, & not oure Lord, A man þat haþ a mysbylefyd wyf & heoȝe P. assenteþ to dwelle stille wiþ hym, ne lefe he noȝt hure. & þe womman þat haþ ahaþ a in the margin with caret to mark insertion, S. mysbylefed man to housbonde þat assenteþ to dwelle wiþ hure, ne lefe heoȝe P. noȝt hure housbonde. For a mysbylefed man is y-maad holy þoroȝ a feyþful womman, & a mysbyleued womman is y-mad holy þorowȝ a feyþful man: oþer elles ȝoure children weren vnclene; bote now þei beþ holy. & ȝif þilke þat is mysbylefed goþ a-wey, go he a-wey: for in suche nouþer broþer ne suster is soget to þraldam: bote in pes God haþ y-cleped us. & þerfore ȝif þe womman knoweþ þat heo schal safen hure housbonde, oþer þe man knoweþ þat he schal safen his wyf: ryȝt as God haþ departed to eferych man, & as God haþ y-cleped eferich man, so walke he as y teche in alle churches. He þat is circum|sidid
& is y-cleped, ne brynge he noȝt to þe prepucye. & he þat is y-cleped in þe prepucye, ne be he noȝt y-circumsydid. For circumscycyoun is noȝt, ne þe prepucye nouþer; bote þe kepynges of þe comaundementis of God. & eferiche man in þe clepynge þat he is ycleped, duelle he stille to-fore God. Ȝif þou art a serfaunt þat art y-cleped, ne charge þou noȝt; but ȝif þou myȝt be mad fre, vse it þe more. For he þat is y-cleped in oure Lord, he is oure lordes serfaunt & is freman; also he þat is a fre man & y-cleped, he is Cristis serfaunt. Ȝe beþ y-boȝt þorowȝ prys; ne wilne ȝe noȝt to ben y-mad mennes serfauntes. & eferiche man in þat þing þat he is y-cleped broþer, in þat dwelle he stille to-fore God. Of maydenes y ne hafe non commaundement: bote a counseyl ych ȝefe as he þat haþ y-had mercy of God, þat y be trewe. For y trowe þat it be good for þe nede þat is nouþe, & þat it is good to a man for-to be so. Bote ȝif þou art y-bounden to þi wyf, ne seche þou noȝt to ben vnbounden. Ȝif þou art vnbounden, ne wilne þou noȝt to sechen a wyf. & ȝif þou takest þe a wyf, þou ne synnest noȝt; & ȝif a mayde be y-wedded, heo ne synneþ nouþer. Naþeles suche schulleþ haue tribulacyoun of hure flesch: bote y spare ȝow. & bryþeren, y sey to ȝow þese þinges, tyme is schort; an oþer is, þilke þat habbeþ wyfes, ben þei, as þouȝ þei ne hadden none wyfes; & þilke þat wepeþ, as þilke þat wepeþ noȝt; & þilke þat ioyeþ, as þilkeAfter þilke erasure of four letters. An e in the margin, S. þat ioyeþ noȝt; & þilke þat buggeþ, as þilke þat oweþ no þing; & þilke þat vseþ þis worlde, as þauȝ þei ne vsed it noȝt: for þe fygure of þis worlde passeþ forþ. & ych wole þat ȝe ben wiþ-outen bysynesse of þe worlde. He þat haþ no wyf þenkeþ whuche þinges beþ of God, &om. P. how he schal plese GodGod but...schal plese inserted later, P.: but he þat haþ a wyf is bisy aboute þinges þat beþ of þe worlde, & how he schal pleseGod but...schal plese inserted later, P. his wyf, & so he is departed. & a womman þat is a mayden & vn|wedded þinkeþ whuche þinges beþ of God, & þat heo be holy in body & in spiryt: but heo þat is y-wedded þynkeþ þinges þat beþ of þe worlde, & how heo schal plesen hure housbonde.
But þese þinges y sey to ȝow for ȝoure profyte; noȝt þat y þrowe to ȝow a gren, but for þat þing þat is honest, & þat itȝe P. ȝefe ȝow myȝt to knowe wiþ-outen lattynge to bysechen oure Lord. & he þat troweþ þat me holdeþ hym an efel man for his mayde, þat heoheo in the margin with caret to mark insertion, S. ȝe P. is ouer-waxe, & it mote be so: þat he haþ wylle to don do he; for þouȝ he be wedded, heo ne synneþ noȝt. & he þat haþ sadlyche y-stabled in his herte, noȝt hafynge nede, but power of his wylle, & haþ y-demed in his herte to kepenFirst e inserted above the line, S. his mayde, he doþ wel. & he þat maryeþ his mayde doþ wel also; & he doþ betere þat maryeþ hure noȝt. Also longe as a wommannes housbonde lyfeþ, heoȝe P. is y-bounde to þe lawe; bote ȝif hure housbonde dye, heoȝe P. is delyfered from þe lawe of hure housbonde: be heo y-wedded to whom heoȝe P. wole, bote onlyche in God. Bote heoȝhe P. is muche more betere ȝef heoȝhe P. dwelle stille so, aftur my counseyl: & y trowe þat ych haue þe Spiryt of God.

,Befini C vii; C x in the margin, P. ȝe my foleweres, as ych am Cristis folewere. And my bryþeren, y preysepreye P. ȝow, for in alle þinges ȝe hafeþ mynde of me; & riȝt so as ych ȝefe ȝou my comaundementis, so ȝe holdeþ hem. And ych wole þat ȝe knowen, þat þe hed of eferych womman is a man; & þe hed of eferich man is Crist; & þe hed of Crist is God. Eferich man þat preyeþ oþer prophecyeþ wiþ a kefered hed, he defouleþ his hed. Bote eferech womman þat preyeþ oþer prophecyeþ wiþ hedþe hed P. vn|heled, defouleþ hure hed: for it is al on as þouȝ heit P. were balled. For ȝif a womman be noȝt y-kefered, be heo y-dodded: & ȝif it be foul for a womman to ben y-dodded oþer balled, wrye heo hure hed. But a man ne schal noȝt wrye his hed, for he is þe ymage & þe ioye of God: & þe womman is þe ioye of a man. For þe man ne is noȝt of womman, bote þe womman is of man: for man ne is noȝt y-mad for þe womman, bote þe womman for þe man: & þerfore þe womman schal haue an helyng on hure hed, for angeles. Naþeles nouþer man wiþ-oute womman, ne womman
wiþ-outen man in oure Lord. For riȝt as womman is man, riȝt so man is þorowȝ womman; & alle þei beþ of God. Deme ȝe ȝow-selfe: wheþer it byseme a womman vnkefered to preyen to God? Þe kynde of hem techeþ ȝow: & ȝif a man norsche his her, it is schenschype to hym; bote ȝif a womman norsche hure her, it is worschupe for hure: for heres beþ y-ȝeuen to hure for hure keferynge. And ȝif þer be any of ȝow a stryfer, we ne hafeþ no suche custom, ne Goddes churche nouþer. & þese þinges y bydde ȝow, noȝt preysyngein pr. P., þat ȝe comeþ to-gedere in þe churche. Ich heere þat þer be dissensyones a-mong ȝow, and a party y trowe it. For it byhofeþ þat þer ben heresyes a-mong ȝow, þat þilke þat beþ apprefed men a-mong ȝow ben openlyche y-schewed. And þerfore whan ȝe comeþ to-gedere in-to on, now it falleþ noȝt for ȝow to eten oure Lordes sopersakerment added in the margin, 1st corr. S.: for eferich man takeþ byfore his soper for-to eten; & on is an-hungred, & an|oþerom. P. is dronken. Wheþer ȝe ne hafeþ none houses to eten in & drynken in& P.? oþer ȝe dispiseþ Godes churche, & schendeþ þilke þat haueþ none houses? What schal ich seye to ȝow? Ich preyse ȝow, bote in þis ich preyse ȝow noȝt. And ich hafe vnderfongen of oure Lord þat ich hafe y-take to ȝow: for oure Lord Iesus in þat nyȝt þat he was y-takenota in the margin; toke bred; & dude þankynges to God, & brake it, & seyde, Take ȝe, & ete ȝe: þis is my body þat schal be take for ȝou: makeþ þis in mynde of me. Also aftur þat he had soupedy souped P. he toke þe cuppe, & seyde, Þis cuppe is a newe testament in my blod: makeþ þis, as ofte as ȝe drynkeþ, in mynde of me. For as ofte syþes as ȝe eteþ þis bred, & drynkeþ þis cuppe, ȝe schulen schewen þe deþ of oure Lord fortotyl P. þat he come. & so who-euere þat eteþ þis bred or drynkeþ þe cuppe of oure Lord vnworþylychevn inserted above the line, S., he schal be gulty of oure Lordes body & his blood. And þerfore prefe a man hym-selfe, & so ete he of þis bred, & drynke he of þis cuppe. For heom. P. þat eteþ & drynkeþ vnworþiliche, eteþ & drynkeþ dom to hym|selfe, noȝt demynge oure Lordes body. & among ȝow þer
beþ many seke & many febel, & many beþ aslepe. & ȝif we demen ous-selfe, þanne ne schulde we noȝt ben y-demed. But whyles þat we beþ y-demed of oure Lord, we beþ a-mendyd, þat we ne be noȝt y-dampned wiþ þis world. And þerfore, breþeren, whan ȝe comeþ for-to eten, abyde ȝe to|gydere eferichone oþer. & ȝif þat any man be an-hungred, ete he at home, þat ȝe ne come noȝt to-gedere in-to dom. Oþer þinges y wole ordeyne whanne þat y come my-selfen.

Of spirytual þinges, my breþeren, y ne wole noȝt þat ȝe ben vnknowynge. For ȝe wyteþ wel þat whylys ȝe weren mysbyleued, as ȝee weren y-lad, ȝe wenten to dombe maw|metes. And þerfore y certefye ȝow, þat no man spekynge in þe spiryt of God seiþ, A-cursed Iesu; & no man may seye, Oure Lord Iesus, bote it be in þe Holy Spiryt. And þer ben dyuerse graces, bote it is al on Spiryt. And þer ben dyuerse seruynges, bote it is al on Lord. And þer ben dyuerse manere werchynges, bote it is on God, þat worcheþ alle þinges in alle þinges. & to eferich man þer is y-graunted a schewynge of þe spiryt to profyte. To on manto on man repeated in the margin, 1st corr. Below it peuyte in a XVIth century hand, S. þer is y-graunted speche of wysdom þoroȝ þe Spiryt; to anoþer man speche of kunnynge þoroȝ þe same Spiryt; to anoþer man feiþ in þe same Spiryt; to an-oþer man grace of helynge men; to an-oþer man werchynge of vertues; to an-oþer pro|phecye; to an-oþer discrecyoun of spirytes: to an-oþer dyuerse kyndes of langages; to an-oþer interpretacyoun of wordis: and alle þese þinges wercheþ on Spiryt, departynge to dyuerse men as he wole hym-self. And ryȝt as þe body is on, & haþ many membres, & þouȝ þe membres ben many, ȝit þei beþ alle on body; riȝt so Crist. For in on spiryt alle we beþ y-baptyzed into on body, boþe Iewes & oþer Gentyles, and serfauntes & freo men: & alle we haueþ y-drunke of on Spiryt. & þe body ne is noȝt for on membre, bote many membres. & ȝif þe fot seiþ, Y ne am noȝt þe hond, y ne am noȝt of þe body; ȝet he is ner-þe-latere of þe body. & ȝif þe ere seiþ, For y ne am noȝt þe yȝe, y ne am noȝt of þe body; he ne is nefer-þe|latere of þe body. Ȝef al þe body were yȝe, where were þe
herynge? & ȝif al were herynge, where were smellynge? Bote now God haþ y-set þe membres eferychone of hem in þe body, as he wole hym-selfen. & ȝif alle þe membres weren on membre, where were þe body? Bote now þe membres beþ many, bote þe body ne is but on. And þe yȝe ne may not seye to þe hond, Me nedeþ noȝt þyne workus: ne þe hed to þe feet, Ȝe ne beþ noȝt nedeful to me. Bote þilke membres of þe body þat semeþ most febel, þeiþat P. beþ most nedful: & þilke membres þat semeþ us most vnnobel of þe body, aboute hem we doþ most worschupe; & þilke membres þat beþ most in|honest, to hem we doþ most honestee; for oure honeste membres ne haueþ nede of no þing: bote God haþ y-tempred þe body, ȝefynge to hym þat fayled ouȝt þe more worschupe; þat þer be no debate in þe body, bote þatom. P. alle þe membres ben bysy eferichone for oþer. And ȝif any membre suffre any þing, suffren alle þe membres to-gedere; oþer ȝif on membre ioye, ioyen alle þe membres to-gedere. & ȝe beþ Cristis body, & membres of a membre. And God haþ y-put in his churche, furst sum men aposteles, in þe secunde place prophetes, in& in P. þe þridde techeres, seþþe vertues, seþþe graces of helynge men, helpynges, gouernynges, dyuerse kyndes of langages, interpre|tacyons of wordys. Wheþer alle ben aposteles? oþer alle prophetes? oþer alle techeres? oþer alle vertues? wheþer alle men han grace to hele men? wheþer alle men speken dyuerse langages? wheþer alle men maken interpretacyoun of wordys? Folewe ȝe þe betre ȝiftes of grace. & ȝit y wole schewe ȝow a more excellent weye.

ȜefThe rubric in P is a Z. þat y speke wiþ mennes tunges oþer wiþ aungeles tunges, & y ne hafe noȝt charytecharyte repeated in the margin, 1st corr. S., y am y-mad as bras þat souneþ, oþer a cymbal þat souneþ. & ȝef y haue eueriche prophecye, and knowe alle pryuetees, & ȝif y haue euery cunnynge & euery feiþ, so þat y mowe mefen hulles from hure places, ȝif y ne hafe no charite, y ne am noȝt. And ȝif y dele al my catel in-to pore mennes lyflode, & ȝefe my body to brenne, & y ne hafe no charite, it profyteþ me no þing.
Charite is pacyent & benygne; charite ne hateþ no man, ne doþ not wykkedlyche, ne is not y-blowe wiþ pruyde; he neom. P. is not coueytous, he ne secheþ noȝt his owne þinges, he ne is noȝt y-wraþþed, he ne þenkeþ non yuel, ne ioyeþ noȝt up-on wykkednesse, bote ioyeþ to trewþe; alle þinges he suffreþ, alle þinges he byleueþ, alle þinges he hopeþ, alle þinges he abydeþ. Charite ne falleþ nefer a-wey: wheþer þat pro|phecyes schuleþ ben voydyd a-wey, oþer langages schulen cessen, oþer cunnynge schal be destroyed. For a party we knoweþ, & a party we prophecyeþ. Bote whanne þat comeþ þat is parfyt, þanne it schal ben voyded þat þinge þat ne is bote a party. Whan y was a lytel chylde, I spak as a lytel chyld, & y þouȝte as a lytel child, & y safered as a lytel chyld: bote whenne y was man, y voyded a-wey þilke þinges þat weren of childhode. We seþ now þorowȝ a myrour in derk|nesse, bote þanne we schulen sen facé to face. Now y knowe a partye, bote þanne y schal knowe ryȝt as y am y-knowe my-selfe. & now dwelleþ þes þinges, feiþ, hope, & charite; bote þe grettest of þese is charyte.

AndNo heading in the MSS., breþeren, helpynge ȝow we bysecheþ þat ȝe ne resceyfeþ noȝt þe grace of God in veyn; for he haþ y-sayd, In an acceptabel tyme y haue y-herdy om. P. þe, & in þe day of hele y haue y-holpey om. P. þe; and lo, now is an acceptabel tyme, and a day of hele. & ȝefe ȝe non offencyoun to no man, þat ȝoure seruyse ne be not y-blamed; bote in alle þinges ȝefe we ous|seluen as Goddes serfauntes, in myche pacyence, in tribu|lacyones, in nedyschepe, in angwysch, in woundynges, in prisonynges, in bytrayynges, in wakynges, in trauayles, in fastynges, in chastyte, in kunnynge, in longe abydynge, in softnesse, in þe Holy Gost, in charite noȝt y-feyned, in word of trewþe, in þe uertu of God; þorouȝ þe armer of riȝtfulnesse on þe riȝtsyde & on þe lyftsyde, þoroȝ worschupe & vnnobel|nesse, þoroȝ diffamynge & good loos; as gylores, bote as men
þat beþ trewe; & þouȝ ȝe ben y-knowe, ȝet be ȝe as þilke þat beþ vnknowe; as þilke þat dyeþ, & lo, we lyfeþ; as þilke þat beþ y-chasted, & nouȝt y-slawe; as þilke þat beþ drery, bote efermore ioyenge; as þilke þat beþ nedy, bote makyng many men ryche; as þilke þat hafeþ noȝt, bote oweþ alle þinges. Oure mouþ is opned to ȝow, ȝe Corynthes, oure herte is y-drawen a-brood. Ne be ȝe noȝt y-angwysched in ous, bote be ȝe y-angwysched in ȝoure owne in-wardnesse. & hafynge þe same remuneracyoun, as to my chyldren y seye, Be ȝe y-drawen abrood. Ne lede ȝe no ȝok wiþ mysbylefed men: for what a-cord is þer bytwene riȝtfulnessean e in the margin, S. & wykkednesse? oþer what felowschupe bytwene lyȝt & derknesse? Oþer what a-cord by-twene Crist & þe defel? oþer what party haþ a welbyleued man wiþ a mysbyleued man? Oþer what assent bytwene þe temple of God & wiþ mawmetes? For ȝe beþ þe temple of lyfynge God; as God seiþ hym-selfen, Y wole dwellen in hem, & yom. P. wole wonen a-mong hem; & y wole ben hure God, & þei schuleþ be my pepel. Wherfore God seyþ, Goo ȝe a-wey from þe myddel of hem, & be ȝe departyd from hem, & ne touche ȝe non vnclene þing; and y wole resceyue ȝou, & yom. P. wole be ȝoure Fadur, & ȝe schulen be my sones & my douȝteren. Sustur, in þis manere seynt Poule wryteþ to þe Corynthes.

Andad Gal. in the margin, S. to Galathes he wryteþ, & seyþ, Lo, y Poule seye to ȝow, þat ȝef ȝe beþ circumcyded, Crist profyteþ ȝow no þing. For y bere wytnesse eftsones to euerich man þat circumcydeþ hym-selfen, þat heom. P. is dettour to don al þe lawe. & ȝe beþ y-voyded a-wey from Crist, for ȝe þat beþ y-iustyfyed in þe lawe, ȝe beþ y-fallen a-wey from grace. For ȝe ne abydeþ noȝt þe hope of riȝtfulnesse þoroȝ þe spiryt of bylefe. & in Iesu Crist nouþer cyrcumsysyoncyrcumsyoun P. is ouȝt worþ, ne þe pre|pucye nouþer; bote feiþ þat worcheþ by charite. Ȝe ronne wel; who haþ y-lat ȝou nouþe, þat ȝe ne obeyscheþ ȝou noȝt to
þe trewþe? Ne assente ȝe to no man in þis, for þis per|suacyoun (or, euidence)or euidence in the margin, 1st corr. S., or euydence precedes persuacyoun in P. ne is noȝt of hym þat haþ y-cleped ȝow. A lytel sourdouȝ schendeþ al-to-geder a gret pese. Bote y truste in ȝow in oure Lord, þat ȝe ne woleþ safere non oþer þing: bote he þat affrayeþ ȝou schal bere his dom, whyche-efer he be. And breþeren, ȝif yich P. preche ȝit circum|sisyoun, wharto suffre ych ȝet persecucyoun? þanne is þe sclaundur of þe cros y-voyded awey. & wolde God he were y-kut awey þat affrayeþ ȝou þus. My breþeren, ȝe beþ y-cleped in-to fredom; & ne ȝefe ȝe noȝt ȝoure fredom in-to occasyoun of flesch, bote serfe ȝe to-gedere þoroȝ charite of spiryt. For eferich lawe is fulfulled in on word, Þou schalt lofe þiþei P. nexteexpunged, S. neyȝeboure as þi-selfe. & ȝef ȝe byteþ & gnaweþ to-gedere, byseþ ȝou lest ȝe ben y-wasted awey eferichone of oþer. &Dominica xiiii post trinitatem in the margin in a XVIth century hand, S. y sey ȝou in Crist, Walke ȝe in Crist, & ȝe ne schuleþ noȝt fulfylle þe desyres of þe flesch. For þe flesch coueyteþ aȝeyn þe Spiryt, & þe Spiryt a-ȝeyn þe flesch; for þese beþ aduersaryes eferychone to oþer; þat ȝe do noȝt al þat ȝe wolleþ. & ȝif ȝe beþ y-lad þoroȝ þe Spiryt, ȝe beþ not vnder lawe. & þe workes of þi flesch beþ opene, þat beþ fornycacyoun, vnclennesse, in-contynence, seruyse of false goddes, wycche-craftes, enemytees, stryfynges, hatynges, wraþþes, chydynges, debates, sectes, enuyesennoyes P., manslauȝtes, dronkenesse, etynge out of mesure, & oþer þat beþ y-lyche þese, þe whuche y sey ȝow by-fore, as y haue y-seyd ȝow. For þilke þat doþ suche þinges ne schuleþ noȝt hafe þe kyngdom of hefene. Bote þe fruyt of þe Spiryt is charyte, ioye, pees, pacyence, longe abydynge, benyngnyte, goodnesse, mansuetude (þat is, myldene[sse])þat is myldene... in the margin, 1st corr. S. þat is myldenesse follows mansuetude, P., feiþ, softnesse, contynence, chastite; aȝeyn suche þer ne is no lawe. & þilke þat beþ of Crist hafeþ y-crucyfyed hure flesch wiþ vyces and wiþ coueytynges.

,And ȝif we lyfeþ in Spiryt, walke we in Spiryt. Ne be we noȝt y-mad coueytous of veyn glorye, taryynge eferychone
oþer, & hafynge enuye eferichone to oþer.

And breþeren, ȝef any man be y-ocupyed in any trespas, ȝe þat beþ spirytual, enformeþ such a man in þe spiryt of softnesse; byholdynge þi-selfe lest þat þou be y-temptyd. On of ȝow bere oþeres burþenes, & so ȝe schuleþ fulfullen Cristes lawe. For who þat weneþ þat he be any þing, whan þat he ne is noȝt, he bygyleþ hym-selfe. Bote eueryche man prefe his owne werk, & so he schal ioyen in an-oþer man, & noȝt in hym-selfen. For eferych man schal bere his owne burþene. ,And he þat is y-tauȝt, comune he to hym þat techeþ in alle goode þinges. Ne erre ȝe noȝt, for God ne wole noȝt ben y-scorned: for þilke þinges þat a man soweþþt a man soweþ repeated in the margin, 1st corr. S., þilke þinges he schal repen. For he þat soweþ in his flesch, of his flesch he schal repe corrupcyoun; bote he þat soweþ in his spiryt, of his spiryt he schal repe an eferlastynge lyf. And ne fayle we noȝt doynge þing þat is good. And þerfore whyle we haueþ tyme, do we good to alle men, bote most to þilke þat beþ homlyche to þe bylefe. & loke ȝe what manere letteres y wrot to ȝow [wiþ] myn owne hond. Alle þilke þat woleþ plesen in flesch, þei constreyneþ ȝow to ben circumcyded; onlyche for þei ne wolde noȝt suffre þe persecucyoun of Cristis cros. & nouþer þei þat circumcydeþ kepeþ þe lawe; bote þei wolden þat ȝe weren circumcyded, for þei wolden ioyen in ȝoure flesch. Bote God forbede þat y ioye bote in þe cros of oure Lord Iesu Criste in the margin, S., þoroȝ whom þe world is y-crucyfyed to me, & y to þe worlde. For in Iesu Crist nouþer circumsysyoun is ouȝt worþ, ne þe prepucye nouþer, bote a newe creature. & whyche|efer þat han y-folewed þis reule, pees & mercy be on hem & up-on þeom. P. Israel of God. Aftur þis tyme no man be greuous to me: for y bere þe markes of þe woundes of Iesu Crist.

ToHeading: Epheses 4 C in the original scribe's hand, S. þe Epheses, suster, he wryteþ, & sayþ, Y þat am y-bounden in oure Lord, pray ȝou þat ȝe walken worþilyche
in þe clepynge þat ȝe beþ y-cleped, wiþ al humelnesse & man|suetude, wiþ pacyence, berynge up eferichone oþer in charite; & be ȝe bysy to kepe þe vnyte of Spiryt in þe bond of pees. On body, & on spiryt, as ȝe beþ y-cleped in on hope of ȝoure ,clepynge; on Lord, on feiþ, on baptysme, on God & Faderon fader P. of alle þinges, & abofen alle þinges, & by alle þinges, & in ous alle. And to eferich of ȝou is y-graunted grace aftur þe mesure of þe ȝefynge of Crist. Wherfore he seiþ, He þat styeþ up an hyȝ þrowȝ awey wrecchednesse, & ȝef ȝiftes to men. And what is þat, þat he steyȝ up an hyȝ, bote þat he come doun first in-to þe neþer partyes of þe erþe? & he þat com doun is he þat steyȝ up a-bofen alle hefenes to fulfullen alle þinges. & he ordeynede summe men aposteles; & summeThe first two strokes of the second m effaced, S. prophetes; & summe euangelistes; & oþer schepherdes & techeres in-to þe ende of þe worldes; & in-to þe werke of mynystrynge in-to þe buyldynge of þe body of Cryst: fortoTyl P. þat we comen alle to-gedere in vnyte of feiþ, & of þe knowynge of Godes Sone, in-to a parfyt manHeading: Epheses in a late hand throughout, S., in-to þe mesure of þe age of þe fulnesse of Crist. Þat we ne ben noȝt nouþe smale children, fletynge abrood, ne ben noȝt y-boren aboute with eferych wynd of techynge, in þe wykkednesse of men, in gyle, to þe deceyt of errour; bote do we trewþe in charite, & waxe we in hym þoroȝ alle þinges, þat is oure hed, Crist; of whom al þe body is y-knyt to-geder by eferich myȝt of mynystrynge, þoroȝ worchynge in mesure of eferich membre, þat makeþ þe waxynge of þe body in þe buyldynge of hym in charyte. And þerfore y sey ȝow, & wytnesse to ȝow in oure Lord, þat ȝe ne walkeþ noȝt nouþe as mysbylefed men, þat walkeþ in vanyte of hure wyt, hauynge a derke vnderstondynge y-mad darke þoroȝ darknesse, & beþ alyened from þe wey of God, þoroȝ þe vnkunnyngenesse þat is in hem, for þe blyndenesse of hure hertes; and þei dispeyrynge han y-taken hem-selfen to vnclannesse, in worchynge of eferyche vnclannesse in-to couetyse. ,Bote ȝe ne haueþ not so y-lernyd Crist; & ȝif ȝe han y-herd hym, & beþ y-tauȝt in hym, as trewþe is in Iesu:
do ȝe a-wey ȝoure olde conuersacyoun, & þe olde man þat is corrupt þoroȝ þe desyres of errour; & be ȝe renewed in þe spyryt of ȝoure þouȝt, & cloþeþ ȝow wiþ a newe man, þat is y-schape [þ]orouȝP; ȝorouȝ S. God in ryȝtfulnesse & in holynesse of trewþe. Wherfore, do ȝe a-wey lesynge, & speke ȝe trewþe eferych man wiþ his neyȝbore: for we beþ eferychone membres to oþer. Be ȝe wroþ, & ne sunge ȝe noȝt: ne þe sonne go noȝt a-doun vp-on ȝoure wraþþe: ne ȝefe ȝe no stude to þe defel. He þat haþ y-stolen here byfore, ne stele he noȝt nouþe: bote trauayle he more, worchynge wiþ his honden þat þing þat is good, & he haue wher-of to ȝefenȝefen repeated in the margin, 1st corr. S. to hym þat haþ nede. Ne passe þer non euel word out of ȝoure mouþ, bote ȝif þer is any good word to edefyynge of þe feiþ, þat ȝefe grace to hem þat hereþ. & ne sorowe ȝe noȝt þe holy Spiryt of God, in whom ȝe beþ y-marked in þe day of redempcyoun. Eferych bitternesse, & wraþþe, & indygna|cyoun, & cryynge, & blasphemye, be don a-wey from ȝou, & eferyche malice: & be ȝe benygne eferychone to oþer, & mercyful, & forȝefynge eferychone oþer, as God haþ forȝouen ȝou in Crist.

And þerfore be ȝe foloweres of God, as his dereste children; & walke ȝe in lofe, as Crist haþ y-lofed ous, & ȝef hym-selfen for ous, an offrynge & a sacryfyce to God in a swet smellynge of softnesse. And fornycacyoun, ne non oþer vnclannesse, ne couetyse, ne be noȝt y-nemydnemyd on erasure in a later hand, S. y dampned P. Vulg. nominetur. among ȝou, as it bysemeþ noȝt goode men; ne non fylþe, ne folye speche, ne harlotrye, þat ne parteneþ noȝt to þe þing: bote raþere þankynges to God. For þis wyte ȝe wel & vnderstondeþ it, þat eferych lecchourharlotrye repeated in the margin, 1st corr. S., oþer an vnclene man, oþer a coueytous man, þat is þe seruyce of false goddes, ne haþ non erytage in þe kyngdom of Crist & of God. No man bygyle ȝou wiþwiþ in the margin, 1st corr. S. weyn wordes: for herfore þe wraþþe of God com in-to þe children of mys|trust. & þerfore ne be ȝe noȝt y-mad partyneres of hem; for ȝe weren derknesse sumtyme, bote ȝe beþ now lyȝt in
oure Lord; & walke ȝe asa P. children of lyȝt. For þe fruyt of lyȝt is in eferych goodnesse & ryȝtfulnesse & treuþe. & prefe ȝe what þing is wel plesynge to God: & ne comune ȝe noȝt to þe vnfruytfulvnriȝtful P. werkes of darknesse, bote raþere vndernymeþ hem; for þilke þinges þat beþ y-don of hem in prifete it is foul forto speke. & alle þilke þinges þat beþ vndernomen of lyȝt, beþ openliche y-schewed: & al þynge þat is y-schewed openlyche is lyȝt. & þerfore he sayþ, Aryse up, þat slepest, & rysarys P. þou up from deþ, and Crist wole schyne on þe. And þerfore, bryþeren, loke ȝe how wyslyche ȝe walken, noȝt as vnwyse men, bote as wyse men; forbugge ȝe tyme, for þese dayes beþ yuele. & þerfore ne be ȝe noȝt y-maad vn-redy men, bote vnderstondynge whuche be þe wylle of God. And ne be ȝe noȝt y-maad dronken þoroȝ wynhym with the downstroke of the h visible, the rest erased, P., in whom is leccherye, bote be ȝe fulfylled wiþ þe Holy Gost; spekynge to ȝou-selfen in psalmes & in ympnys & in spyrytual songes, syngynge in ȝoure hertes, & doynge þankynges to oure Lord efer more for alle men in þe name of oure Lord Iesu Cryst to God þe Fader; beynge soget eferych man to oþer in þe drede of Crist. Wymmen also ben sogettes to hure hous|bondes as to oure Lord. For a man is þe hed of a womman, as Crist is hed of holy churche, & he is þe safeour of þe body of holy chu[r]che. & ryȝt as holy churche is soget to Crist, so ben wymmenwymmen repeated in the margin, 1st corr. S. sogetes to hire housbondes in alle þinges. And ȝe housbondes, lofe ȝe ȝoure wyfes, as Crist lofedloueþ, P. holy churche, & ȝef hym-self for hure; to maken hure holy, makynge hure clene þoroȝ þe waschynge of water in þe word of lyf, þat he maked hure gloryous to hym-selfen, hafynge no wem, ne non ryfelynge, (þat is, no sen)þt is no sen in the margin, 1st corr. S., ne non suche oþer þing: bote þat he be holy & wiþouten wem. & so men schulleþ lofen hure wyfes ryȝt as hure owne bodyes. & who þat lofeþ his wyf lofeþ hym-selfen: for þer ne is no man þat hateþ his owne flesch; bote norscheþ it & kepeþ it, as Crist doþ holy churche; for we beþ þe membres of his body, of
his flesch, & of his bonys. Wherfore a man schal lefen his fader & his moder, & drawen hym to his wyf; & þei schulleþ ben tweyn in on flesch. Þis sacrament is gret; and y seye in Crist & in holy churche. Þat eferych of ȝou lofe his wyf as hym-selfen, & drede þe wyf hure housbonde.

And, ȝe children, be ȝe buxom to ȝoure eldren: for þat is ryȝtful. Worschupe þi fader & þi moder, þat is on of þe furste comaundementes in þe byheste, þat it be weel to þe, & þat þou be longe lyfynge on þe erþe. And, ȝe faderes, ne stere ȝe noȝt ȝoure children to wraþþe: bote norsche ȝe hem in þe techynge of oure Lord, & amende hem of here defautes. Serfauntesserfauntes repeated in the margin, 1st corr. S., be ȝe boxum to ȝoure fleschlyche lordes, wiþ drede & wiþ quakyng, in sympelnesse of ȝoure herte, ryȝt as to Crist; noȝt serfynge to þe [yȝe], as for-to plesen men, bote as Cristes serfauntes, doyng þe wylle of God wylfullyche, serfynge wiþ a good will as to oure Lord, & noȝt as to men: knowynge þat what good dede any man do, he schal vnder|fongen it of God, wheþerwhere P. he be a serfaunt oþer a fre man. And, ȝe lordes, do ȝe þe same þinges to hem, forȝefynge hem þretynges: knowynge þat boþe ȝoure Lord & hure Lord is in hefene, & þer ne is non vnderfongynge of mennes persones to-fore God. & her-aftur, my breþeren, be ȝe y-comforted in oure Lord & in þe myȝt of his vertu. & casteþ up ȝou þe armer of God, þat ȝe mown stonden aȝeyn þe aspyes of þe defel. For ȝoure wrastlynget inserted in a later hand, S. ne is noȝt a-ȝeyn flesch & blood, bote aȝeyn princes & potestates, a-ȝeyn þe gouernoures of þe worlde of þis darknesse, a-ȝeyn þe spyrytual armer of wykked|nesse in hefnelyche þinges. Wharfore take ȝe þe armer of God, þat ȝeȝ nearly effaced, S. mown aȝeyn-stonde in þe luther day, & þat ȝe mowen stonde parfyt in alle þinges. & þerfore cutteþ up ȝoure lendeshertes precedes in P., & stonde ȝe in trewþe, & cloþeþ ȝou wiþ an haberiounhaberioun repeated in the margin, 1st corr. S. of riȝtfulnesse, & schoyeþ ȝoure fet in greyþynge of þe euangelye of pees; and in al þinge, take ȝe þe scheld of þe feyþ, in þe whuche ȝe mowen quenchen alle þe fuyry
gafelokes & dartes of hym þat is most wykked. & take ȝe to ȝow þe helm of hele, & þe swerd of þe Spiryt, þat is Goddes word: preynge in eferych tyme in spiryt þoroȝ eferych preyere & bysechynge, & wakynge in spiryt in eferich bysynesse, & preynge for alle goode men, & for me þat þer be y-ȝefe to me speche in& P. openynge of my mouþ wiþ trust, to make ȝou knowe þe mystery of þe euangely. For whom y vse wor|schupfulyche my ligacyoni on erasure; byndynge in the margin, 1st corr. S. (byndynge) in þis chayne, so þat in hym y darea in dare blurred, but repeated in the margin with mark of insertion, S. speke, þat y schulde speke. And for þat ȝe schulden y-knowe, how it is wiþ me & what y do, alle þinges Tyte, my derest broþer & a trewe serfaunt in oure Lord, schal make ȝou knowe: whom ich hafe y-sendy om. P. to ȝow for þis enchesoun, þat ȝe knowen how it is wiþ ous to comforte ȝoure hertes. Pees be to oure breþeren, & charite wiþ feiþ of oure God þe Fader & oure Lord Iesu Crist. Þe grace of God be wiþ alle hem þat lofeþ oure Lord Iesu Crist [in] incor|[rup]cyoun& incorec-cyoun with ec-cy in a later hand on erasure, S. om. P. Vulg. in incorruptione.. Amen.

Susteruster half erased. Heading of the chapter: phylypences in the 1st corrector's hand, S., to þe Phylypences he wryteþ in þis wyse, Hafe ȝe worþilyche ȝoure conuersacyoun onlyche after þe gospel of Crist: þat, whanneHeading: Phylypenses in a late hand throughout the epistle, S. ich come & seo ȝou oþer absent yhere of ȝou, þat ȝe stondeþ in on spirit & of on soule trafaylynge to-geder to þe feiþ of þe euangelye; & in no þing be ȝe a-gast of ȝoure aduersaryes: þat is to hem an enchesoun of per|dycyoun, bote to ous of hele, & þis is of God; for it is y-graunted to ȝou, noȝt þat ȝe onlyche byleue in hym bote þat ȝe suffren also for hym: hauynge þe same fyȝtynge þat ȝe han y-seyn in me, [&]in S.P. þat ȝe hereþ now of me.

Andd in and omitted. þerfore ȝif þer be any comfortynge in Crist, oþer eny solace of charyte, oþer eny felawschupe of spiryt, oþer
[e]nyony with on on erasure, S. in-wardnesse of hafynge mercy & reuþe, fulfylle ȝe my ioye, þat ȝe saferen on þing, hauynge on charyte, beynge of on soule, & felynge on þing; no þyng þoroȝ stryfynge, ne þoroȝ veyn glorye, bote in humelnesse deme ȝe eferich man sofereyn to oþer; ne no man byholdynge his owene þinges, bote oþer mennes þinges. And fele ȝe þis þing in ȝou, þat was in Crist Iesu: þe whuche whenne he was efene wiþ God, he ne demed it no rafeyn þat he were euene wiþ God, bote he anentyschedfirst n on erasure, S. hym-selfen, takynge þe forme of a serfaunt, & was y-mady om. P. in þeþe om. P. lykenesse of men, & y-founden in habyt as a man; & he humeled hym-selfe, & was y-mad boxum to þe deþ, ȝe, to þe deþ of þeþe om. P. cros. Wherfore God arered hym up, & grauntede hym a name þat is abofen eferich name; þat in þe name of Iesu eferiche kne be y-bowed, of hefnelyche þinges & of erþelyche þinges and of þynges þat beþ of helle, & eferich tonge knowleche þat oure Lord Iesu Crist is in þe blisse of God þe Fader. And so, my dereste breþeren, as ȝe hafeþ herd byfore, ben boxum noȝt onlyche in my presence bote also in myn absence, so wiþ drede & wiþ quakynge worche ȝe ȝoure owene hele. For God is þat worcheþ in ȝou wilil on erasure, S. & parformynge, for good wil. & alle þinges do ȝe wiþ-outen grucchynges & wiþ-outen doutynges; þat ȝe ben wiþ-outen blame, sympel chyldren of God wiþ-outen reprefe in þe myddel of aom. P. schrewed nacyoun & a wykked, among whom ȝe schyneþ as lanternes in þe worlde, holdynge þe word of lyf to my blysse in þe day of Crist; for y ne hafe noȝt y-ronne in veyn, ne y-trauayled in veyn. & ȝif þat ich be offred abofe þe sacrifyce &in P. þe seruyse of ȝoure feiþ, y ioye, & glade to ȝou alle: & ioye ȝe alle also in þe same þing, and ioye to me.

And þerfore, my dereste breþeren, my ioye & my corone, stonde ȝe so in oure Lord, my lefeste breþeren. & ioye ȝe in oure Lord efermore: & eftsones y seye, Ioye ȝe. Ȝoure soft|nesse be y-knowe to alle men. Oure Lord is nyȝ. Be ȝe no þyng bysy; bote in eferiche preyere & bysechynge, in doynge þankynges, ȝoure axynge ben y-knowe to-fore God. And þe pees of God, þat passeþ eferich wytt, kepe ȝoure hertes & ȝoure vnderstondynges in Iesu Crist. And breþeren, her|after, what-efer þinges þat beþ trewe, & chaste, oþer ryȝtful, oþer holy, oþer worþi to ben y-lofed, oþer of good loos, what|efer vertu, what-efer preysynge of techynge, þese þinges þenke ȝe. [And]in S.P. þilke þat ȝe habbeþ y-lerned & vnderfongen & y-herd & y-seyn in me, þese þinges do ȝe, & God of pees schal be wiþ ȝow.

SusterColocenses in the margin, 1st corrector. Colocenses in a late hand heads the pages throughout; uster nearly erased, S., to þe Colocenses seynt Poule wryteþ & seiþ, From þe day þatþt whan P. we han y-herd of ȝow, we ne cesseþ noȝt for-to preyen & to bysechen God for ȝow, þat ȝeom. P. ben fulfylled wiþ þe knowynge of his wil & eferich wysdom & spirytual vnder|stondynge,, þat ȝe walkeþ worþilyche, plesynge God by alle þinges, & makynge fruyt in eferich good werk, & waxynge in þe knowynge of God in eferich vertu; & y-comforted þoroȝ þe power of his clernesse, in eferich pacyence & longanymyte wiþ ioye; þankynge God þe Fader, þat haþ y-mad ous worþi in-to þe party of þe sort of goode men in lyȝt; þat haþ delyfered ous from þe power of darknesse, & haþ y-broȝt ous in-to þe kyngdom of þe Sone of his lofe; in whom we habbeþ forbuggynge, & forȝefenesse of oure synnes: and he is þe ymage of God þat is in-visybel, & he is þe furste bygeten
sone of eferych creature. For in hym beþ alle þinges y-mad, in hefne & in erþe, boþe þinges þat mowen ben y-seye, & invisybel þinges, wheþer it ben thrones oþerorþer P. lordschypes oþer pryncypatees oþer myȝtes; alle þinges beþ y-maad in hym, & þoroȝ hym; & he is to-foren alle þinges, and alle þinges beþ in hym. & he is hed of þe body, of holy churche: & he is þe bygynnynge, & þe furst bygeten chyld of dede men; þat he holde þe furste dygnyte among alle þinges. For it plesed God þat eferich fulnesse dwelled in hym; & þat alle þinges weren reconcyled by hym to hym-selfen, makynge a pees þoroȝ þe blod of his cros, boþe to þilke þinges þat beþ in erþe, oþer in hefne. And ȝe, whan ȝe weren sumtyme y-alyened & y-mynused in wyt in efel werkes, now he haþ reconsyled ȝow in þe body of his flesch þoroȝ deþþe deþ P., to ȝelde ȝow holy & wiþ-outen wem & wiþ-outen reprefe to-fore hym: so ȝif þat ȝee dwelleþ stylle, y-founded in þe feiþ, stabel and im-mebel from þe hope of þe euangelye þat ȝe han y-herd, þat haþ ben y-preched in alle þe creatures þat beþ vnder hefne; of whuche euangelye y Poule am y-mad mynystre, þat ioye nouþe in my suffrynges for ȝou, & fulfille in my flesch þilke þat wanteþ of þe passyones of Crist for his body, þat is holy churche; of whom ich am y-mad mynystre, after þe dispe[n]sacyoun of God þat is y-graunted to me in ȝow, þat y fulfille þe word of God & þe mysterye þat haþ ben y-hud from worldes & from kynredes. Bote now it is y-schewed to goode men, to whom God wolde y-knowe þe richesse of þe blisse of þis sacrement, þat is Crist, in hem þat weren mysbylefed men, þat is in ȝow hope of blisse: whom we scheweþ, amendynge eferich man, & techynge in eferich wysdom, þat we ȝelden eferich man parfyt in Iesu Crist; in whom y trauayle, fyȝtynge aftur þe worchynge of hym, þat heom. P. worcheþ in me in vertu.

And ich wole þat ȝe wyten what bisynesse ich hafe for ȝow, & for hem þat beþ at Laudycye, & alle þilke þat ne hafeþ noȝt yseye my vysage in flesch; þat hure hertes ben
y-comforted, & þat þei ben enformed in charite, & in alle þe richesses of þe fulnesse of vnderstondynge, in knowynge þe mysterye of God þe Fader of Iesu Crist, in whom beþ alle þe tresoures y-hud of wysdom & of connynge. & þis y seye, þat no man bygyle ȝow in hyȝenesse of wordes. For þouȝ ich be absent from ȝow in body, ich am present wiþ ȝow in spiryt, ioyynge & seynge ȝoure order, & þe sadnesse of ȝoure feiþ þat is in Crist. & þerfore ȝef ȝe han vnderfongen oure Lord Iesu Crist, walke ȝe in hym, y-roted & y-buld in hym, & y-con|fermedy om. P. in þe feiþ, as ȝe han y-lerned, beynge plentefous in doynge þankynges to God. And loke ȝe þat no man bygyle ȝow by prophecye & veyn fallas, aftur mennes tradycyones, after þe elementes of þis worlde, & noȝt after Crist: for in hym dwelleþ eferich fulnesse of þe Godhed bodylyche, & ȝe beþ fulfylled in hym, þat is hed of eferich pryncypate & potestat: in whom ȝe beþ circumsyded þoroȝ circumsyscyoun, þat ne is noȝt y-maad wiþ honden, in spoylynge of þe body of flesch, in þe cyrcumscysyoun of Iesu Crist; ȝe beþ y-buryed to-gedere wiþ hym þoroȝ baptysme, in whom ȝe han a-rysen up from deþ to lyf by þe feiþ of þe worchynge of God, þat a-rered hym upin the margin, S. from deþ to lyfe. And ȝe, whanne ȝe weren dede in ȝoure synnes, & in þe prepucye of ȝoure flesch, he haþ y-mad ȝou lyfe to-gedere wiþ hym, forȝeuenge ȝou ȝoure synnes; & doynge a-wey þe wrytynge of þe decre þat was a-ȝeyn ȝow, & toke it a-wey from ȝow, þat was contrarye to ȝow, hongynge hym on þe cros; and spoylynge principatees & potestates, ladde ofer trustylyche, ofercomynge hem open|lyche in hym-selfenin hym selfen underlined, S.. And þerfore no man deme ȝow in metein mete repeated in the margin, 1st corr. S., ne in drynke, ne in party of þe feste day, oþer of neo-men[y]eneo menþe with o nearly effaced and a cross in the margin to mark error, S. neo mounþe P. Vulg. neomeniæ., oþer of sabotes: þat beþ a schadewe of þinges þat beþ to comen; bote þe body of Crist. No man bygyle ȝow, þat wole walken in þe humelnesse & in þe relygyoun of angeles, þat he ne haþ noȝt y-seyn, þat is veynlyche y-blowe þoroȝ þe wyt of his flesch, & ne halt noȝt þe hed, of whom al
þe body is y-maad & y-wroȝt by [io]yntesmyntes, probably error for iuyntes, S. ioyntes, P. & knuttynges, & groweþ in-to þe wexynge of God. And ȝef ȝe beþ dede wiþ Crist from þe elementes of þis worlde, whar-to deme ȝe ȝet as men þat lyfeþ in þe worlde? Nee in the margin, S. touche ȝe noȝt, ne taste ȝe noȝt, ne trete ȝe noȝt alle þilke þinges, þat beþ by þe pure vse of hem in-to deþ, aftur mennes hestes & hure techynges; þat haueþ þe resoun of wysdom in supersticyoun & in humel|nesse, & noȝt for-to spare þe body, ne in no manere worschupe to hele of þe flesch.

And þerfore ȝef ȝe han a-resen up to-gedere wiþ Crist, secheþ þilke þinges þat beþ abofen, þere as Crist is syttynge in þe ryȝt syde of God. And saferesafere repeated in the margin, 1st corr. S. ȝe þilke þinges þat beþ a-bofen, & noȝt þilke þinges þat beþ up-on þe erþe. For ȝe ben dede, &in P. ȝoure lyf is hud wiþ Crist in God. And when þat Crist appereþ, ȝoure lyf, þanne schulle ȝe appere wiþ hym in blysse. & þerfore mortifye ȝe ȝoure membres þat beþ up-on þe erþe, as fornycacyoun, vnclannesse, lykynge flesch|lyche, efel coueytynge, & coueytyse, þat is seruyse of maw|metes; for whuche þinges þat wraþþe of God com in-to þe children of mys-trust & of vnbylefe; in þe [whuche ȝe also] walkeden sumtyme, whyles þat ȝe lyfeden in hem. Bote do ȝe now a-wey from ȝou alle þinges, wraþþe, indygnacyoun, malyce, blasphemye& bl. P., foule wordes ne passe noȝt forþ out of ȝoure mouþ: ne lye ȝe noȝt to-gedere, bote spoyleþ ȝow of þe olde man wiþ his dedes, & cloþeþ ȝow wiþ a newe man, wiþ hym þat is renewed in þe knowynge of God aftur þe ymage of hym þat haþ y-schaped hym: wher ne is noȝ male & femal, Iew & Gentyl, circumscysyoun & prepucye, vncouþe man & couþ man, bonde man & fre man: bote alle þynges in alle þynges Crist. & þerfore cloþeþ ȝow as holy men & derlynges, þat beþ y-chosen of God, þe inwardnesse of mercy, benygnyte, humelnesse, softnesse, pacyence; supportynge eferich man oþer, & forȝefynge eferich man oþer, ȝif eny man haþ eny playnt aȝeyn eny of ȝou; & riȝt as God haþ forȝeuen ȝou, so do ȝe: and abofen alle þese þinges haue ȝe charite,
þat is a bond of perfeccioun. & þe pees of Crist ioye in ȝoure hertes, in þe whuche pes ȝe beþ y-cleped in on body; & be ȝe kynde. Þe word of Crist dwelle in ȝow in eferich wysdom plenteuouslyche, techynge & warnynge ȝow-selfe in psalmesnota in the margin, S., ympnys & spirytual songes, in grace syngynge in ȝoure hertes to God. And alle þinge what-efer ȝe don, in word oþer in dede, alle þinges do ȝe in þe name of oure Lord Iesu Crist, doyngeo on erasure, S. þankynges to God & to þe Fader þorow hym. And ȝe wymmen, be ȝe sogetes to ȝoure housbondes, as it byhofeþ in oure Lord. And ȝe men, lofe ȝe ȝoure wyfes, & ne be ȝeom. P. not bytter to hem. Chyldren, be ȝe buxom to ȝoure eldren by alle þinges, for þat is plesynge to God. And ȝe fadres, ne stere ȝe noȝt ȝoure chyldren to indyngnacyoun, þat þey ne be noȝt y-maad of smal soule. And ȝe serfauntes, be ȝeom. P. buxom to ȝoure fleschlyche lordes by alle þinges, noȝt serfynge at þe yȝe, as plesynge to men, bote in sympelnesse of herte, dredynge oure Lord: & what-efer ȝe doþ, doþ it wylfullyche, as to oure Lord God, & noȝt to men; knowynge þat of oure Lord ȝe schulleþ vnderfonge a rewardynge of herytage: serfe ȝe to Crist þat is God. For he þat doþ wrong schal receyfen þat he haþ yuel y-don: & þer ne is non vnderfongynge of mennes persones to-fore God.

And ȝe lordes, þat is efene & riȝtful doþ to ȝoure serfauntes, knowynge þat ȝe habbeþ also a Lord in hefene. Andlordes & P. lordes in the margin, 1st corr. S. be ȝe in ȝoure preyeres, & wake ȝe in doynge þankynges to God, preyenge to-gedere & for ous also, þat God opene to ous þe dore of his speche, to speke þe mysterye of Crist, wherfore ich am y-bounde; þat y schewe it openlyche, so as it byhofeþ me for-to speken. Walke ȝe in wysdom to þilke þat beþ wiþ|outen-forþ, forbuggynge þe tyme. And ȝoure word in grace be y-safered wiþ salt, þat ȝe knowen how it byhofeþ ȝow to answeren eferich man. And þilke þinges þat beþ aboute me, Tyte, my broþer schal make ȝow knowe, þat is a trewe serfaunt & serfaunt wiþ me in oure Lord: hym ich haue y-sent to ȝou for þis enchesoun, þat he knowe how it is wiþ ȝou & coumforte ȝoure hertes.
Andtessalonycences in the margin, 1st corr.; repeated as a heading through|out in a late hand, S. to þe Tessalonycences, suster, he writeþ & seiþ,

We þankeþ God efermore for ȝow alle, & we makeþ muynde of ȝou efermore wiþ-outen styntynge, hafynge muynde of þe werk of ȝoure feiþ, & of ȝoureoure, P. trafayle, & of ȝoure charyte, & of ȝoure abydynge, & of ȝoure hope of oure Lord Iesu Crist, to-fore God & oure Fader. And knowe ȝe, my lefe breþeren, ȝoure eleccyoun of God, for oure euangelye ne was noȝt to ȝou onlyche in word, bote in vertu, & in þe holy Spiryt, & in gret plente, as ȝe wyteþ whyche we weren in ȝou for ȝou. And ȝe beþ y-maad foleweres of ous, & of oure Lord, takynge þe word in myche tribulacyoun, wiþ þe ioye of þe holy Spiryt; þat ȝe beþ y-maad forme to alle þilke þat byleueþ in Macedonye & in Achaye. For of ȝou Godes [word]word in a late hand, P. is y-sprongens added above the-line, S. a-brood, noȝt onlyche in Macedonye & in Achaye, bote in-to eferich place ȝoure feiþ þat is in God is y-passed forþ; so þat it is noȝt nedful to speke to ȝou no þing. For þei scheweþ of ous what entre we haden in-to ȝow; & how ȝe beþ y-turned to God fro mawmetes, for-to seruen a verrey God þat lyueþ, & to abyden his Sone from heuene, whom he arered up from deþ to lyf, Iesu, þat haþ delyuered ous from wraþþe þat is to comynge.

And ȝe ȝou|self knoweþ oure entre to ȝou, & þat it ne was noȝt veyn: bote furst we suffreden enuyes & disheses, as ȝe wyteþ wel, among Phylypences, bote we haden trust in oure Lord God to speke to ȝou þe euangelye of God in myche bysynesse. & oure exortacyoun ne was noȝt of errour, ne of vnclannesse, ne in gyle: bote as [we] weren y-prefed by-fore God, & as þe euangelye was y-take to ous, so we spekeþ; noȝt as plesynge to men, bote to God þat prefeþ oure hertes. Ne we weren noȝt in no tyme in speche of flaterynge, as ȝe wyteþ wel, ne inin no P. nota in the margin, S. occasyoun of coueytyse, God is wyttnesse; ne sechyng worschupe of ȝou, ne of non oþer, whan we myȝten haue y-be
chargefulchargeful repeated in the margin, 1st corr. S. to ȝou, as Cristes aposteles. Bote we were y-maad as smale children among ȝou, riȝt as a norysche þat nore|scheþ hure chuldren: so we han desyred ȝou & wolden noȝt onlyche haue y-take to ȝou þe euangelye, bote also oure owne soules, for ȝe weren leuest to ous. Andnota in the margin, S. breþeren, ȝe haueþ mynde of oure trauayl & of oure werynesse: for day & nyȝt we wroȝten, for we ne wolden greue none of ȝow, ne be chariaunt, and precheden to ȝow þe euangelye of God. & ȝe beþ wytnesses, & God also, hou holylyche & ryȝtfullyche and wiþ-outen blame we weren to ȝou þat byleueden, as ȝe wyteþ wel, & preyenge eferichone of ȝou as a fader his chyldren, & comfortynge ȝou, & wytnessed to ȝow, þat ȝe walken worþilyche to God, þat haþ ycleped ȝow in-to his kyngdom & in-to his blisse. & þerfore we þankeþ God wiþ-outen stuntyngestundynge P., for whanne ȝe hadden vnderfongen of ous þe word of þe herynge of God, ȝe vnderfongen it noȝt as mennes word, bote as þe word of God verreylyche, þat worcheþ in ȝou þat han byleued. For breþeren, ȝe beþ y-mad foleweres of Godes churches þat beþ [in] Iudee in Iesu Crist: for ȝe han y-suffred þe same þinges of oure felowchupes, þat þei habbeþ of Iewes; þat slowen IesusJesus...prophetis in late hand on erasure, P. þat is God & þe prophetesJesus... prophetis in late hand on erasure, P. also, & ous þei han purswed, & þei ne pleseþ noȝt God, & to alle men þei beþ aduersaryes: forbedynge ous to speke to mysbylefed men þat þei ben y-saued; þat þei fulfullen efermore hure synnes: for þe wraþþe of God is y-comen on hem to þe ende. And breþeren, we þat ben desolat from ȝou [for a tyme], in m[o]u[þ]many S.P. Vulg. desolati a vobis ad tempus horæ. & in byholdynge, & noȝt in herte, hafeþ muche y-hyȝed to sen ȝoure vysage wiþ muche desyr: & ich wolde haue y-come to ȝou ones & eftsones, bote Sathanas letted me. Whuche is oure hope, oþer oure ioye, oþer þe corone of oure blisse? Ne be ȝe þat noȝt byfore oure Lord Iesu Crist in his comynge? Ȝe beþ oure blysse & oure ioye.

And for we myȝten no lengere abyden, it plesed ous to lyfen al-one at Athenys: & senden to ȝow Tymothe, oure
broþer & Goddes seruaunt in þe euangelye of Crist, to con|ferme ȝow, & to byseche ȝou for ȝoure feiþ; þat noman be y-mefed in þese trybulacyons; for ȝe wyteþ ȝow-selfe þat in þis we beþ y-sett. For whenne we weren wiþ ȝow, we tolden ȝou þis byfore, þat we schulden suffre trybulacyones; as it is y-don, & as ȝe knoweþ. And þerfore y ne abode no lengere, bote sende to knowe ȝoure feiþ, lest he þat tempteþ haue y-tempted ȝou, & oure trauayle be y-mad veyn. Bote now when Tymothe comeþ from ȝou to ous, & telleþ ous ȝoure feiþ & ȝoure charyte, & þat ȝe han good mynde on ous, & þat ȝe wolden sen ous, as we wolden ȝow. & þerfore, breþeren, we beþ ycoumforted in ȝow in al oureȝoure P. nede & al oureȝoure P. trybulacyoun þorȝ ȝoure feiþ: for now we lyfeþ, ȝif þat ȝe stondeþ in oure Lord. & what þankynges mow we ȝelde to God for ȝow in al oure ioye, þat we ioyeþ for ȝow to-foren oure God; preyenge boþe nyȝt & day þat we sen ȝoure vysage, & þat we fulfullen þilke þinges þat lakkeþ to ȝoureoure P. feiþ. Bote God oure Fader, & oure Lord Iesu Crist, dresse oure weye to-ward ȝow: & God multyplye ȝou & encrece ȝoure charyte to-gedere, & to alle men, ryȝt as we beþ in ȝow: to conferme ȝoure hertes wiþ-outen blame in holynesse to-fore God oure Fader, in þe comynge of oure God IesuIesu twice, P. Crist wiþ alle his seyntes.

And þerfore, breþeren, here-after we preyeþ ȝow and bysecheþ ȝou in oure Lord Iesus, þat, ryȝt as ȝe han vnder|fongen of ous how it byhoueþ ȝou to walken & to plesen God, so walke ȝe, þat ȝe wexen more plenteuous. For ȝe knoweþ whyche hestes ich haue ȝeue ȝow þoroȝ oure Lord Iesus. & þis is þe wyl of God, ȝoure holynesse, þat ȝe abstene ȝow from fornycacion; þat eferech man of ȝow connee in the margin, S. owe his vessel in holynesse & in worschupe, noȝt in passyoun of lust as folke þat knoweþ noȝt God; ne no man oferpasse ne bygyle his broþer in chaffarynge: for God is wrachful of alle suche men, as we han y-sayd ȝou herbyfore, & y-wytnessed it to ȝow. For God ne haþ noȝt y-cleped ous in-to vnclannesse, bote in-to holynesse. & þerfore who þat dyspyseþ þese þinges, he
ne dispyseþ noȝt man, bote God, þat haþ y-ȝefen his holy Spiryt in ous. Of charite of breþerhede we ne haueþ no nede to wryte to ȝou: for of God ȝe han y-lerned ȝow-selfe, how ȝe schulen l[o]uelyue S.P. nota in the margin, S. to-gedere; for [ȝe doþ] þat to alle ȝowre breþeren in al Macedonye. Bote, breþeren, we preyeþ ȝowVulg. Rogamus autem vos fratres ut abundetis magis., þat ȝe ben aboute to ben in reste, & þat ȝe don ȝoure werk, & worchen wiþ ȝoure hondes, as we han y-bede ȝou & y-sayd ȝow her-byfore; þat ȝe walken honestlyche to hem þat ben wiþ-outen-forþ, desyrynge no þing of no mannes. Bote, breþeren, we ne woleþ noȝt þat ȝe ben vnkunnynge of hem þat beþ slepynge; þat ȝe ben noȝt drery, as oþer men, þat habbeþ non hope. For ȝef we bylefeþ þat Iesu was ded, & þat he rosa ros P. up from deeþ to lyfe, so God schal bryngen þilke þat hafeþ y-sleped by Iesus wiþ hym. For þis we seggeþ in þe word of God, þat we þat lyfeþ & beþ þe resydue in þe comynge of oure Lord, ne schuleþ noȝt gon byforen hem þat han y-slept byfore. For oure Lord in his commaundynge, & in þe voyce of an archaungel, & in þe trompe of God, schal come adown from hefne: & þilke þat beþ dede in Crist schuleþ rysenrisen repeated in the margin, 1st corr. S. up furst: & siþþe we þat lyfeþ, þat beþ y-laft, schulen ben y-rauysched to-gedere wiþ hem in clowdes, to mete with Cryst in þe eyr: & so we schuleþ efermore ben with oure Lord. & þerfore be ȝe y-comforted to-gedere in these wordes.

Bote of þe tymes & of þe momentes, my breþeren, it nedeþ noȝt þat y wryte to ȝou. For ȝe wyteþ ȝou-selfe þat þe day of oure Lord schal come as a þef by nyȝte. Fore in the margin, S. whanne me seiþ þat þer is pees & sekernesse, þanne schal þer come a sodayn deþ, as þe sorowȝ of aom. P. womman þat bereþ a chylde; bote þei ne schuleþ noȝt flen a-wey. Bote, breþeren, ȝe be noȝt in derknesse, þat þilke day take ȝow as a þef: for alle ȝe beþ chyldren of lyȝt, & Goddes chyldren, & ȝe beþ nouþer of nyȝt, ne of darknesse. And þerfore ne slepe we noȝt, as oþer men, bote wake we & be we sober. For þilke
þat slepeþ, þei slepeþ a-nyȝt; & þilke þat beþ dronken, beþ dronken a-nyȝt; bote we þat beþ of þe day, be we sober, and caste we up-on ous an haberioun of feiþ & of charyte, & an helm þat is hope of hele. For God ne haþ noȝt y-put ous in-to wraþþe, bote in-to getynge of hele þoroȝ oure Lord Iesu Crist, þat dyed for ous, þat, wheþer we waken oþer slepen, we lyfen to-gedere wiþ hym. Wherfore be ȝe y-coumforted to God, & eferich man edyfye oþer, as ȝe doþ. And, breþeren, we preyeþ ȝow þat ȝe know hem, þat trauayleþ a-mong ȝow, & beþ abofen ȝou in oure Lord, & warne ȝou, þat ȝe han hem more plenteuouslyche in charite for hure werk; &e in the margin, S. haue ȝe pees wiþ hem. And, breþeren, we preyeþ ȝow þat ȝe a-menden vn-pesyble men, & comforteþ men of smal soule, & vnderfongeþ seke men, & be ȝe pacyent to alle men. & lokeþ þat no man ȝelde to oþer yfel for yfel; bote efermo swe þe þing þat is good, eferich man to oþer, & to alle men. & ioye ,ȝe efermore; & preye ȝe wiþ-oute stuntynge; & in alle þinges do ȝe þankynges to God: for þis is Godes wille in Iesu Crist in& P. alle ous. ,Ne quenche ȝe noȝt þe Spiryt; ne dyspyse ȝe noȝt prophecyes; prefeþ alle þinges, & holdeþ þat þing þatþing þt on erasure, S. is good; & absteneþ ȝou from al yfel. ,& he þat is God of pees halewe ȝou by alle þinges, þat ȝoure spiryt, ȝoure soule, & ȝoure body be y-kept hol wiþ-outen playnt in þe comynge of oure Lord Iesu Crist. & þe trewe God þat haþ y-cleped ȝou, he schal don hyt. Breþeren, preye ȝe for ous.

AndAn P., breþeren, we oweþ to þanke God efermore for ȝou, as it is worþi, for efermore ȝoure feiþ waxeþ, & ȝoure charite waxeþ plenteous of eferichone to oþer; so þat we ous-selfe ioyeþ in ȝou in Goddes churches for ȝoure pacyence & ȝoure feiþ in alle persecucyons and ȝoure tribulacyounes þat ȝe suffreþ, in ensample of þe ryȝtful dom of God; þat ȝe ben y-hady om. P. worþy to þe kyngdom of God, for whom ȝe suffreþ: ȝif it be ryȝtful to-fore God to ȝelde trybulacyoun to þilke þat
anuyeþ ȝou, & to ȝow þat haueþ trybulacyoun, reste wiþ ouse in the margin, S., in þe reualacyoun of oure Lord Iesu Crist from hefne wiþ þe angeles of his vertu, doynge veniaunce in lye of fuyr in hem þat ne haueþ noȝt y-knowe God, [& þat] ne beþ noȝt buxom to þe euangelye of oure Lord Iesu Crist: & þei schulleþ ȝeuen eferlastynge peynes in deþ from þe face of oure Lord & þe blisse of his vertu, whenn þat he comeþ to ben y-gloryfyed in his seyntes, & to ben wondurful in alle þilke þat han byleued, & oure witnesse schal ben y-lefed on ȝou, in þat day. & we preyeþ euermore for ȝou, þat God fouche saaf to clepe ȝou þoroȝ his clepynge, and fulfulle al þe wylle of his goodnesse & þe werk of feyþ in verteu; þat þe name of oure Lord Iesu Crist be y-claryfyed in ȝou, & ȝe wiþ hym þoroȝ þe grace of oure Lord Iesu Crist.

Bute breþeren, we preyeþ ȝou by þe comynge of oure Lord Iesu Crist, & of oure congregacion in-to þe same þing, þat ȝe benne ben P. noȝt sone y-mefed from ȝoure wyt, ne þat ȝe ben noȝt afrayed, as þouȝ þe day of oure Lord were y-come, nouþer by epystel, as þoȝ heo were y-send from ous, ne by spiryt, ne by word; ne no man bygyle ȝou in no manere: for bote ȝif þat þer come dissencyoun furst, & he be y-schewed, þat is man of sunne & child of perdycyoun, þat is aduersary & y-hofen up a-bofen alle þinge þat is y-cleped God oþer heryed, so þat he sytte in þe templetempele repeated in the margin, 1st corr. S. of God, schewynge hym|selfe as þouȝ he were a God. Ne holde ȝe noȝt, þat þese þynges y sayde to ȝou, whyles þat ich was wiþ ȝou? & þat wiþholdeþ now ȝe knoweþ, þat he be y-schewed in his tyme. For he wercheþ now þe mystery of wykkednesse: onlyche þat he þat holdeþ now, holde he, forto hehe altered from be, S. be P. be y-don out of þe myddel. And þanne þilke wykked schal ben y-schewed, whom oure Lord Iesus schal slen wiþ þe spiryt of his mouþ, & schal distroyen hym þoroȝ þe schynynge & þe brytnesse of his comynge; hym, whos comynge is þoroȝ þe worchynge of Sathanas in eferich vertu & sygnes & false wondres, & in eferych bygylynge of wykkednesse to þilke þatþt inserted above the line in a later hand, S. peryscheþ;
for þei ne haueþ noȝt resceyued þe charite of treuþe þat þei weren y-maad saf. & þerfore God schal sende to hem a worchynge of errour, þat þei bylefen to lesynge; & þat alle þei ben y-demed þat bylefeþ noȝt to þe trewþe, bote as|senteden to wykkednesse. Bote we oweþ efermore to þanke God for ȝow, þat beþ y-lofed of God, þat God haþ y-chosen ous þe furste fruyt in-to hele in þeom. P. holynesse of Spiryt & feiþ of trewþe, in þe whuche God haþ y-cleped ȝou by oureȝoure P. euangelye, in getynge of þe blisse of God & of oure Lord Iesu Crist. & þerfore, breþeren, stonde ȝe, & holdeþ þe tradicyones þat ȝe han y-lerned, wheþer it be by word, oþer by oure epistel. And oure Lord Iesu Crist, & God oure Fader þat lofed ous & haþ y-ȝefen ous an eferlastynge com|fort & a good hope in grace, conferme ȝoure hertes in eferich good werk & good word.

And breþeren, her-aftur preyeþ for ous, that Goddes word renne & be y-claryfyed, as it is wiþ ȝou; & þat we ben delyuered from vncofenabel men & wykked; for þe feiþ ne is noȝt of alle men. Bote God is trewe, þat schal conferme ȝow & kepe ȝou from yuel. & we trusteþ in ȝow in God, þat ȝe doþ & schulen don þilke þinges þat we hafeþ y-bede ȝou don. And oure Lord dresse ȝoure hertes in þe charite of God, & in þe pacyence of Crist. And breþeren, we chargeþ ȝou in þe name of oure Lord Iesu Crist, þat ȝe wiþ-drawe ȝou from eferich broþer þat walkeþ in-ordynatlychenota in margin, S., & noȝt after þe tradycyon þat ȝe han vnderfongen of ous. And ȝe ȝouselfen wyteþ hou it byhofeþ ȝou to folewen ous; for we ne were not vnpesybel a-mong ȝow, ne eten noȝt oure bred of no mannes ȝefynge, bote trauayleden & weren wery boþe nyȝt & day, for we ne wolden noȝt chargen no man of ȝou: noȝt as þoȝ we haden y-had no power, bote for we wolden ȝefen ous-selfe forme to ȝou, how ȝe schulden folewen ous. For whyles þat ich was wiþ ȝow, þis y sayde to ȝow, He þat ne wol not trafaylen, ne ete he noȝtete he noȝt repeated in the margin, 1st corr. S.. For we herden þat þer weren summe a-mong ȝowom. P., þat walkeden in reste, worchynge no
þing, bote doynge coryouslyche hure þinges. And we chargeþ suche men & bysecheþ hem in oure Lord Iesu Crist, þat þei worchen in sylence & eten hure bred. Bote breþeren, ne fayle ȝe noȝt wel doynge. And hwoho P. þat ne boweþ noȝt to oure word by þis epystel, marke ȝeȝe inserted above the line, S. hym, & ne medleþ noȝt wiþ hym, þat he be confounded. Bote ne holde hym notin margin, 1st corr. S. as ȝoure enemy, bote amendeþ hym as ȝoure broþer. And Godin margin, 1st corr. S. of pees he graunte ȝou pees in eferich place. And God be wiþ ȝow alle.

AndHebreos in margin, 1st corr.; repeated in a late hand as a heading throughout the epistle, S. to þe children of Israel, suster, he wryteþ & saiþ, God haþ y-spoken in many maneres sumtyme in prophetes to oure fadres, bote al-þer last in þese dayes he haþ y-spoken to ous in his Sone, whom he haþ y-ordeyned to ben eyr of alle þinges, by whom also he made þe worldes; & he is þe brytnesse of his blisse, & þe fygure of his substaunce, berynge alle þinges þoroȝ þe word of his vertu, & makynge þe pur|gacyoun of synnes, he syt on þe ryȝt syde of þe mageste an hyȝ in hefne; so muche y-maad betur þan aungeles, in as muche as he haþ an-heryted a different name to-foren hem. For to whuche of þe aungeles haþ God y-sayd in any tyme, Þou art my Sone, to day ich haue bygete þe? & eftsones, Ich wole be to hym a Fader & he schal be my Sone? And eftsones whan he bryngeþ his furst bygeten sone in-to þe worlde he sayþ, & alle his aungeles heryen hym. & to aungeles he seiþ, He makeþ his aungeles spirytes & þi ser|fauntes lye of þeom. P. fuyr. Bote to þe sone he seyþ, Þi throne, God, is from worlde to worlde; & a ȝerde of equyte þe ȝerde of þi kyngdom. Þou hast y-lofed riȝtfulnesse & y-hated wykkednesse; wher-fore þi God haþ a-noynted þe wiþ oyle of gladnesse to-fore þi felawes. &, Lord, in þeþi P. bygynnynge þou foundedest þe erþe, & hefnes beþ þe werkes of þyn honden:
þei schuleþ perysche, bote þou schalt efermore duelle stylle: & alle þei schuleþ waxen old as cloþinge; & as an helynge þou schalt chaungen hem, & þei schuleþ ben y-chaunged: bote þou art efermore on, & þi ȝeres ne schuleþ noȝt faylenfinem in the margin, in a xvth century hand, S.. Bote to whom of þe aungeles haþ he y-sayd her-byfore, Sitte on my ryȝtsyde, for-to þat y putte þin enemyes a stol vnder þi feet? Ne beþ noȝt alle þe spirites serfauntes, & y-send for-to seruen for hem þat takeþ þe erytage of hele?

And þerfore it byhoueþ ous more largelycher added above the line, S. to kepen þilke þinges þat we han y-h[er]edy hyȝed, S.P. Vulg. audivimus., lest þat we fleten aweylest precedes awey, P.. For ȝif þat word þat was y-maad by aungeles was ferme & stabel, & eferich priuaricacyoun & in-obedyence haþ vnder|fongen a ryȝtful rewardynge to mede; how schule we ascape, ȝef we dyspyseþ þus gret an hele? þe whuche hele, whan it hade y-take a bygynnynge to ben y-told by oure Lord, of hem þat herden in ous heo is confermed, God berynge wyttnesse in sygnes & wondres, & dyuerse vertues & delynges of þe Holy Gost, aftur his owene wylle. And God ne made noȝt þe worlde þat is to comen, of whom we spekeþ, of soget to aungeles. Bote onIon with i added in darker ink, S. on P. wittnesseþ in a place & sayþ, What is man, þat þou hast mynde of hym? oþer mannes sone, þat þou vysytest hym? Þou hast y-mad hym lytel lasse þan aungeles, & þou hast corowned hym wiþ ioye & wiþ wor|schupe, & þou hast y-ordeyned hym up-on þe werkes of þin honden: alle þinges þou hast y-mad soget vnder his fet. & in þat it haþ y-mad alle þinges soget to hym, he ne lefed no þing þat ne was soget to hym. Bote ȝet we ne seþ noȝt alle þinges soget to hym. And we seþ hym þat was y-mad luytel lasse þan aungeles, Iesus, for þe suffrenge of deþ y-corowned wiþ ioye & wiþ worschupe, þat [he þoroȝ]Vulg. ut gratia Dei pro omnibus gustaret mortem. þe grace of God schulde for alle men taste þe deþ. For it bysemed hym, þoroȝ whom beþ alle þinges, & for whom beþ alle þinges, þat ladde wiþ hym many chyldren in-to blisse & was auctor of hure hele, to hafe an ende by passyoun. For he þat haleweþ,
& þei þat beþ y-halewed, alle þei beþ ofom. P. on; for whuche enchesoun he ne is noȝt a-schamed to clepen hem his breþeren, seyenge, Y wol telle þi name to my breþeren, & in þe myddel of þeom. P. churche y wole herye þe. & eftsones, Yy wele haue trust...eftsones added in a later hand, P. wole haue turst in hym. & eftsones, Lo y & my chyldren þat God haþ y-ȝefe me. And þerfore for chyldren han y-comuned to his flesch & his blod, he haþ also y-parted wiþ hem; þat þoroȝ deþ he wole distroyen hym þat hade þe empyre of deþ, þat is, þe defel; & wolde delyueren hem þat in drede of deþ by al hure lyf weren soget to þraldom. For nowȝere he toke aungeles, bote he toke þe sed of Abraham. Wherfore he owed by alle þinges to ben y-lekened to breþeren, þat he were y-mad mercyful & a trewe byschop to-fore God, to forȝefen his pepel hure synnes. For in þat he suffred & was y-temptyd, he is myȝty to helpen þilke þat beþ y-tempted.

Wherfore, ȝe holy breþeren þat beþ partyneres of an hefenlyche clepynge, byholde ȝe þe apostul & þe byschop of ȝoure knowlechynge, Iesus, þat is trewe to hym þat made hym, as Moyses was in al his hous. Bote þes is worþi to muche more worschupe þan Moyses, as muche more as he is worþi þat makeþ an housBous, error for Hous, repeated in the margin, 1st corr. S. þan þe hous. For eferich hous is y-buld of sum man; bote he þat made alle þinges he is God. & Moyses was trewe in al his hous as a serfaunt, in witnesse of þilke þinges þat weren to seyen þer-aftur. Bote Crist is as a sone in his hous; whyche hous we beþ, ȝef it so be þat we holden oure trust & þe ioye of oure hope sadlyche to þe ende. Wherfore þe Holy Spiryt saiþ, To day ȝef ȝee hereþ his voyce, ne harde ȝe noȝt ȝoure hertes, after þe day of temptacyoun, þat ȝoure fadrus temptedene in the margin, S. me in desert, where þei prefeden me and syen my werkes fourty ȝeres. Wherfore ich was wroþ to þis generacyoun, & y seyde, Þese erreþ efermore in hure herte: bote þei knewen noȝt my weyes; & y swor to hem in my wraþþe, þat þei ne schulden noȝt entren in-to my reste. And breþeren, loke ȝe, wheþer
þerþer in the margin, 1st corr. S. be in any of ȝou an efel herte of vnbylefe, to departen ȝou from þe lyfynge God; bote prefeþ ȝou-selfe by eferich day, whyles þat þis day is nempned, wheþer eny of ȝou be y|harded þoroȝ þe fallas of synne: for we beþ y-mad partyneres of Crist, ȝef þat we holdeþ þe bygynnynge of his substaunce to þe ende: whyles it is y-sayd, To day ȝef ȝe hereþ his voys, ne harde ȝe noȝt ȝoure hertes, as þei duden in hure tarrynge. For summe tarreden hym, bote noȝt alle þilke þat comen out of Egypt by Moyses. Bote to whom was he wroþ fourty ȝere? bote to þilke þat synneden, whos careynes weren þrowen a-down in desert. And to whom swor he þat þei schulden noȝt entren in-to his reste, bote to þilke þat weren vnbylefynge? & we seþ þat þei ne myȝte not entren in-to his reste for hure vnbylefynge.

And þerfore drede we, leste þe byheste be y-lafte to entren in-to his reste, leste þer be y-founde any of ous fayle þer-hennesh above the line; second n on erasure, S. þer enne, P.. For it is y-told to ous, as it was to hem; bote þe word þat þei herden ne profyted hem noȝt, for it ne was noȝt y-medled wiþ bylefe. For we þat haueþ bylefed schuleþ entren in-to resteste on erasure, S., as he sayde, As ich haue y-swore in my wraþþe, þei ne schuleþ noȝt entren in-to my reste. And whanne in þe bygynnynge of þe worlde he hade parformed his werkes, he saiþ in on place of þeom. P. sefeþe day in þis wyse, God rested þe sefeþe daygod rested þe sefeþ day repeated in the margin, 1st corr. S. from alle his werkes; & in þis place also, Þei ne schuleþ noȝt entren in-to my reste. And for þat summe entreden in-to þat reste, & þilke þat weren byfore to whom it was y-told, ne entrede noȝt in-to þat reste, þerfore he setteþ a certeyn day, To day, in Dauyd seyenge as it is y-sayd abofen, aftur so muche tyme, To day ȝef ȝe hereþ his voys, ne harde ȝe noȝt ȝoure hertes. And ȝef Iesus hade y-ȝefen hem reste, he ne wolde nefer aftur han y-spoken of þis day. And þerfore þer is y-laft a day of reste to Goddes pepel. For he þat entred in-to his reste, he rested from his werkes, as God dude from his werkes. & þerfore hyȝe we to entren in-to þat reste, þat no man falle in-to þat ensampel of
vnbylefe. For Goddes word is lyfynge, & spedful, & more persynge þan eny two-egged swerd: for he comeþ to þe departynge of þe soule & of þe spiryt, & of þe myndes & of þe maryȝes, & knowere of þoȝtes & of þeom. P. willes of þe herte. & þer ne is no creature invysybel in his syȝt. Bote alle þinges beþ naked & opne to his yen to whom oure speche is. And þerfore we þat haueþ a gret byschop þat haþ y-persed hefnes, Iesu Goddes Sone, holde we þe knowlechynge of oure hope. For we ne haueþ no bischop þat ne may haue com|passyoun to oure infirmytees, þat haþ ben y-tempted by alle Þinges to oure lyknesse wiþ-outen synne. And þerfore go we wiþ trust to þe throne of his grace, þat we han mercy & y-fynden grace in cofenabel help.

For euerych byschop þat is y-taken up of men, he is y-ordeyned for men in þese þinges þat beþ to God: to offren ȝiftes & sacryfyces for oure synnes; þat may sorowen wiþ hem þat beþ vnkunnynge & erreþ, for he hymselfe is enuyroned aboute wiþ infirmyte; and þerfore he is y-holde to offren for hym-self & his synnes, as for þe pepel & hure synnes. Ne no man takeþ worschypeworschype repeated in the margin, S. to hymselfen, bote he þat is y-cleped of God, as Aaron. So Cryst ne claryfyed noȝt hym-selfen, þat he were y-maad a byschop, bote he þat spake to hym & sayde, Þou art my sone, to day ich haue bygete þe.
