As he seiþ in an oþer place, Þou art an euerlastynge prest aftur þe ordre of Melchysedech. & he in þe dayes of his flesch offred preyeres & bysechynges wiþ gret cry & wiþ teres to hym þat myȝte safen hym from deþ, & for his reverence he was y-herd. And ȝet whan he was Goddes sone, he lerned obedyence of þinges þat he suffred; & he þat was y-broȝt to an ende, was y-maad to alle þilke þat boweþ hem to hym a cause of an eferlastynge hele; & of God he was y-cleped a byschop aftur þe order of Melchysedech. Of whom þer is to ous a gret speche þat may noȝt ben expouned, for ȝe beþ y-maad ful febel for-to heren. For þouȝ ȝe oweden to ben maystresy maystres S.P. for tyme, ȝow byhoueþ aȝeynward to ben y-tauȝt whuche beþ þe elementes of þe bygynnynge of Goddes wordes.
And ȝe beþ y-maad so þat ȝou byhofeþ mylkmylk repeated in the margin, 1st corr. S. & no sad mete. For eferich man þat is partener of mylk, he is wiþ-outen part of þe word of ryȝtfulnesse; for he is a smal chyld. Bote sad mete is of parfyt men, of hem þat by costom han hure wyttes y-vsed to discrecyoun of good and of yuel.

Werfore we woleþ senden in a word of þe bygynnynge of Crist, & passen forþ to a more parfyt; noȝt castynge aȝeyn þe foundement of penawnce from dede werkes, & of feiþþe feiþ P. to God, & of baptysmes, & of techynge also of puttynge [in]& S.P. of hondes, & of arysynge aȝeyn of dede men, & of þe eferlastynge dom. & þis we woleþ don, ȝef þat God wole leten us. For it is im-possybele to þilke þat beþ ones y-lyȝted & han y-tasted an hefenlyche ȝefte, & beþ y-made parteneres of þe holy Spiryt, & han y-tasted also þe goode word of God, & þe vertues of þe worlde þat is to comynge, & beþ y-slyde a-ȝeyn, to ben renewed aȝene on erasure, S. to penaunce. For þei crucyfyeþ aȝeyn Goddes sone to hem-seluen, & han hym to a spectakel. For þe erþe þat drynkeþ þe reyn þat falleþ ofte syþes up-on hym, & bryngeþ forþ a cofenabel herbe to þilke men þat heo is y-tyled of, vnderfongeþ blessynge of God: bote ȝef heo bryngeþ forþ breres & þornesbreres þornes repeated in the margin, 1st corr. S., heo is nyȝ cursynge; & þe ende þer-of is to ben y-brand. Bote, my lefeste breþeren, we trusteþ of ȝou beter þinges and neer to hele, þouȝ we speken þus: for God ne is noȝt vnryȝtful, þat he wole forȝeten ȝoureȝ added in a later hand, S. werk & ȝoure lofe þat ȝe han y-schewed in his name: for ȝe han y-mynystred to goode men & ȝet ȝe doþ. & we desyre þat eferich of ȝou schewe oftesyþes þe same bysynesse to fulfullynge of ȝoure hope to þe ende: þat ȝe ben noȝt y-mad slowe, bote foleweres of hem þat by feiþ & pacyence schulleþ an-heryten þe byhestes. For God þat made his byheste to Abraham, for he ne hade no grettour to swere by, he swor by hym-selfe & sayde, Ich wole blesse þe, & ich wole multyplye þe. And so wiþ his longe abydynge he get his byheste. For men swereþ by hym þat is grettur þan þei beþ; & þe
confirmacyoun of þe ende of eferich ple is an oþ. In þe whuche þing God, þat wolde schewen to eyres þe immebelnesse of his conseyl, putte by-twene a gret oþ: þat þorow tweyne im|mebel þinges, in þe whuche it is im-possybel for God to lye, we han þe strengest solas; we þat goþ to-gedere to holde þis forseyd hope, þe whuche we han as a syker & a stabel anker of oure soule, & goynge in-to þe inwardnessein om. P. of þe huydynge; wher Iesus, oure byfore-goere, entred in for ous, y-mad an eferlastynge byschop aftur Melchysedekes ordre.

For þes Melchysedekmelchysedek repeated in the margin, 1st corr. S., kyng of Salem, and a prest of þe heyeste God, þat mette wiþ Abraham whenne he come aȝeyn from þe sleynge of kynges, & blessed hym, to whom Abraham departed þe tenþinges of al his good; & he was furst y-cleped Kyng of ryȝtfulnesse, & afturward Kyng of Salem, þat is, Kyng of pees; wiþ-outen fadur, wiþ-outen moder, wiþ-outen kynrede, nouþer hade [he] bygynnynge of his dayes ne ende of his lyf, bote y-lykned to Goddes Sone, he duelleþ stille an eferlastynge prest. Bote byholdeþ how gret þes is, to& to S.P. whom Abraham ȝef tenþinges þat was on of þe moste worþy patryarkes. For þilke þat weren of þe children of Leui þat vnderfongen presthod haden a comaundement to take tenþinges of þe pepel, after þe lawe of hure owne breþeren, þouȝ þat þei passeden out of Abrahames lendes. Bote he whos generacyoun ne is noȝt y-nombred a-mong hem tok tenþinges of Abraham, & blessed hym þat hade þe re|promyssyones. Bote wiþ-outen any aȝeyn-seyenge þat þing þat is lasse is yblessed of þat þing þat is beter. & here men þat dyeþ takeþ tenþinges; bote þere it is y-wytnessed þat he lyfeþ. And ȝef it mowe be seyd so, by Abraham Leui, þat vnderfong ten-þinges, was y-tenþed; for he was ȝet in his fader lendes, whanne þat Melchysedek mette wiþ hym. And þer-fore ȝef þer hade y-ben an ende by þe presthod of Leui—for vnder þatþe P. presthod þe pepel vnderfong þe lawe—what had it be nedful þat þer hade rysen up an-oþer prest aftur
Melchisedekes order, & noȝt ben y-sayd of þe order of Aaron? For ȝef þe presthode be y-translated, it mot nede ben þat þer be y-mad a translacyoun of þe lawe. For in hym of whom þese þinges beþ y-sayd it is of an-oþer kynrede, of þe whuche kynrede þer ne was non ordeyned to þe auter. For it is open y-knowe þat oure Lord was y-boren of þe kynrede of Iuda; in þe whucheom. P. kynrede Moyses spak no þing of prestes. And ȝet furþer-more it is openlyche y-knowe þat, ȝef þer is a-rysen up an-oþer prest aftur þe lyknesse of Melchysedech, þat ne is noȝt y-mad after þe lawe of þe fleschlyche comaunde|ment, bote aftur þe vertu of a lyf þat may not ben vndon. For he bereþ wytnesse, Þat þou art an eferlastynge prest aftur þe order of Melchisedech. Þanne is þe raþere comaunde|ment reprefed for his infirmyte & his vnprofytabelnesse: for þe lawe brouȝte no man to perfeccyoun. Bote þer is a bryngynge in of a betur hope, by þe whuche we neyȝlacheþ to God. In as muche as it ne is noȝt wiþ-outen a gret oþ—for þe oþer weren y-mad prestes wiþ-outen a gret swerynge bote þes was wiþ a gret swerynge by hym þat sayde to hym, Oure Lord haþ ysworen & it neom. P. schal noȝt a-þinken hym, Þou art an euerlastynge prest—& in so muche Iesu Crist is y-made a byhoter of a beter testement. And þe oþer weren y-mad many prestes, for as muche as þoroȝ deþ þei weren forboden to dwellen efermore stille: bote þes, in þat he dwelleþ efer|more, he haþ an eferlastynge presthode. Wherfore he may efermore safen, neyȝenge by hym-selfen to God, & lyfynge efermore to byseche God for ous. For it by-semed þat oure byschop werewery P. holy, innocent, im-pollut, departed from synful men, & y-mad heyȝer þan hefnes; þat haþ no nede eferich day, as oþer prestes, furst to offren for hure owne gyltes sacryfyces & seþþe for þe pepel: for þat he dude ones, offrynge hym-self. And þe lawe ordeyneþ men to ben prestes, þat habbeþ infyrmyte; bote þe word of þe grete swerynge, þat is aftur þe lawe, ordeyneþ þe sone þat is efermore parfytquod (erasure of two or three letters) peuytt follows in a XVIth century hand; the same name occurs on ff. 67, 69, 71b, 73b, 75b, S..

A chapytre onof P. þilke þinges þat beþ y-sayd: we han suche a byschop, þat sitteþ in þe ryȝtsyde of þe sege of þe Gretnesse of God an hyȝ in hefne, mynyster of seyntes & of þe verrey tabernakel, þat God made, & noȝt man. For eferich byschop is ordeyned to offren ȝeftes & sacryfyces: wherfore it is nedful þat he haue sumwhat forto offren. And þerfore ȝef [he]þer S.P. Vulg. si ergo esset super terram, nec esset sacerdos. were up-on þeom. P. erþe, [he]& þer S.P. neom. P. were no prest, when þer weren þilke þat schulden offre ȝeftes afturof P. þe lawe, þat serfed to þe ensampler & þe schadewe of hefnelyche þinges; as it was y-answerd to Moyses, when he schulde make þe tabernakel, Lokeon erasure, S., God sayde, þat þou make alle þinges as it was y-schewed to þe in þe hul. Bote now þer is y-comen a beter serfynge, by as muche as þe medyatour is of a beter testement, þat is y-halewed in beter byhestes. For ȝef þat raþere hade y-ben wiþ-outen blame, þe place of þe secounde ne schulde noȝt haue ben y-soȝt. Bote God, blamynge hem, saiþ, Lo, dayes comeþ, God saiþ, & ich wole bryngen on þe hous of Israel & on þe hous of Iuda a newe testement; noȝt aftur þat testement þat y made to hure fadres in& S.P. þat day þat y toke hure hond to bryngen hem out of þe lond of Egypt; for þei ne dwelled not stille in myn testement, & y dispysed hem, saiþ God. For þis is þe teste|ment þat ich wole ordeyne to þe hous of Israel aftur þilke dayes, God seiþ, ich wole ȝeue my lawe in hure þouȝt u inserted above the line, S., & ich wole wryte hym in hure hertes; & ich wole ben hure God, & þei schuleþ be my pepel: and eferich man ne schal noȝt seye to his nextenexte expunged, S. neyȝbore, ne to his broþer, Knowe þou God: for alle þei schulleþ knowe me, from þe leste to þeom. P. meste. For ich wole forȝeuen hem hure synnes, & y nul noȝt haue muynde on hem þer-aftur. And in suggynge, A newe, he made þe raþere waxen old. & þat þing þat waxeþ old is nyȝ his dystruccioun.
And þeom. P. raþere hade iustifyenges & an holy seculer.

For þe tabernakel was furst y-mad, in whom þer weren
chaundeleres, & a table, & proposycyon of loues; þat is y-sayd holy þinges. Bote aftur þe veyl þer is þe secounde taber|nakeltabernakel repeated in the margin, 1st corr. S., þat is y-sayd holy þinge of holy þinges, þat haþ a censer of gold, & þe arke of þeom. P. testement wiþ helynge on eferich syde of gold; in þe arke þer is a pot of gold þat is wiþ manna, & Aarones ȝerde þat broȝte forþ bowes, & þe tables of þe testament; & abouen þeseþese twice, P. þinges was Cherubyn of blisse [o]ferschadewyngeefersch. S.P. þe propycyatorye; of whuche it ne is noȝt now to speken of sundrylyche. & whenne alle þese þinges weren þus y-ordeyned, in þe furste tabernakel entred in prestes efermore, doynge þe offyces of sacryfyces. Bote in þe secounde tabernakel þe byschop al-one, ones in þe ȝer, schulde entren in, noȝt wiþ-outen blod, þat he schulde offren for his owene vnkunnyngnesse & þe peples also: & þis sygny|fyeþ þe Holy Spiryt, þat ȝet noȝt holy mennes lyfynge ne was noȝt y-schewed, whiles þe raþer tabernakel hade his stondynge; þe whuche parable is of þe tyme þat is nowþenewe P., by whom ȝeftes and sacrifyces beþ y-offred, þat mowe noȝt maken hym þat serfeþ parfyt in his conscyence, in metes & drynkes & dyuerse waschynges & riȝtfulnesse of þe flesch, þat weren y-ordeyned in-to þe tyme of correccyoun. Bote Crist þat is a byschop of goodes þat beþ to comynge, [in]& S.P. a more large & aom. P. more parfyt tabernakel, noȝt y-mad wiþ honden, þat isom. P. to seyn, noȝt of þis creacyoun, nouþerneyþer P. by gotes blod ne by calfes blod, bote þoroȝ his owne blod he entred in-to holy places þat weren y-founden by an efer|lastynge redempcyoun. For ȝef þat gotes blod oþer boles blod, oþer þe aschenconrē (expunged) in the text with aschen in the margin, probably in the original scribe's hand, S. of a cow-calf y-spreynd on men, haleweþ hem þat beþ defouled to þe clansynge of hure flesch: how muche more schal Cristes blod, þat by þe Holy Gost offred hym-selfe wiþ-outen wem to God, makeschal make, S.P. clene hure con|scyence from dede werkes to serue þe lyuynge God? And þerfore he is a medyatour of a newe testement, þat, þoroȝ þe bysechynge of deþ in forbuggynge of þe preuarycaciones þat
weren vnder þe raþere testement, þei taken a byheste þat beþ y-cleped of an eferlastynge heritage. For þer as is a testa|ment, it is nedful þat þe deþ go bytwene of hym þat oweþ þe testament. For a testement in dede men is y-confermyd: for it a-vayleþ noȝt whyles he lyueþ þat makeþ þe testement. Wherfore þe furste ne was noȝt y-halewed wiþ-oute blod. For whanne þat eferich comaundement of þe lawe was y-rad of Moyses to al þe pepel, he toke gotes blod & calfes blod, wiþ water & red wolle & ysope, & spreynde þe bok & al þe pepel, & sayde, Þis is þe blod of þe testement þat God haþ y-send to ȝow. He spreynde also wiþ blod þe tabernakel & alle þe vesseles þat serfeden þer-to. And almost alle þinges beþ y-mad clene wiþ blod aftur þe lawe, & wiþ-outen schedyngeschendynge P. of blod þer ne is y-mad no remyssyoun. And þerfore it is nedeful þat þe sampleres of hefenlyche þinges ben y-mad clene þoroȝ þese þinges; bote þilke hefenliche þinges [þo]roȝȝroȝ S.P. muche betur þinges þan þese beþ. For Iesu ne entred noȝt in-to holy places y-mad wiþ honden, þat beþ sampleres of verrey places; bote in-to þe self hefne, þat he appere now to þe syȝt of God for ous: and noȝt þat he offre felesyþes hym-selfe, as þe byschop doþ wiþ-ynne holy places, eferich ȝer in an-oþer þinges blod; oþer it hade byhoued hym fele syþes to haue y-suffred from þe bygynnynge of þe worlde. Bote now he apered ones in þe ende of þe worlde to distruccioun of synne by his owne sacrifyce. & riȝt as it was y-ordeyned to men for-to dyen ones & syþþe comen to dom; ryȝt so Crist was y-offred ones to þe clensynge of many mennes synnes, & in þe secounde tyme he schal appere to hem þat abydeþ hym in-to hele.

For þe lawe haþ a schadewe of goodis þat beþ to comynge, & noȝt þat ymage of þinges, [&] eferich ȝer offreþ þe selfe sacrifyces wiþ-outen cessynge, & may noȝt maken hem parfyt þat haueþ accesse to hem. For elles me schulde hafe y-cessyd to offren sacrifyces, for as muche as þe doeres þer-of, ones y-mad clene, ne schulden hafe y-had afturward no conscyence of synne. Bote eferyche ȝer in hem þer is y-mad a muynde of synnes. For it is impossybel for synnes
to ben y-don a-wey þoroȝ gotes blod oþer boles blod. And þerfore whanne he comeþ in-to þe worlde, he saiþ, Þou ne desyredestdesyrest P. noȝt sacryfyce & offrynge, bote þou schapedest to ,me a body; & holocaustesholocaustes, þt is sakerfices brent added in the margin, 1st corrector's hand, S. for synne ne plesede þe noȝt: & þo y sayde, Lo, y come—in þe bygynnynge of þe bok it is y-wryten of me—þat y do þi wille, God. & so suggynge abofe, þat þou ne woldest noȝt sacrifyces & offrynges & holo|caustes for synnes, ne þei weren noȝt plesynge to þe þat beþ y-offred aftur þe lawe, þo yom. P. sayde, Lo, God, ygod y on erasure, S. come þat y do þi wylle. He doþ awey þe raþer, þat he stable þat þat foleweþ. In þe whuche wylle we beþ y-halewed by þe offrynge of þe body of Iesu Crist ones. And eferich prest mot ben eferich day redy mynystryngemynȳstrȳge S. & offrynge fele syþes þe same sacryfyces, þat mowen nefer don awey synnes: bote þes prestþese prest S. þese prestes P., offrynge on sacryfyce for synnes, sytteþ efer|more in þeom. P. ryȝt syde of God, abydynge her-aftur for-to þat his enemyes ben y-sett þe stool of his fet. For þoroȝ on offrynge he made men holy for efer. For þe Holy Gost wytnesseþ þat whanne he saiþ, Þis schal be þe testement þat ich wole make to hem aftur þilke dayes, seiþ God, ich wole ȝeue my lawes in hure hertes, & ich wole wryte hem in hure þoȝtes; & y nul byþenke no more of hure wyckednesse & hure synnes. & þer as is forȝeuenesse of þese, þer is non offrynge for synne. And þerfore, breþeren, we habbeþ a trust in þe entrynge of seyntes in Cristes blod, in þe whuche trust he haþ y-cast to ous a newe weye & a lyfynge þoroȝ þe keferynge, þat is, þoroȝ his flesch; & þoroȝ a gret prest vp-on Godes hous; & come we to hym wiþ a trewe herte in fulnesse of bylefe, & sprenge we oure hertes from an efel conscyence, & wasche we þe body wiþ clene watyr, & holde we þe know|lechynge of oure hope bowynge to no syde; for he is trewe of þat hehe in the margin, S. haþ y-ȝefen ous a byheste. And byholde we to|gedere in sterynge of charyte & of goode werkes, noȝt lefynge oure quyletes, as it is a custom to summe men, bote
comfortynge eferychone oþer; & so muche þe more as we seþ þe day neyȝlechen. For ȝif þat we synneþ wylfullyche after þe vnderfongynge of þe knowleche of trewþe, þer ne is noȝt y-laft a sacrifyce for oure synnes, bote þer is a dredful abydynge of þe dom, & þe sewynge fuyr þat schal consumen þe aduersaryes of Crist. For who þat brekes Moyses lawe, wiþ-outen any mercy, vnder two oþer þre wytnesses, he is y-don to þe deþ; how muche more trewe, ȝef þat hehe in the margin, S. deserfe grettere tormentynges þat defouleþ Godes sone, & defouleþ þe blod of þe testament, in whom he is y-halewed, & doþ wrong to þe Spiryt of grace? For we wyteþ þat he seyde, To me veniaunce, & ich wole ȝelden aȝeyn. & eftsones, For God schal demen his pepel. And þerfore it is dredful to fallen in-to þe hondes of þe lyfynge God. Bote hafe ȝe muynde of þe raþer dayes, in whom ȝe weren y-lyȝted & susteyned a gret batayle of suffrynges; & in anoþer day ȝe weren y-mad a spectakel to reprefes & trybulacyones; & an|oþer day ȝe beþ y-mad felawes of þilke þat han such conuer|sacyoun. For ȝe haden compassyoun of hem þat weren y-bounden, & vnderfongen þe robbynge of ȝoure goodes wiþ ioye, knowynge þat ȝe haden a beter substaunce dwellynge in hefne. Ne lese ȝe noȝt þanne ȝoure trust þat haþ a gret rewardynge. For pacyence is nedful to ȝow þat ȝe don þe wylle of God, þat ȝe bryngen his byheste. And ȝet a lytelytel on erasure, S. whyle, & wiþynne a lytel whyle he þat is to comynge schal come; & my ryȝtful man lyfeþ of bylefe: & ȝef he wiþ-draweþ his fot he ne schal noȝt plesen his soule. Bote we ne beþ noȝt chyldren of wyþdrawynge in-to perdycioun, bote Goddes chyldren in getynge of þe soule.

Bote feiþ is þe substaunce of þinges þat beþ to ben y-hoped, & an argument of þinges þat semeþ noȝt. For in þis olde men han y-had testymonye. Þoroȝ feiþ we vnder|stondeþ þat þe worldes weren y-mad þoroȝ þe word of God, & þat of in-vysybel þinges weren y-mad þinges þat mowen ben y-seye. Þoroȝ feiþ Abel offred a grettere sacrifyce þan
Caym, þoroȝ whuche he hade wytnesse þat he was ryȝtful. For God ber wytnesse to his ȝeftes: & þoroȝ hure he spak when þat he was ded. Þoroȝ feiþ Enoch wasþoroȝ feiþ enoch was saf repeated in the margin, 1st corr. S. translated þat he ne seyȝ noȝt deþ; & he ne was noȝt y-founde, for Godon erasure, S. translated hym: for byforen his translacyoun he hade witnesse þat he plesede God: & wiþ-outen feiþ it is im|possybel for-to plese God: for it byhoueþ þilke þat wolleþ come to God bylefen þat he is, & to þilke þat secheþ hym bysylyche he is y-mad a rewarder. And þoroȝ feiþ Noe vnderfong an answere of þinges þat ne were noȝt y-seye byfore, &, dredynge, he ordeyned hym a schyp to þe hele of his houshold; by whom he dampned þe worlde, & was y-mad eyr of þe ryȝtfulnesse þat is þoroȝ feiþ. And þoroȝ feiþ Abraham, y-cleped, obeysched to gon in-to þe place þat he schulde vnderfongen for erytage; & wente forþ, noȝt knowynge whyder þat he wente. & þoroȝ feiþ he dwelled in þe lond of byheste, as a straunger, wonyng inin þe P. lytel houses, wiþ Ysaac & wiþ Iacob, þat weren eyres wiþ hym of þe same byheste: for he abod a cyte hauynge foundementes, whos werk-men & makere was God. And þoroȝ feiþ Sara þat was bareyne vnderfong vertu in consceyfynge of seed & aȝeyn þe tyme of hure age, for heoȝhe P. bylefed þat he was trewe þat hade by-hoten hure; wherfore of on beþ many y-boren, & aftur þat he was ded, as þe multitude of þe sterres of hefne, & as þe grafel in þe brynke of þe see þat may noȝt ben y-nombred. By feyþ alle þese beþ dede, wiþ-outen vnderfongynge of þe byheste, bote byholdynge a-fer þyn[g]eþynke with nke on erasure, S. þinge P. Vulg. non acceptis repromissionibus, sed a longe eas aspicientes. ofof in the margin, S. byhestes, & saluwynge hem, & knowlechynge þat þei beþ pilgrymes & men herborewed on þe erþe. For þei þat seyen þis sygnyfyeþ þat þei secheþ a contray. & ȝef þei haden y-had muynde of þe contray þat þei wenten out of, þei haden tyme to haue y-turned aȝeyn. Bote now desyreþ a beter, þat is, an hefenlyche contrey. And þerfore God ne is noȝt
y-confoundedy om. P. to ben y-cleped hure God: for he haþ y-ordeyned to hem a cyte. And þoroȝ feiþ Abraham offred Ysaac whan he was y-tempted, & offred his on bygeten sone þat hade vnderfongen þe byheste; for to hym it was y-sayd, In Ysaac þi seed schal ben y-cleped: schewynge þat God is myȝty to areren up men from deþ to lyf. Wherfore he vnderfong hym in a parable. & þoroȝ feiþ of þinges þat weren to comynge, Ysaac blessed Iacob & Esau. & þoroȝ feiþ Iacob dyynge blessed Iosephes chyldren, & honoured þe hyȝschyp of his ȝerde; & þoroȝ feyþ Ioseph dyynge hade muynde of þe passynge forþ of þe chyldren of Israel, & comaunded of his bones. And þoroȝ feiþ Moyses, whanan on erasure, P. he was y-bore, was y-hud þre moneþes of his eldren, for þei seyen þat he was a welfaryng chyld, & dradde noȝt þe kynges comaunde|ment. And þoroȝ feiþ Moyses [was] y-mad gret and forsok þat he was Pharaoes douȝter sone; desyryng more to ben y-peyned wiþ Goddes peple, þan for-to haue temporel murþe of synne; trowynge þe obbroydThe catchwords at the bottom of fol. 72b have obbrayd of S. of Crist grettour rychesse þan þe tresour of Egypcyenes: for he byheld in-to þe remuneracyoun. Þoroȝ feiþ he lefed Egypt, noȝt dredynge þe boldschype of þe kyng; for heom. P. abod hym þat was in-vysybel as þouȝ he seye hym. Þoroȝ feyþ he halewed pask, and þe schedynge of blod, lest he touched hem þat wasted þe furste bygeten þinges of Egipcyenes. And þoroȝ feiþ þei passeden ouer þe Rede See as by druye lond: bote þe Egypcyenes asayeden þat & weren deuoured.

And þoroȝ feiþ menVulg. Fide muri Iericho corruerunt. of Ierycho fullen a-doun þoroȝ þe circuyt of sefen dayes. & þoroȝ feiþ Raab þe hore ne perysched noȝt wiþ oþer þat weren vnbylefed, vnderfongynge þe aspyes wiþ pees. & what schal y seye ȝet? for tyme wole fayle me to telle of Gedeon, Barac, Sampson, Iepte, Dauyd, Samuel & þe prophetes: þat by feiþ ofer-comeneuercomen P. kyngdomes, & wroȝten ryȝtfulnes, & geten repromyssyones, & stoppeden lyones mouþes, & quencheden þe impetuesnesse of fuyr, & dryfen a-wey þe scharpnesse of swerd, & han
y-kefered of seknesse, & han [ben y-] madvp y mad P.; S. has vp (followed by erasure of one letter) mad, the p being altered from b. Vulg. fortes facti sunt. strong in batayle, & han y-turned up þe casteles of straunge men. & wymmen han vnderfongen hure housbondes arysynge aȝeyn from deþ to lyf: but oþer han y-be wiþholden, noȝt underfongynge redempcyoun; for þei wolden y-fynde a beter resureccion: oþer hafeþ assayed dyspysynges & betynges, & prisones & byndynge: & han y-ben y-stoned & to-hewe & y-temptyd, & han y-dyed þoroȝ sleynge of swerd. And summe han y-gon aboute in rouȝ cloþinge of heres, & in gotes skynnes; nedy & a-nuyed & y-angwysched, to whom þe world ne was noȝt worþi; errynge in wyldernesse & in hulles & in dennes & holes of þe erþe. & alle þeseþese þei S.P., prefed þoroȝ wytnessynge of feiþ, ne vnderfongen noȝt þe repromyssyoun: for God ordeyned sum þyng beter for us, þat þei ne schulde noȝt ben y-broȝt to ende wiþ-outen ous.

And þerfore we þat hafeþ so gret a cloud of wytnesses y-putte to ous, do we a-wey from ous eferich charge & synne þat stondeþ abouten ous, & renne we by pacyence to þe fyȝtynge þat is y-purposed to ous, byholdynge in-to þe auctor & þe bryngere to ende of oure feiþ Iesus, þat whenne ioye was y-purposed to hym he suffred þe cros, dispysynge confusyoun, & he sytteþ on þe ryȝt syde of þe sege of God. & þerfore byþinkeþ ȝow on hym þat suffred synful men aȝeyn-seyenge hym, þat ȝe ne ben noȝt y-w[e]ryedy waryed S.P. Vulg. ne fatigemini., faylynge to ȝoure soules. For ȝet now ȝe ne hafeþ noȝt aȝeynstondynge, fyȝtynge aȝeyn synne, to þe schedynge of ȝoure blod. & hafe ȝe forȝeten þe comfort þat God haþ spoken to ous as to his chyldren, seyenge, My chyld, ne dispyse þou noȝt þe techynge of oure Lord, ne be þou noȝt y-weryed whyles þou art y-prefed of hym; for he chasteþ þilke þat he loueþ, & he scoureþ eferych chyld þat he receyfeþ. Abyde ȝe stylle in techynge, for God ȝefeþ hymself to ȝow as to his chyldren; & what chyldchyld repeated in the margin, S. is þere þat þe fader ne chasteþ noȝt? & ȝef ȝe beþ out of techynge, whos partyneres ben ȝe y-mad alle?
þanne be ȝe spousebrekeres & noȝt sones. Furþermore, we haden fadres þat weren techeres of oure flesch, & we wor|schupeden hem: muche more we schulleþ be buxom to þe Fader of spirytes, & we schulleþ lyfen. And þei wiþ-ynne a fewe dayes enformeden ous aftur hure owne wylle; bote þes to þat þing þat is profytabel, in receyfynge his holynesse. Bote eferyche techynge in þis tyme ne semeþ noȝt to ben of ioye, bote of deþ. Bote afterward he schal ȝelde to þilke þat han wel y-lerned þe moste pesful fruyt of ryȝtfulnesse. Wherfore rereþ up ȝoure remysse hondes, & ȝowre knees þat beþ dissolut; & makeþ efene þe goynges to ȝoure fet, þat no man erre haltynge, bote be raþer y-heled. & folewe ȝe pes with alle men, & holynesse wiþouten whom no man schal y-seo God. And loke ȝe, þat no man lakke þe grace of God; ne þat no rote of bytternesse bourgenynge upward latte no man, þoroȝ þe whuche many men ben defouled; ne þat no man beben...man be on erasure, S. a lechour, & wycked as Esau, þat for mete solde his herytage. For wyte ȝe wel, þat whanne he desyred to hafe an-heryted þe blessynge, he was reprefed, for he ne fonde no place of penaunce, þouȝ þat he souȝte it wiþ teres. For ȝe ne beþ noȝt y-come to þe fuyr, þat me may holden & neyȝlechen þer-to, ne to þe whyrlewynd & to tempest, ne to þe sown of a trumpe, ne to þe voys of wordes, whom þilke þat herde excuseden hem-selfe, for þat þe voys ne schulde noȝt ben y-mad to hem: for þey ne beren noȝt þat þat was y-seyd, & ȝef a best hade y-touched þe hul, he schuldehe schulde twice, the first expunged. S. haue ben y-stoned; & so dredful it was þat was y-seye, for Moyses seyde, Ich am a-gast & quakynge for drede. Bote ȝe beþ y-come to þe hul of Syon, & to þe hefenlyche Ierusalem þat is þe cyte of þe lyfynge God, & to þe cumpany of many þousandes of aungeles, & to þe churche of primytyfes þat beþ y-wryten to-gedere in hefenes, & to þe domesman of alle spyrytes & of ryȝtful men & of parfyt men, & to þe medyatour of a newe testement, Iesus, & to þe schedynge of his blod þat spak betere þan Abel. & loke ȝe þat ȝe ne refuse noȝt hym þat spekeþ. For ȝef þei neom. P. a-scaped noȝt, þat refuseden
hym þat spak vp-on þe erþe, muche more we ne schuleþ noȝt, þat turneþ ous a-wey from hym þat spekeþ to ous from hefene: whos voyce meued þe erþe sumtyme: bote he byhoteþ now & seiþ, Ȝet ones, & ich wol meue noȝt onlyche þe erþe bote hefene also. What is þat, þat he seiþ Ones? in& P. þat he declareþ þe translacyoun of mebel þinges, as of þinges þat beþ y-don, þat þey þat beþ im-mebel þinges dwellen stylle. & þerfore we þat vnderfongeþ a kyngdom þat is im-mebel hafeþ a grace, þoroȝ whom we schulen seruen oure God wiþ drede & wiþ reuerence: for oure God is fuyr þat consumeþ.

Þe charite of breþerhede dwelle a-mong ȝow. & ne forȝete ȝe noȝt hospytalite: for þer-þoroȝ sum men han y-plesed aungeles in receyuynge hem to herborewe. & hafe ȝe muynde of hem þat beþ y-bounde, as þouȝ ȝe weren y-bounde ȝow-selfen; & of hem þat trafayleþ, as þouȝ ȝe ȝow-selfen weren duellynge in body. And be þer worschupful wedlak in allein alle in the margin, later hand, S. þinges, & a bed wiþ-outen wem: for God schal deme boþe lecchours & spousbrekeres. And ben ȝoure maneres wiþ-outen couey|tysety om. P., a-payd wiþ present þinges: for God saiþ, Y nul noȝt lefe þe. So þat we mowen seye trustylyche, My lord is myn helpere, & y nul not drede what no man do to me. And hafe ȝe muynde of hem þat beþ y-set to-fore ȝow, þat hafeþ y-spoke to ȝow Goddus word; & byholde ȝe þe yssew of hure conuersacyoun, & folewe ȝe hure feiþ. Iesu Crist was ȝurstay & to day, and he is efermore. Ne be ȝe noȝt y-lad awey with dyuerse techynges & straunge: for it is best þat þe herte be y-stabled in grace; noȝt in metes, þat ne profytedprofyteþ P. noȝt to hem þat walkeden in hem. We han an auter, of whom no men han power forto eten bote þilke þat serfeþ in þe taber|nakel. For of þilke bestes, whos blod is y-boren in-to holy places by þe byschop for synne, hure bodyes beþ y-brent wiþ-outen þe casteles. Wherfore Iesus, for he wolde halewen his pepel þoroȝ his blod, he suffred his passyoun with-outen þe ȝate. & þerfore go we out to hym wiþ-outen þe casteles,
berynge his obbrayd. For we ne hafeþ noȝt here no cyte þat is dwellynge, bote we secheþ on þat is to comen. For þoroȝ hym we offreþ efermore a sacrifyce of heryynge to God, þat is, þe fruyt of þe lyppys þat knowlecheþ to his name. Bote ne forȝete ȝe noȝt of wel doynge & of comunyon, for in syche sacrifices God is y-worschuped. & be ȝe buxom & sogettes to hem þat beþ abofe ȝow: for þei wakeþ as for-to ȝelden acountes for ȝoure soules; þat þei don it wiþ ioye & noȝt wiþ sorowe: for þat ne is noȝt spedful to ȝow. & preyeþ for ous: for we trusteþ þat we han a good conscyence in all þilke þat han good wylle to don wel. & þe more largelyche y preye ȝow þat ȝe don so, in as myche as y schal þe raþere comen aȝeyn to ȝou. & God of pees, þat broȝte out from deþ oure Lord Iesu Crist, a gret schepherde of alle men in þe blod of on eferlastynge testement, ordeyne ȝow in eferich place þat ȝe don his wylle, & do in ȝow þat be plesynge in hym by Iesu Crist; to whom be ioye & blysse worlde wiþ|outen ende. Amen.

Þus, suster, seynt Poule haþ y-tauȝt men for-to lyfen þat byleueþ in Crist in his pystelis. And to Tymothe he wryteþ on pistel, how he schulde hafen hymself in good ensampel to oþer men, & seiþ in þis wyse,

Pouleof follows, P., Iesu Cristes apostelapostestel S. þoroȝ þe comawndynge of God & oure Safyour, & of Iesu Crist oure hope; to Tymothe, my lefe sone in feiþ, be grace, mercy, & pees of God oure Fader Tymothe as heading throughout the epistles, in a late hand, S. & oure Lord Iesu Crist. As y preyde þe þat þou schuldest dwelle stylle at Ephese, whanne þat ich wente in-to Macedonye, þat þou schuldest telle to summe men, þat þei ne tauȝte non oþer wyse, ne toke no kepe to tales, ne to genologyes þat hafeþ non ende, þat meueþ raþer questyonesquestyones repeated in the margin, S.
þan to þe edyfycacyon of God þat is in feiþ. For þe ende of þe comaundement is charite of a clene herte & of a good conscience & of feiþ noȝt [y]-feynedin feyned S. y f. P.: from þe whuche þinges summe men habbeþ y-erred a-wey & beþ y-turned in-to veyn speche, & wolleþ ben doctoures of þe lawe, bote þei ne vnder|stondeþ noȝt what þei spekeþ, ne þe þinges þat þev affermeþ. And we wyteþ wel þat þe lawelawe repeated in the margin, 1st corrector S. is good, who-so vseþ hure lawefullyche, knowynge wel, þat þer ne is no lawe y-set to a ryȝtful man, bote to vnryȝtful men, & to þilke þat ne weleþ noȝt ben sogetes, & to wikked men, & to synful men, & to cursed men, & to men þat beþ defouled, & to men þat sleþ hure fadres & hure moderes, & to men-sleares, & to lecchoures, & to sodomytes, & to gyloures, & to lyeres, & to men þat beþ forswore, & what-efer elles þat þer be, þat be aȝeyn hol techynge of þe euangely of blysse of God þat is y-blessed, þe whuche euangely is y-take to me. And y þonke hym þat haþ y-comforted me in oure Lord Iesu Crist, for þat he sup|posed þat ich was trewe & sette me in his seruyse, þat byfore was a blasphemeblasphemere with re in a later hand, P., & a pursuere, & doynge iniurye to his serfauntes: bote ich haue y-founde þe mercy of God, for vnknowynge y dude it in vnbylefe. Bote þe grace of oure Lord Iesu Crist weswhas P. ofer-plentefous wiþ feiþ & lofe þat is in Iesu Crist. A trewe word & worþy to ben vnderfonge, þat Iesu Crist com in-to þe worlde to safe synful men; of whom ich was on of þe furste: bote þerfore ich had mercy, for þat Iesu Crist wolde furst schewen in me eferych pacyence, to þe informacyon of hem þat schulden lyfen to hym in-to an efer|lastynge lyf. Bote to hym þat is Kyng of worldes, & noȝt dedlyche, & invysybel, þat onlyche is God, be worschype & blysse worldþe w. P. wiþ-outen ende. And þis heste y bytake þe, Tymothe my sone, þat þou ocupye þe after þe prophecyes þat habbeþ y-ben byfore þis tyme, hafynge a good feiþ & aom. P. good conscyence; whom summe men habbeþ y-put a-wey from hem, & han y-had schypbreche aboute þe feiþ: of þe whuche weren
Ymeness later addition, S. & Alysaunder; whom y toke to Sathanas, þat þei lernen þat þei ne blaspheme not God.

And þerfore y byseche þat þer ben furst y-mad of alle men preyerespreyeres repeated in the margin, 1st corr. S., bysechynges, & þankynges to God for alle men; & for kynges & for alle þilke þat beþ y-ordeyned in hyȝschype; þat we han a pesybel lyfynge & an esy in eferich pyte & chastyte. For þis isabove the line, S. good & acceptabel to-fore God oure Safyour, þat wole þat alle men ben y-safed, & þat þei comen to þe knowlechynge of his trewþe. þer is on God, & on medyatour of God & of men, Iesu Crist, þat is a man, þat ȝef hym self redempcyoun for alle men, whos wytnesse is y-confermed in his tymes; in whom ich am y-set a prechour & an apostel, for y seye trewþe & y ne lye noȝt, þat am techere of mysbyleued men in feiþ & in treuþe. And þerfore ich wole þat men preyen in eferich place, lyftynge up clene honden wiþ-outen wraþþe & stryuynge. And wymmen also in a couenabel habyte, wiþ schamfastnesse & sobernesse arayynge hem-selfe, noȝt in heres y-platted, ne wiþ gol[d] oþer margery perlesgol oþer perles repeated in the margin, 1st corr. S. oþer precyous cloþing; but, as it bysemeþ wymmen þat byhoteþ chastyte, by goode werkes. & a wom|man lerne in scylence with alle subieccyon. Bote y ne lete no womman to teche, ne to hafe lordschupe on hure hous|bonde, bote to ben in sylence. For Adam was furst y-mad, & syþen Eue. & Adam ne was noȝt bygyled, bote þe wom|man was bygyled in preuarycacyon: & heoȝe P. schal ben y-safed by bryngynge forþ of children, ȝef þat he dwelle stille in feiþ & lofe & holynesse wiþ eferiche sobernesse.

Aprima ad thimotheum 3o Co heads the chapter in a late XVth century hand, S. trewe word, Who þat desyreþ a byschopryche, he desyreþ a good werk. For it byhoueþ a byschopa byschop repeated in the margin, 1st corr. S. to ben a man wiþ-outen reprefe, & a man ofof in the margin, S. on wif, sober, redy, chaste, hospiteler, a techere; noȝt dronkelew, ne smytere; bote softe & good, none P. stryfer, ne coueytous; bote þat gouerneþ
wel his household; þat þat haþ his children sogettys in eferiche chastyte; & who þat can noȝt rewle wel his owene houshold, how schal he haue þe dylygence of Godes churche? ne þilke þat is late y-baptysed, lest he be hofen up in-to pruyde & falle in-to þe dom of þe defel. For it byhofeþ þat he hafe good witnesse of þilke þat ben wiþouten-forþ, þat he ne falle noȝt in-to obbrayd & in-to þe defeles grun. Dekenesderkenesse expunged with dekeness in marg., 1st corr. S. also ben chaste & noȝt of two tunges, noȝt y-ȝeue to myche wyn, ne suynge foul wynnynge; bote hafynge þe mynystrynge of feiþ in a clene consyence. Bote ben þese first y-prefed, & so mynystren þei wiþouten blame. & summe wymmen also ben chaste, noȝt bakbytynge, sober & feiþful in alle þinges. Dekenes ben of on wyf, þat rewleþ wel hure chyldren & hure houshold. For þilke þat mynystreþ wel schulleþ geten hem-selfen a good degre, & a muche trust in þe feiþ þat is in oure [Lord]oure (crossed through) lord (erased) with Crist written over it in a later hand, S. Iesu Crist. Þese þynges y wryte to ȝowȝow crossed out and þe tymoþe in a late hand in the margin, S., hopynge to come sone to [ȝow]the in a late hand on erasure, S. ȝe P.; & ȝef þat y tarye, þat þou weteþat þou wete inserted in a later hand, the same as above corrections, S. om. P. how þou schalt haue þi conuersacyoun in þe hous of God, þat is Goddes churche þat lyfeþ, & a pyler & a stabelnesse of þe trewþe. And it is openlyche a gret sacrament of pyte, þat haþ ben y-schewed in flesch & y-iustyfyed in spiryt & appered to aungeles & is y-preched a-mong mysbylefed men & is y-lefed in þe world & y-taken vp in blysse.

Butsoþli added in a late hand above the line, S. þe spiryt seiþ openlyche, þat in þe laste dayes þer schulleþ summe fallen awey froin a late hand above the line, S. feiþ, takynge kepe to spirytes ofin a late hand above the line, S. errour & to þe doctrines of fendes, þat in ypocrysye spekeþ lesynges, þat hafeþ a corrupt consyence, & forbedeþ weddynge, & abstenen from metes þat God haþ y-mad to ben vnderfongen of trewe men, þat han y-knowe þe trewþe wyþ þonkynges to God. For eferiche creature of God is good, & þer ne is no þing to ben y-cast awey þat is vnderfongen wiþ
þankynges to God: for it is y-mad holy by Goddes word & by preyere. And proposynge þese þynges to oure breþeren, be þou a good serfaunt of oure Lord Iesu Crist, y-norsched wiþ wordes of þe feiþ, & of þe good doctryne þat þou hast y-folowed. And schunye þou vncouenabel & veyn fables, & excersyse þi-selfe to pyte: for bodylyche excercyse is profytabel to luytel þing; but pyte is profytabel to alle þinges, hafynge a byheste of lyf þat is now, & of lyf þat is to comynge. A trewe word & a worþi to ben accepted. For in þis we trafeyleþ & we beþ y-cursed, for we hopeþ in þe lyfynge God þat is safyour of alle men, bote most of feiþful men. Hote þou þese þinges & teche hem. No man dispyse þy ȝouþe; bote be þou ensampel of feiþful men, in word, in conuersacyoun, in charyte, in feiþ, in chastyte. Forto y come, take hede to redynge, to exortacyoun & to doctryne. Ne be þou noȝt necclygent of þe grace þat is y-ȝefe þe by prophecye wiþ puttynge in of þe honden of presthodþe presthod with hod dotted out, and þe above the line in a later hand, S.. Þese þynges by-þenche þou; & be þou in þese þynges, þat þy profytynge be opene to alle men. Take hede to þi-selfe, & to doctrine. Be bysy in hem, for doyngeo above the line, S. so þou schalt safe þi-selfe & þilke þat y-hereþ þe.

Ne blame þou noȝt hym þat is aldere þan þou, bote byseche hym as þi fader; & ȝonge men as breþeren: olde wymmen as moderes; ȝonge wymmenold men ȝong men ȝonge wymmen repeated in the margin, 1st corr. S. as sustren in alle chastyte. Worschupe wydewes þat beþ trewe wydewes. & ȝef þer be a wedewe þat haþ sones oþer ne[u]ewesne[u]ewes dotted out and cosynes written above in a later hand, S. cosyns P., lerne he furst to gouerne hure owene houshold, & to ȝelden a-ȝeyn to hure eldren for þe goodnesse þat þei han receyfed of hem: for þis is acceptabel to-fore God. And heoȝhe P. þat is a trewe wydewe & desolat, hope heoȝhe P. in God, & be he in hure preyeres & bysechynges nyȝt & day. For heo þat lyfeþ in delyces is deed. & comaunde þou þese þinges, þat þei ben wiþouten reprefe. & who þat haþ no charge of þilke þat beþ of his, & most of þilke þat beþ homlyche wiþ hym, he haþ forsaken his feyþ, & is worse þan a mysbylefed man. A
wydewe be y-chose noȝt lasse þan of syxty wynter, þat haþ y-ben on mannes wyf, & haþ y-had testymonye in goode werkes; ȝef heoȝhe P. haþ wel y-norsched hure children, ȝef heoȝhe P. haþ y-herborewd men, ȝef heoȝhe P. haþ y-wasche goode mennes fet, ȝef heoȝhe P. haþ y-mynystred to þilke þat habbeþ y-suffred trybulacyoun, & ȝef heoȝhe P. hafe y-swed eferych good werk. Bote schonye þou wydewes þat beþ ȝongere: for when þei haueþ y-don leccherye in Cristin Crist follows y weddyd P, in the margin, S., þei w[o]lleþ ben y-weddyd: & hau[eþ]wylliþ be weddid (on erasure) dyd in Crist (expunged) & (half erased) hauing (ing on erasure), S. neleþ nat ben y weddyd P. dampnacyoun, for þei habbeþ y-mad hure furste feiþ veyn. & þei lerneþ to gon to-gedere in ydelnesse, & gon aboute to mennes houses; noȝt onlyche ydel, bote also ful of wordes, and spekynge curyouslyche þinges þat it byhofeþ noȝt for-to speken. And þerfore ich wole þat ȝongere wymmen ben y-weddyd & bryngen forþ children & ben houswyfes, þat þei ȝefen non occasyoun to þe aduersary by enchesoun of efel seyȝenge: for now þer beþ summe y-turned abak aftur Sathanas. And þerfore who þat haþ trewe wydewes, mynystre he to hem, so þat þe churche ne be noȝt y-grefed, & þat heoȝhe P. mowe suffice to þilke þat beþ trewe wydewes. And þilke prestes þat beþ wel abofen oþer men, ben þei y-had worþy to doubel worschupe, & þei most þat traueyleþ in word & in techynge. For holy scripture seyþ, Þou ne schalt noȝt bynde þe mouþ of þe oxe þat tyleþ þi lond. &, A werkman is worþi his mede. & vnderfonge þou non accusasyounusa on erasure, S. occasyoun P. aȝeyn a prest, bote vnder two wytnesses oþer þre. & vnderneme þilke þat synneþ to-foren alle men, þat oþer ben adrad. And y wyt|nesse to-fore God, & to-fore Iesu Crist, & aungelis þat beþ y-chosen, þatþat þou...þou do on erasure, probably different hand, S. þou kepe þese þynges wiþouten lattynge of ony enchesoun, & þat þou do þat þou...þou do on erasure, probably different hand, S. no þing bowynge to þe oþertoþer P. syde. Ne putte þou not þyn honden to no man sone, ne comune þou noȝt to oþer mennes synnes: kepe þi-selfe chaste. Ne drynke þou noȝt water ȝet, but vse þou a lytul wyn for þi stomac & for þi sekenesses þat þou art y-woned to haue. Summe mennes synnes beþ opene, & goynge byfore þe dom; & summe
mennes foleweþ. Also goode werkes beþ opene, & þilke þat beþ oþerwyse ne mowe noȝt ben y-hud.

And alle þilke þat beþ in seruytute, worschypen þei hure lordes [in]& S.P. alle worschupe, leste þe name of God & his doctrine be blasphemed. And þilke þat habbeþ feiþful lordes, ne despyseþ þei noȝt hem, for þei beþ hure breþeren; bote serfen hem þe raþer, þat þei beþ feiþful & y-lofed & partyneres of þe benefys of God. Þese þynges teche þou & stere hem þerto. & ȝef eny man teche oþer-wyse, & assenteþ notin a later hand in the margin, S. om. P. to þe hol wordes of þe doctryne of oure Lord Iesu Crist, & to þe techynge of pyte; he is proudhe is proud repeated in the margin, 1st corr. S., knowynge no þing, bote longynge aboute questyones & stryfynges of wordes, of whom ryseþ up enuyes & stryfynges, blasphemyes, efel suspycyones, fyȝtynges of men þat beþ corrupt in þouȝt & beþ depryfed of trewþe, þat weneþ þat getynge by pyte. ,Bote a ful gret getynge is pyte wiþ suffysaunce: for we broȝten no þing in-to þis world, & it is certayn wiþ-oute doute þat we mowen beren no þing a-wey. Bote hafe we lyflode & what we mowen ben y-wrye wiþ, holde we ous a-payd þerwiþ. For þilke þat wolleþ ben y-mad ryche men, þei falleþ in-to temptacyoun & in-to þe defeles grun & in-to many vnprofytabel desyres & noyfulnyful P., þat drencheþ men in-to deþ & in-to perdycyoun. For þe rote of al efel is couetyse: whom summen hafeþ desyred, & han y-erred from þe feiþ & han y-broȝt hemselfen in-to muche sorewe. Bote þou þat art Goddes man, fleo þese þinges; & folewe þow ryȝtfulnesse & pyte, feiþ, charyte, pacyence, & mansuetude. Fyȝt a good fyȝtynge of þe feiþ, & take þe eferlastynge lyf, in þe whuche þow art y-cleped, & hast y-knowleched a good knowlechynge to-fore many wytnesses. & ich hote þe to-fore God in Iesu Crist, þat makeþ alle þinges lyfen in Iesu Crist, þat ȝef a testymony vnder Pylat of Pounce, a good knowlechynge, þat þow kepe þe comaundement, wiþ-outen wem, vnre|prefabel, in-to þe comynge of oure Lord Iesu Crist: whom he schal schewen in his tyme, þat is y-blessed, and al-onelone P. myȝty,
& Kyng of kynges & Lord of lordes; þat onlyche haþ vn|dedlynesse, & dwelleþ in lyȝt þat no man may come to, ne no man haþ y-seyn, ne may y-sen it nouþ[er]mark of shortening erased, S. nouþer P.; to whom be worschype & blysse & empyre efer wiþ-outen ende. Amen.

And byde þou ryche men of þis worlde, þat þei ne safere noȝt an hyȝ, ne þat þey ne hope noȝt in þe vncertaynte of rychesse, bote in þe lyfynge God, þat graunteþ to ous alle þinges plentefouslyche to vsen, & to don wel, & to ben y-mad ryche in goode werkes, & to ȝefen lyȝtlyche & to comune hure goodes; & to maken tresour & a good foundement her-after, þat þei take an eferlastynge lyf. Tymothe, kepe þat þing þat is y-put to þe, & schonye wykked nofeltees of speches & þe opposynges of þe fals name of connynge, whom þat sum|mensūmē men, P. han by-hote & han y-fallen from þe feiþ. Þe grace of God be wiþ þe. Amen.

And oþer epystel Poule wryteþ to Tymothe, & seiþ, Poule Iesu Cristes apostel by þe wyl of God, after þe byheste of lyf þat is in Iesu Crist, to Tymothe, my dereste sone: Grace, mercy, & pes of God þe Fadur & oure Lord Iesu Crist. And y þanke my God, to whom y serfe in a clene conscyence, þat ich hafe wiþ-outen cessynge mynde of þe in my preyerespreyeres repeated in the margin, 1st corr. S., nyȝt & day desyrynge to sen þe, hafynge þoȝt on þy teres of wepynge, þat y be fulfulled wiþ ioye; byþinkynge on þe feiþ þat is in þe vnfeyned; þat dwelledduelleþ P. furst in þi graundam Loyde, & in þi moder Eurace: & ich am certayn þat it is in þe. For þe whuche enchesoun y warne þe þat þou arere up aȝeyn þe grace of God, þat is in þe by þe puttynge yn of myn honden. For God ne haþ noȝt y-ȝefen ous a spyryt of drede: bote of vertu & of lofe & of sobernesse. And þerfore ne be þou noȝt a-schamed of þe wytnesse of oure Lord Iesu Crist, ne of me þat am y-bounden: bote y trafayle neþeles to þe euangelye, þoroȝ þe vertu of hym þat haþ delyfred ous & haþ
y-cleped ous þoroȝ his holy clepynge; & noȝt after oure werkes, bote after his owne purpos & his grace, þat is y-ȝefe to ous in Iesu Crist byfore þe tyme of worldes þat beþ y-passed, bote now it is y-schewed þoroȝ þe lyȝtynge of Iesu Crist oure Safyour, þat haþ distruyed deþ & y-lyȝtedy om. P. lyf & in-corrupcyoun by þe euangely, in whom ich am y-set prechour, & apostel, & mayster of men þat weren mysbylefed. For þe whuche enchesoun þis y suffre: bote y ne am noȝt confounded; for y wot to whom ich hafe bylefed, & ich am certeyn þat he is myȝty þat tresour þat he haþ y-take me to kepe to kepen hym-selfe in-to þat dayVulg. et certus sum quia potens est depositum meum servare in illum diem.. & hafe þou þe forme of hole wordes þat þou hast y-herd of me, in feiþ & in lofe þat is in Iesu Crist. And þe goode tresour þat is y-ȝefe þe by þe Holy Gost þat dwelleþ in ous, kepe þou. For þow wost wel, þat alle þilke þat weren in Asya beþ y-turned awey from me; of whom weren Phylegeuseg on erasure, S. and Hermogenes. & God hafe mercy on Honesyphores housholdhoushold repeated in the margin, 1st corr. S.: for ofte syþes he re|fresched me, & was noȝt a-schamed of my chayne; & whenne he come to Rome, he soȝte me bysylyche for-to þat he fond me—oure Lord graunte þat he fynde mercy in þat day—and how wel he mynystred to me at Ephese, þow knowest wel y-nowȝ.

And þerfore, my sone, be þou y-comforted in þe grace þat is in Iesu Crist of þilke þinges þat þou hast y-herd of me by many wytnesses, & þese þinges bytake þou to feiþful men, þat mowen also techen oþer men. & trauayle þou as a good knyȝt of Iesu Crist. þer ne is nono man serfiþ god repeated in the margin, 1st corr. S. man serfynge God þat implyeþ hym-selfe to wordlyche doynges, þatbut þat P. he plese hym to whom he haþ y-prefed hym-selfe. For he þat fyȝteþ in batayle ne schal noȝt ben y-crowned, bote ȝif he fyȝte leffullyche. & it byhoueþ þat þe erþe-tylyer þat trauayleþ furst perceyfenperteynen P. of þe fruytes. Vnderstonde what y seye to þe; for God wole ȝefe þe vndurstondynge in allein alle twice, S. þinges. &
haue muynde þat Iesu Crist a-ros up from deþ to lyfe, of þeom. P. seed of Dauyd, aftur myn euangely: in whom y trauayle, for whom ich am y-bounde; bote Goddes word ne is noȝt y-bounde. & þer-fore al þing y suffre for hem þat beþ y-chosen, þat þei ben y-safed þoroȝ þe helehere P. of oure Lord Iesu Crist wiþ an hefnelyche blis. A trew word: Ȝef we beþ dede to-gedere with Crist, we schule lyfen to-gedere wiþ hym: & ȝef we suffreþ, we schulleþ regne to-gedere: & ȝef we for|sakeþ hym, he wole forsaken ous: ȝef we ne bylefeþ noȝt, he duelleþ stille trewe, & he ne may noȝt forsaken hym-selfen. Þese þinges warne þou, witnessynge to-fore God, & ne stryfe þou noȝt in wordes, for þat is profytabel to no þing, bote to turnen hem up þat hereþ. And be bysy to ȝefe þi-selfen y-prefed to God, & a werk-man wiþ-outen schenschyp, tretynge ryȝtlyche þe word of trewþe. And schenye þou boþe wykked speches & veyn speches: for þei profyteþ muche to wykkednesse, & þeom. P. speche of hem crepeþ pryfelyche as a cancre: of whom Phyletphilep P. & Ymene beþ, þat beþ y-fallen a-wey from þe trowþe, seyenge þat þe resurreccyoun of dede men is now y-don; & þei turneþ up þe feiþ of summe men. Bote þe stabel foundement of God stondeþ stylle, hafynge þys marke, Oure Lord haþ y-knowe þilke þat beþ of his: &, Eferich man departeþ hym-selfe fro wykkednesse þat clepeþ þe name of oure Lord. & in a gret hous þer beþ noȝt onlyche vesselesrepeated in the margin, 1st corr. S. of gold & of sylfer, bote also of treotreo expunged with wodde in the margin, later hand, S. & of erþe; and summe beþ to worschupe, & summe to defoul. Bote who þat makeþ hym-self clene from þese, he schal ben a vessel y-halewed in-to worschupe, and profytabel to God, and redy to eferich good werk. & fleo þou þe desyres of ȝouþe, bote folewe þou ryȝtfulnesse, feiþ, charyte, & pes, wiþ þilke þat clepeþ þe name of oure Lord wiþ a clene herte. And schonye þou questyones of foly & þat beþ wiþ-outen techynge, knowynge þat þei bryngeþ forþ stryfynges. And it byhoueþ Godes serfaunt to ben no stryfere, bote good & softe to alle men, habel to ben y-tauȝt, pacyent, & wiþ softnesse amend|ynge
hem þat aȝeynstondeþ þe trewþe; ȝef þat God wole ȝefen hem myȝt for-to knowe þe trewþe, þat þei ascapen from þe defeles grunnes, of whom þei beþ y-holde prysoneres after his wylle.

Andsektys in the margin, 1st corr. S. knowe þou þis, þat in þe laste dayes þer schuleþ ben perylous tymes. For men schulleþ ben lofynge hem|selfen, coueytous and proude, blasphemes, in-obedyent to hure eldren, vnkynde, cursede, wiþ-outen lofe, wiþ-outen pes, blamynge oþer men, incontynent, noȝ[t] muke, with-outen benygnyte, traytoures, fro-ward, swellynge þoroȝ pruyde, loferes of lustes more þan of God; hafynge þe lyknesse of pyte bote forsakynge his vertu: and þese schenyeschonye P. þou. For of þese þer beþ þat perseþ mennes houses, & ledeþ wiþ hem wrecchede wymmen þat beþ y-charged wiþ synnes & y-lad wiþ dyuerse desyres, & efermore þei beþ lernynge, bote þei ne comeþ nefer to þe knowynge of trewþe. And as Ianness on erasure, S. & Mambres aȝenstodenaȝenstonden P. Moyses, so þese aȝeynstondeþ þe trewþe; men þat beþ corrupt in pouȝt, & wykked a-boute þe feiþ. Bote þei ne schuleþ noȝt profyten: for hure vnkun|nyngenesse schal ben openlycheen on erasure, S. y-knowen to alle men, ryȝt as þe oþeres was. Bote þou hast folewed my techynge, myn ordeynynge, & my purpos, feiþ, longanymyte (þat is longabydynge)Thus in P. þt is lonabydege in the margin, 1st corr. S., lofe, pacyence, persecucyones, suffrynges, whyche habbeþ y-ben y-do to me at Anthyoche, at Yconye & at Lystres; whuche persecucyones ich haue y-suffred: bote God haþ defended me of hem alle. And alle þilke þat woleþ lyfen mukelyche in Crist schulleþ suffre persecucyoun. Bote wykkede men & gyloures schulleþ profyten into worse, errynge hem-selfen, & bryngen oþer men in-to errour. Bote dwelle þow stylle in þese þinges, þat þou hast y-lernyd & þat beþ y-take to þe, knowynge of whom þou hast y-lernyd; & þat from þi ȝouþe þou hast y-knowe holy wrytynges þat mowen enforme þe in-to hele by þe feiþ þat is in Iesu Crist. And eferich wrytynge þat is inspyred of God is profytabel to techen men, & to vndernymen hem, & to amenden hem,
& to enformen hem in ryȝtfulnesse: so þat a Goddes man is parfyt & enformed to eferich good werk.

And y wytnesse to-fore God, & oure Lord Iesu Crist, þat schal deme boþe quyke men & dede, & by his comynge & his kyngdom; preche þou þe word, & stonde bysylyche boþe in hese & in anuy; & vndernyme þou, & byseche, & blame þou in eferich pacyence & in techynge. For tymeffor tyme repeated in the margin, 1st corr. S. schal come when men ne wolleþ noȝt susteyne good techynge & hol; bote þei schuleþ gedere to-gyder maystres, ycchyngetichynge on erasure in a late hand, P. heresþe heres, P., & þei schulleþ turnen awey hure herynge from trewþe, & þei schuleþ turnen hem to tales. Bote wake þou, & trauayle þou in alle þinges, & do þou þi werk of þe euangelye, & fulfulle þi mynystrynge. & be þou sober.

AndHeading: Tyte in a modern hand on ff. 83b and 84, S., suster, to an oþer of his dissiples þat hyȝte Tyte he wryteþ in þis wyse, For þis enchesoun y laftelaue P. nota in the margin, S. þe at Crete, for þou schuldest amenden þilke þinges þat lakkeþ, & þat þou schuldest ordeyne prestes by cytees, as ich ordeyned þe; and who þat is wiþ-outen blame, a man of on wyf, þat haþ feiþful children, noȝt in-to accusacyoun, ne soget to leccherye. For it byhofeþ þat a byschop be wiþ-outen blame, as despensatour of God; noȝt proud, ne wraþþeful, ne dronkelew, ne a smyter, ne coueytous of foul wynnynge; bote an ospyteler & benygne, sober, ryȝtful & holy, contynent; & cleppynge a feiþful & a trewe word þat is aftur good doctryne, þat he be myȝty to warne men in hol techynge, & vndernymen þilke þat aȝeyn|seyen. For þer beþ manye in-obedyent, veyn spekeres & gyloures, & most of þilke þat beþ of circumcysyoun, whom byhofeþ to ben vndernomyn; for þei turneþ up alle houses, techynge þat ne byhofeþ noȝt to ben y-tauȝt, for enchesoun of foul wynnynge. And on of hure owne prophetes seyde, Men of Crete beþ efermore lyeres, lether bestes, of slow
wombe. & þis testymonye is soþ. & þerfore blame hem harde, þat þei ben hol in feiþ, noȝt takynge kepe to þe fables of Iewes, ne to mennes comaundementes þat turneþ hem a-wey from trewþe. And to clene men alle þinges beþ clene: bote to men þat beþ defouled & mysbylefed þer ne is no þing clene; for hure þoȝt and hure conscyence beþ defouled. & þei knowlecheþ þat þei knoweþ God; bote in hure dedys þei forsakeþ hym, for þei beþ abhomynabel, & vnbylefed, & [reprefabel] to eferich good werk.

Bote speke þou hol doctryne þat bysemeþ þe to speke: þat olde men ben sober and chaste, redy & wys, hol in feiþ, in lofe, & in pacyence: olde wymmen also ben in an holy habyt, noȝt schidesteres, noȝt serfynge to muche wynveyn P., spekynge & seyenge wel, þat þei techen wysdom: ȝonge wymmen, þat þei lofen hure housbondes & hure chyldren also, & þat þei ben redy & wys, chast & sober, hafynge [cure] of þe houshold, benyngne, & sogetys to hure housbondes, þat þe word of God ne be noȝt y-blasphemed. Warne þou also ȝonge men þat þei ben sober: & in alle þinges ȝef þi-selfen an ensampel of goode werkes, in techynge, in holnesse, in chastyte, in sadnesse þi word be hol & wiþouten reprefe; þat he þat is aduersary be adrad, & fynde non yfel to seyn of ous. Also þat serfauntes ben in alle þinges sogetes to hure lordes, plesynge in alle þinges & noȝt aȝeyn-seyenge; ne bygylynge, bote in alle þinges schewynge a good feiþ; þat þei worschupen in alle þinges þe doctrine of oure God & oure Safyour. For þe grace of God oure Safyour haþ appered to alle men, techynge ous þat we forsaken wykkednesse & wordlyche desyres, & þat soberlyche & ryȝtfullyche & mukelyche we lyfen in þis worlde, abydynge þe blissed hope & þe comynge of þe blysse of þe grete God & oure Safyour Iesu Crist; þat ȝef hym-selfen for ous to fore-byȝenge ous of eferich wykkednesse, & to maken ous a clene pepel & an acceptabel to hym-selfe & a folewere of goode werkes.
Þese þinges spek þow & warne & vndernyme wiþ eferich power of comaundynge. No man despyse þe.

And warne hem to be sogetes to princys, & to potestatys, to ben
obedyent to þat þat is y-sayd hem, & redy to eferich good werk, to blaspheme no man, ne ben none stryferes, bote softe, schewynge eferich mansuetude to alle men. And we weren ous-self sumtyme vnwyse, vnbylefed, errynge, & serfynge to oure desyres & to dyuerse lustes, & in malyce and in enuye lyfynge, y-hated of oþer men, & hatynge to-gedere. Bote when þe benygnyte & þe humanyte appered of God oure Safyour, noȝt of þe werkes of ryȝtfulnesse, þat we hafeþ y-don, bote þoroȝ his owne mercy he safed ous, by waschynge of a bygetynge aȝeyn & renewynge of þe Holy Gost, whom he haþ y-sched in ous plenteuouslyche, by Iesu Crist oure Safyour; þat we ben y-iustyfyed þoroȝ his grace & ben eyrys þoroȝ hope of an eferlastynge lyf. A trew word, & of þese þinges ich wole conferme þe, þat by goode werkes men chargen to ben beforen oþer, þilke þat bylefeþ to God. For þese þinges beþ goode & profytabel to men: bote schenye þou questyones of foly, and genologyes, and stryfes of þe lawe; for þei beþ vnprofytabel and veyn. A man þat is an heretyk aftur þe furste & þe secounde correccyoun schenye hym; knowynge þat such a man is y-turned upso-doun, & he agulteþ whan he is y-dampned þorowȝ his owne dom.

Þus, suster, seynt Poule techeþ how Cristene men schuleþ lyfe, & his techyng acordeþ wiþ Cristis techynge in þe gospel, as þe techynge of þe oþere aposteles doþ. And now, suster, my counseyl is þat þou lyfe vertuouslyche after Cristes techynge, & kepynge his hestes whyles þou art in þis world; & þanne þou schalt þoroȝ his mercy come to an eferlastynge lyf of blysse, boþe in body and in soule. Amen.

DIV2.HEAD: THE ACTS OF THE APOSTLESMSS. C and D begin here. Here bigynnes þo actus of apostuls C. Actuum apostolorum S.P. Apostolorum D..

DIV3.P:
AlsCo 1. in the margin, C. saynte Luke telles ande writes of þo dedes of þo apostuls, andeom. S.P.D. sais vponon S.P.D. þis wise, Forsoþe, þou Theophul, þe firste sermone I made of alleþinges follows in a later hand, P. þat Iesus bigan to do ande& to D. teche, vnto þat daye þat daye þat he ascended vppe (or was taken uppe), comawndeandecomaundede S.P.D. vntoto S.P.D. þo apostulsposteles S.P. þurghe þo Holigoste þo whiche he chees: ande vnto þo whiche he schewed hym|seluen lifande efter hise passion in many argumentes, bi fourtyargumen (crossed through) tes follows, C. daysdays in the margin, C. apperande vnto hem, ande spekande of þo kengdome of God: ande etande he comanded hem þat þei schulde noghte departe norno P. go away fro Jerusalem, bot þat þei schulde abide þo sonde ande þo bihetyngehetynge S.P.D. of þo fader, þat ȝhe haue harde, he saide, bi my mowþe: forom. P. forsoþe Iohn baptised in water, forsoþe ȝhe schal be baptised þurghe þo Holigoste noghte myche efter þise dais. Þerfore þei þat wore komen togader asched hym, ande saide, Schalt þou in þat tyme restore þo kengdomeþe kyngdom (crossed out) follows, S. of IsraelIrael D.? Ande he saide soþely unto hem, Hit es noghte ȝoures to knowe þo tymes (or, hit falles noghte to ȝowe) ande þo momentes, þo whiche mymy fader (expunged) ends fol. 85b; the line is unfinished with room for 7-8 letters more; my fader repeated on fol. 86 S. Fader has putte in his power. Bot ȝhe schal take vertewe comande fro abouen vnto ȝowe of þo Holygoste into ȝowe: ande vntoto S.P.D. me witnesses ȝhe schal bebere S.P.D. in Ieru|salem, ande in al Iury ande Samarye, ande vnto þo ferresteferþeste S.P.D. ande laste of erþe. Ande whanne he hade saide þise þinges, hemþei S.P.D. seande, he was lifte vppe; ande a clowde toke hym fro her eyghne. Andeom. S.P.D. whanne þei lokedlokande S.P.D. vppe intoin tul S.P.D. heuen efter h[y]mhem C. hym S.P.D. wendande, lo, twootwey S.P.D. men stoden biside hem in white
cloþinges, þo whiche saide vnto hem, Men of Galilee, wherto stonde ȝhe biholdande into heuen? [He þis Iesus þat es up-taken fro ȝou in-to heuene]S.P.D., righte as ȝhe sawe hym ascendein the margin, C. vntoom. P. up into S.D. heuenom. P., right so schal he kome asos S.D. ȝhe sawe hym wende. Þannew division with initial, S.P.D. ii in the margin, D. turned þei agayne vntoto S.P.D. Ierusalem fro þe mownte of Olyuete, þat es biside Ierusalem. Ande whanne þei hade enturde into þerþe P. cynacle (a howse þat þei dwelled inne), þei ȝode vppe where Peter dwelled, ande Iohn, ande Iames, ande Andrewe, ande Philippe, & Thomas, ande Bartholomewbertulmew S.P. berthilmew D., ande Mathewe ande Iacob Alphei, ande Symonsymonde S.P.D. Poule, Drede noghte, bot speke, ande be noghte stille; for-whi I am wiþ þe, ande noneno þing S.P.D. schal be putte to þe þat schal noye þe: for myche folke es to me ande myne in þis cyte. Ande Poule sete þer a ȝhere ande sexe moneþes, techande amonge hem þo worde of God. þo lawe teches men to worschippe God. Ande as Poule biganne to opun his mouþe to speke, Gallyo saide vntoto S.P.D. þoom. S.D. Iewes, Ȝhe men, Iewes, if hit wore any wikked þinge or grete mysdede, rightly schulde I susteyne (or, suffure) ȝowe. Bot if hit be bot questions of þo worde ande names of ȝoure lawe, auyse ȝoure-seluen, for I wole noghte be iuge of þiseþis wordes S.P.D.. Ephesum. He þis was tawghte þo waye of God; ande he was feruente in spiritte, ande teched besily þinges þat wore of Iesu Criste; ande onely he knewe þo bapteme of Ioon. He& he S.P. þis biganne tristely to dotrustely to do twice, P. in þo synagoge. Ande whanne Priscille ande Aquyla harde hym, þei toke hym vntoto S.P.D. hem, ande besily expowned to hym þo waye of God. Ande whanne þei hade harde þis, þei wore baptised in þo name of oure Lorde Iesu Criste. Ande whanne Poule hade laide on hem hise hendehonde S.P.D., þo Holygoste come vponon S.P.D. hem; ande þei speke wiþ tunges ande prophecyed. Ande alle þo men wore nerehandeny honde S.P.D. twelue. Ande Poule entered into þo synagoge, ande tristely he speke by þree monythis, disputande ande techande of þo kengdome of God. Ande þis he dide bi twoo ȝere; in so myche þat men þat wonned in Asye harde þo worde of God, boþe þo Iewes ande gentiles. Ande many vertewes did God by þo hendehonde S.P.D. of Poule: in so myche þat men broghten sudaries [ande]S.P.D. girdels from hise body, ande layde hem vponon S.P.D. þo seke, ande þe sekenes wente fro hem, ande þo wikked spirittes wente oute of menhem S.P.. Ande summe of þo exorcistes of þo Iewes þat wente aboute, assayde forto calle þo name of Iesu vponon S.P.D. hem þat hade yuel spirittes, & saide, We coniure ȝowe bi Iesu whom Poule preches. Ande þer wore in a house of a Iewe, þat was prince of prestes, seuen sones þat diden þis. Ande þo wikked spirittewicked spirite repeated in marg. 1st corr. S. ansuerande
saide, Iesu I knewe, ande Poule I knoweknewe S.P.D.; bot whowhat S.P.D. ben ȝhe? Ande þo man in whom þoþe wicked S.P.D. fende was lepe to hem, ande heom. P. hade maisterschippe of boþe, ande was myghtye agayne, in so myche þat wonded ande naked þei fledde fro þoþt S.P.D. house. Ande þis was made knowne vntoto S.P.D. alle þe Iewes ande gentiles þat dwelled atte Ephesy; ande grete drede felle vponon S.P.D. alle hem, ande þei loued þo name of oure Lorde Iesu. & many of þo trowandeþat troweden S.P.D. come, schriuande, ande schewande þer dedes. Ande many alssoom. S.P.D. þatþt byfore S.P.D. vsed curiostes broghte þer bokes, ande brente hem bifore alle: ande whanne þei hade acownted þo price of hem, þei fonde money of fifty thowsande penyes (þat es, so myche wore þei worþe in price). Ande so wexe þo worde of God ande was confermed. Ande whan þise wore ended, Poule purposed in spiritte to go vntoby S.P.D. Macedonye ande Achaye, ande so forto goo vntoto S.P.D. Ierusalem, ande saide to hymseluen, þat efter þat I haue ben þore, me bihoues to see Rome. Ande heom. S.P.D. sende two of þoo þat mynisterde untoto S.P.D. hym, Tymothe ande Eraste, into Macedonye, ande he dwelled vntoto S.P.D. a certayne tyme in Asye. Ande in þat tyme was grete turbacione of þo waye of God. For one, whos named in the margin, S. was Demetrye, þat was a siluer-maker, ande made þo thabernacles of þo goddesþe goddesse repeated in the marg. 1st corr. S. Dyane of syluer, he gafe vntoto S.P.D. þo warke-men grete money, ande calledcleped S.P.D. hem togider, ande saide vntoto S.P.D. hem þat wore of þatþe P. crafte, Ȝe men, ȝhe wyten wele þat of þis crafte es oure getynge ande lyuynge. Ande ȝhe seen ande heren, þat noghte onely at Ephesum, bot alsso alle þo multitude of Asye, he þis Poule bi his techinges haues turned, ande teches, þat þoo ben noghte goddes þat ben madewiþ hendehonde S.P.D.: ande noghte onely schal oure crafte perische ande be in reproue to vs; bot alsso þo temple of þo grete Dyane, oure goddes, schal be destroyed ande broghte to noghte, ande hire mageste schal be vndone, þo whiche alle Asie ande alle þo worlde worschippes. Ande whanne þise
wordes woren harde, þei wore fulfilledfyllyd S.D. wiþin S.P.D. ire, ande þei cryed, sayande, Þo grete Dyane of Ephesye. Ande þo cyte was fulfilled wiþ confusione: ande wiþ one hertte þei made an hastines into þo spectacle; ande þore þei toke Gaye ande Aristarke, men of Macedonye, þo felowes of Poule. Ande Poule wolde haue gone into þo puple, ande þo discipuls wolde noghte suffure hym goto goo S.P.D.. I haue schewed vntoto S.P.D. ȝowe, ande tawghte ȝowe opunly & bi ȝoure howses, wytnesande to þo Iewes [ande þo folke]S.P.D. into God penaunce, ande faiþe into oure Lorde Iesu Cristeom. S.P.D.. Ande loalso P., I, þat am nowe bownden in spiritte, go into Ierusalem, noghte knowande what schal bifalle to me in hit, bot þat þo Holygoste wytnes to me be alle þo cytes, sayandewittnessynge to me precedes, S.P.D., þat bondes ande tribulaciones abiden me in Ierusalem. Bot I drede no þinge of þise, nor I make my life more preciouse þanne meselfe, whilestewhylys S.P.D. þat I ende my course ande mynisterynge of þo worde, þat I haue taken of oure Lorde Iesu Criste, forto wytnes þo gospelle of þo grace of God. Ande lo, nowe I wote þat ȝhe schal nomore see my face, ȝhe alle, bi whom I haue passed ande preched þo kengedame of God. Ande þerfore I wytnes ȝowe þis daye, þat I am clene fro þo blode of ȝowe alle. Forwhi I haue noghte letted, þat neI ne S.P.D. I haue schewed alle þo counseyle of God to ȝowe. Takes kepe þerfore vntoto S.P.D. ȝoure-seluen ande to alle þo flokke, in þo whiche flokke þo Holygoste haues sette ȝowe bischoppes, forto guuerne his chirche, þe whiche he boghte bi hise owne blode. whanne we come vntoto S.P.D. Ierusalem, gladly receyued vs þo breþer. Ande on þo secunde daye wente Poule wiþ us vntoto S.P.D. Iame, ande alle þe eldars wore gadired togider. Ande whan he hade hailsedsalowyd S.P.D. hem, he tolde vntoto S.P.D. hem þat God hade done by his mynisterynge in nacyons. S. of þe Iewes trowden; ande alle ben filowers of þo lawe; ande þei hafe harde of þe, þat þow teches discencyone (or, diuerste) fro Moises of þo Iewes þo whiche are bi nacyons: þat hem owes noghte to circum|cide þer childer, nor fortoto S.P.D. goabove the line, C. as þei ben wonte. What þanneþarfore is S.P.? a multitude soþely schal be gaderde togider, for þei schal here þat þow erte comyn. Do þerfore þat we saye: Wiþ vs ben foure men þat has on hem [v]oweS.P.D. nowe C.; take þise, ande halow þe wiþ hem, ande gifeput S.P.D. þow in hem þat þei schaue þer heuedes: ande alle 11schal knowe, þat what þei haue harde of þe ben fals; bot alsso þei1111-11 om. S.P.D. schalalle schal P. alle in marg. 1st corr. S. knowe, þat þow gos ande kepes þo lawe. Ande whan þo seuen dais wore ended, þo Iewes þat wore of Asie, whanne þei see hym in þo temple, þei stiredmeuyd S.P.D. alle þo puple, ande kesteputte S.P.D. þer hondes on hym criande, Ȝhe men of Israel, helpes: þis es þo man þat teches in iche place alle maner of men agayne þo puple, þo& þe S.P. lawe, ande þis placeom. Ephesy, with hym, ande þei supposed þat Poule hade broghte hym into þo temple. Ande alle þe cyte was stiredmeuyd S.P.D., ande grete concourse of þo puple was made: ande þei toke Poule ande drowe hym wiþouten þo temple: & onone wore þo ȝhates sparredclosyd S.P.D.. Ieru|salem: ande whan þei see þo tribune ande þo knyghtes, þei cessed forto smyte Poule. Þanne þo tribune toke Poule, ande bade þat he schulde be bownden wiþ twoo chenys, ande asched what he was, ande whatte þat he hade done. Ande whanne þo tribune myghte noghte knowe þo soþe forfor þe P. grete noyce, he bade þat he schulde be ledde intoto S.P.D. þo castelscastel S.P.D.. D. breþer into Damaske forto bringe hem from þeþenþen S.P.D. bownden into Ierusalem, þat þei schulde be punysched. Ande hit bifelle, as I wente, andeI S.P. neghed vntoto S.P.D. Damaske, 11ymiddes þo way1111-11 in myddil of þe day S.P.D., sodenly vmschonebyschone S.P.D. me grete lighte fro heuen. Ande [fallande]fallynge S.P.D. vntoto S.P.D. þo erthe I harde a voyce sayande vntoto S.P.D. me, Saule, Saule, wharto pursewes þow me? Ande I ansuered, Who erte þou, Lorde? Ande he saide vntoto S.P.D. me, I am Iesu of Nazareth, whom þatom. S.P.D. þow pursewes. Ande þoo þat wore wiþ me seen lighte, bot þei harde noghte his voice þat speke wiþ me. & I saide, What schal I do, Lorde? Ande he saide vntoto S.P.D. me, Rise, ande go into Damaske; ande þer schal be saide vntoto S.P.D. þe of alle þinges þatwhat S.P. þe bihoues to do. & whanne I myghte noghte se for clerte of þat lyghte, I was ledde bi þoom. S.P.D. honde of my felowes, ande so I kome vntoto S.P.D. Damaske. Ande a man whos name was Ananye, he bi þo lawe hade wytnes of alle þoom. S.P.D. Iewes, þat dwelled þore, ande he come to me, andeande seid to in different ink, on erasure, C. seid to me, Saule broþer, biholde ande se. Ande I in þo same houre bihelde vponon S.P.D. hym. Ande he saide, Þoerased S. om. P. God of oure fadires haues bifore-ordeyned þe forto knowe hise wille, 21& forto see hise rightwise2121-21 om. S.P.D., ande forto here hise voyce of hise mouþe. For þou schalt be wytnes of hym vntoto S.P.D. alle men of þoom. S.P.D. þinges þat þow haues sene ande harde.
Ande nowe, wharto taries þowe? Rise, ande be baptisedbaptizest P., and wasche þi synnes, ande calleclepe S.P.D. vponneon S.P.D. hise name þat þus haues schewed vntoto S.P.D. þe. Ande hit bifelle, þat, whanne I turned agayne into Ierusalem ande preyde in þo temple, þat I was stonyed in mynde; ande me þoghte I harde hym sayande vntoto S.P.D. me, Haste þe, ande go oute swiftelyschyftely P. of Ieru|salem, for þei schal noghte receyue þoþi S.P.D. wytnessinge of me. & I saide, Lorde, þei knowne þat I am he þat sperredclosyd S.P.D. in prisone & betty bi þo synagogesynagogys S.P.D. hem þat trowedþt trowed expunged follows, S. in þe: ande whanne þo blode of Stephyn þat was þi witnes was schedde, I was þore, ande assented vntoto S.P.D. hise slaughte; ande I kepped þo cloþes of hem þat slowe hym. Ande he saide vntoto S.P.D. me, Go, forto alle nacyons I schal sende þe. Þo companye harde hym vntoto S.P.D. þis worde, ande þei lifte vppe þer voice, ande cried, Undo hym (orand S.P.D., delyuer hym) oute of þo erthe: for hit es noghte leffulle þat he schal life. Ande whanne þei maked þis crye, ande keste forþe þer cloþes, ande smote vppe pouder into þo ayre, þo tribune bade toom. S.P.D. lede hym into þo castels, ande forto bete hym wiþ scourges, ande forto to S.P.D. touremente, þat he myghte wyte for what cause suche criynge was made agayne hym. Ande whanne þei hade streyned hym in þooom. S.P.D. bondes, Poule saide vntoto S.P.D. þo centurione þat stode bi hym, Is hit leffulle vntoto S.P.D. ȝowe so forto scourge ande bete a man Romayne þat es noghte dampned? Ande whanne þo centurio harde þis, he wente vntoto S.P.D. þo Tribune, ande saide vntoclepe S.P.D. hym, What schalte þow do? þis man es a Romayne. & þo tribune come vntoto S.P.D. hym ande saideseyde to hym S.P.D., Say me if þow be a Romayne. Ande he saide, Ȝhe. Ande þo Tribune saide, Lyghtly sais þou þat þow erte a buriase of Rome; I haue goten þis cytecytee crossed through with borcheschep in marg. 1st corr. S. burscheschep P. wiþ myche money. Ande Poule saide, Ande I am borne Romayne. Ande onone þooþo ilke S.P. þat schulde hafe tourmented hym wente fro hym; ande þo
tribune dredde, efter þat he harde þat he was a Romayne, ande for he hade so bownden hym.

Andein marg. ye xxiii co in a XVIth cent. hand, S. Cm xxiii P. þo day efter þo Tribune wolde knowe certaynlymore c. S.P. for what cause he was accused of þo Iewes. He lowsed hym, ande called togider þo prestes ande alle þo cownseile, ande broghte forþe Poule, ande sette hym amonge hem.

Saducens, ande so þo multitude was diuersed ande twynned. Þo Saducens saide, þat þere schulde no resurreccyone be, ande þat þer was nouþer awngel norne S.P. spiritte: ande þo Pharisens saide þo reuerce þat boþe þise was. Ande grete criynge was made: ande sum of þo Pharises faughte, sayande, We fynde none yuel in þis man: what þofeȝif S.P.D. a spirytte hafe spoken vntoto S.P.D. hym, or aneny S.P.D. awngel?
Ande whanne grete discencyone was amonges hem, þo tribune dredde hym þat Poule schulde be alle todriuento ryfyn S.P.D. amonge hem; ande he bade knyghtes to goo ande take hym fro myddes of hem, ande forto lede hym into þo castelscastel S.P.. Ande in þo nyghte efter Criste stode bi hym, ande saide, Be stedfaste, for as þow haueste wytnessed of me in Ierusalem, so bihoues þe to wytnes at Rome. Ande whanne daye was comen, summe of þo Iewes gadured hem togider, ande made a vowe amonge hem, sayande, þat þei schulde noþerneyþer S.P.D. ete nor drinke vntoto S.P.D. þei hade slayne Poule. Ande þei wore mo þanne fourety men þat made þis coniuracyone ande þis oþe. Þise men ȝode to þo princes of prestes ande þo eldars, ande sayde, We han made a vowe, þat we schal nouþerneyþer P. ete norno P. drinke totyl S.P.D. we haue slayne Poule. Þerfore make ȝhe knowne vntoto S.P.D. þo tribune wiþ þo cownsel, þat he bringe hym forþe vntoto S.P.D. vs as we schulde knowe more certaynly of hym: ande we, or he come to vs, ben redy forto slee hym. Þis harde a childe þat was Poule sister sone; he come into þo castelscastel S.P.D. ande tolde Poule of þis. Ande Poule called vntoto S.P.D. hym one of þe centuryons, ande saide, Lede þis childe to þo tribune, for he haues sumwhat to telle vntoom. S.P.D. hym. Ande he toke hym, ande ledde hym to þo tribune, ande saide, Poule þat es bownden preyde me to bringe þis childe vntoto S.P.D. þe, for he haues to speke wiþ þe. Ande þo tribune toke þo hande of þo childe, ande wente wiþ hym biside, ande saide vntoto S.P.D. hym, What haues þow tofor to S.P.D. telle vntoto S.P.D. me? Ande he saide, Þo Iewes hanbeþ S.P.D. accorded to preye þe, þat þow bringe forþe to|morne Poule into þo conseyl, as if þei wolde wyte more wyterlysykyrly S.P.D. of hym. Bot trowe hem noghte: for moo þanne fourty men lyne in wayte for hym, þo whichewhulke S.D. han made a vowe, nouþer to ete nor drinke totul S.P.D. þeiþei sle hym S.P.D. haue slayne hym: ande now ben þei redy, ande abiden þi biheste ande þi wille. Ande þoom. P. tribune lete þis childe go, ande bade hym þat he schulde telle vntoto S.P.D. none þat he hade made þis knowne vntoto S.P.D.
hym. Ande he called twoto P. centurions, ande saide to hem, Makes redy two hundreth knyghtes forto go vntoto S.P.D. Cesarye, ande seuenty horse-men, ande spere-men two hundreth, fro þo þridde houre of þo nyghte; ande make redy ȝour bestes, þat ȝhe may sette Poule on one ande lede saufehym faste S.P. vnto Felix þo mayer marye P., ande wrote a letter in þis maner of wordes: Claudius Lysias to gode Felix gretes wele (or, ȝernesdesyreþ S.P.D. hele). Þis man þat was taken of þe Iewes, ande in poynte to be slayne of hem, I& S.P.D., in þo mene tyme comande, toke hym fro þer hendehonde S.P.D., for I knewe þat he was a Romayn. Ande for I wolde knowe þo cause þat þei keste agayne hym, I ledde hym into þerþe S.P.D. counseyle. And I fonde þat he was accused of þo questions of þer lawe: bot I fonde hym no þinge worþi þo deþe nor þat bere cryme vntoto S.P.D. þo Iewes. Ande whanne hit was tolde me of þo waytynges þat þei ordeyned agayne hym, I sende hym vntoto S.P.D. þe, ande biddande vntoto S.P.D. þe accusars þat þei telle þerþe S.P.D. pleynte bifore þe. Ande þo knyghtes, as hit was bodenbedyn S.P.D. to hem, þei toke Poule, ande ledde hym into Antipatridem. Ande þo toþer day þei lefte þer þerom. S.P. horseshors S.P.D. fortoto S.P.D. go wiþ hym, ande þei ȝode vntoto S.P.D. þo castels. Ande whanne þei wore comen vntoto S.P.D. Cesarie, ande hade gifen þe letter vntoto S.P.D. þo mayremarye P., þei sette bifore hym Poule. Ande whanne he hade redde þo letter, ande asched of what contre he was; ande whanne he knewe þat he was of Cylyce, he saide, I schal here þe whan þineþi S.P.D. accusars comen. Ande he bade kepe hym in þo mote-halle of Herowde (þo place þere Heroude demed).

Andein marg. Cm 24 in a later hand, C. þe xxiiii co in a XVIth century hand, S. efter fiue dais come þo prince of prestes Anany with summe of þo elders, and wiþ one Tertullo, an orator (þat es, a motar or aduoket); þise wente vntoto S.P.D. þe mairemarye P. agaynes Poule. Ande whanne Poule was sommunde, Tertullus biganne to accuse Poule, ande saide vntoto S.P.D. þe mayremarye P., Siþen we ben in mekemuche S.P.D. pece bi þe, ande many þinges
ben correctud by þi prouidence, euermoreande euermore S.P.D.C. , gode Felix, we han receyued þise wiþ alle dedis of þankes. Ande þat I no lenger tarye þein marg. C., I prey þe, here þisus S.P.D. for þi godenes. We haue fownden þis wikked man, ande styrande sedicione vntoto S.P.D. alle þo Iewes in alle þo worlde, ande autor of þo sedicione of þo secteseete D. cytee S.P. of Nazarens: ande oure temple has hehe haþ S.P.D. ben aboute fortoto S.P.D. file. Ande whanne we haden taken hym, we wolde haue iuged hym efter oure lawe. Ande þo tribune Lysias kome, and toke [hym]S.P.D. oute of our hendehonde S.P.D. with grete strenkthe, ande bade hise accusars come vntoto S.P.D. þe, of whom þow may knowe, demande of alle þise, of þo whiche we accusen hym. Ande þo Iewes saiden alsso þat þus hit was. Ande þo mayre made token to Poule to speke, and Poule ansuered, Of many ȝhere I þat haue knowne þe iuge vntoto S.P.D. þis flokkefolke S.P.D., [in a good wille I]S.P.D. schal make satisfaccyon for me bifore þe: þow may wele knowe þat no moo days ben vntoto S.P.D. me botþan S.P.D. twelfe siþen I come fro Ierusalem. Ande in þo temple þei han noghte fownden any disputande wiþ me or elles makandeme makynge follows companye, S.P.D. any concourse of company, nouþer in þo temple, nor in þo synagoge, nor in þo cyte. Nor þei may proue þinges þat þei accusen me of vntoto S.P.D. þe. [Ande I know|leche to þe]S.P.D., þat efter þo secte þat þei callen heresie, I haue so serued to God my fadire þat I trowe vntoto S.P.D. alle þat ben wryten in þo lawe ande þo prophecye: hafande my hope in God, in& in S.P.D. þoom. S.P. whiche alsso hemseluen abiden þo resurreccione þat es fortoto S.P.D. come boþe of þo gode ande þo yuel. In þis alsso I studye forto haue conscience to God euermore, ande to men alsso wiþouten offendikel. Ande efter many ȝhereȝeeres with s in a later hand, S. ȝeeres P. I come vntoto S.P.D. my nacyon forto do almes, ande forto do myne offeringes ande myne auowes: in þo whiche þei fonde me purified in þo temple, noghte wiþ grete companye, nor wiþ noyce. Ande þei toke me, cryande ande sayande, Vndo oure enmye. And summe Iewes of Asye, whom hit bihoued
nowe fortoto S.P.D. be redy bifore þe, & forto accuse, if þei haden oghte agaynes me, or elles say þise hemseluen, if þei hafe fownden any wikkednes in me, siþen I stonde here in þo conseyle, bot onely of þis one voyce, þat I cried stondande amonges hem and sayande, I am demed of ȝowe of þo resur|reccione of deadeþe d. S.P.. & Felix differde hem þat accuseden hym, for he kn[e]weS.P.D. knowe C. how hit was, ande he saide to hem, Whanne þo tribune Lysias komes, I schal here ȝowe. Ande he bade vntoto S.P.D. a centuryone forto kepe Poule, ande þat he schulde haue reste; ande þat none of hemhyse S.P.D., erasure of his follows, C. schulde be lette forto mynister vntoto S.P.D. hym. Ande efter summe dais Felix come wiþ Drusille, hise wife, þo whiche was a Iewes, ande calledprayed for to see S.P. Poule, ande harde of hym þo faiþe in oure Lorde Iesu Criste. Ande whanne he disputed of rightwisenes, ande chastite, ande þo dome þat was fortoto S.P.D. come, Felix was ferde, ande ansuered, Go nowe at þis tyme, for in aom. P. couenabul tyme I schal calle þe. Ande Felix supposed that Poule schulde gife hym summe moneye: and þerfore often tyme he called hym, and speke with hym. Ande efter þat Felix hade fynisched hise two ȝhere in hise office, he hade a successoure whos name was called Festus. Ande for Felix wolde haue þanke of þo Iewes, he lefte Poule bownden in bondes.
