Andein marg. Cm 25 in a later hand, C. xxv co on erasure in a XVIth century hand, S. whanne Festus þanne come into þo contre, efter þo þridde daye he wente vntoto S.P.D. Ierusalem fro Cesarye. Ande þo princes of prestes come vntoto S.P.D. hym, and þo firste & þo moste worþi of þo Iewes, agayne Poule. Ande þei preyde hym, aschande grace agayn hym, þat he schulde bidde hym be broghte into Ierusalem, settande waytynges forto slee hym in þo waye. Ande Festus ansuered, þat Poule schulde be kepped in Cesarye, ande þat hymseluenhe h. S.P. schulde hastily go þider. Andeom. P. þerfore, he saide, þoo þat ben myghty in ȝowein ȝowe om. S.P.D., kome þeiom. S.P.D. alsso. Ande ifom. P. þer be any cryme in þo man, accuse þei hym. And he dwelled amonge hem days no mo bot eghte or tenne. Ande he wente into Cesarye,
ande þo toþer daye he sate in his sete of dome, ande bade þat Poule be broghte forþe. Ande whanne he was broghte forþe, Iewesþe i. S.P. þat komen fro Ierusalem stoden aboute hym, castande agayne hym many grete causes, þo whiche þei myghte noghte proue; for Poule made his skille agayne, sayande, þat nouper I haue synned agayn þo lawe of þo Iewes, nor agayne þo temple, nor agayne þo Cesar. Ande Festus, in wille forto gife grace vntoto S.P.D. þo Iewesnor aȝen þe pepel follows, expunged, S.P., ande forto haue þanke of hem, ansuered vntoto S.P.D. Poule and saide, Wilte þou go vntoto S.P.D. Ieru|salem, ande þer be iuged of þise bifore me? Ande Poule saide, I stonde atte þo demynge-place of þo Cesare, where hit behoues me fortoto S.P.D. be demed. I haue noghte noyed vntoto S.P.D. þo Iewes, as þow wele knowes. Ande if I haue noyed or done any þinge worþi þo deþe, I recuserefuse S.P.D. noghte to dye. Bot if I haue done no þinge þat þei accuse me of, none may gife me vntoto S.P.D. hem. Vntoto S.P.D. þo Cesar I appele. Þanne Festus spake wiþ hise cownseyle, and ansuered, Þow haues appeled vntoto S.P.D. þo Cesar, ande to þo Cesar schalte þow go. Ande whanne summe days wore passed, þo kenge Agrippa ande men of BaronyeVulg. Agrippa rex et Bernice. come vnto Cesarie to Festus, forto hayls hym. And whanne þei hade ben þore many dayes, Festus tolde vntoto S.P.D. þo kenge of Poule, & sayde, þer was a man lefte bownden of Felix: forin marg. C. whom, whanne I was at Ierusalem, þo princes of prestes ande þo elders come vntoto S.P.D. me, aschande dampnacione agaynes hym. To whom I ansuered, þat hit es noghte custome vntoto S.P.D. þo Romayns tofor to S.P. dampne any man, totil (on erasure, S.) P. he þat es accused haue presente hise accusars, and alsso þat he haue place forto defende hym, forto ansuere vntoto S.P.D. þo crymes þat ben putte vponon S.P. hym. Ande whanne þei come hider wiþouten any taryynge, I sate on þo toþer day forto deme, and I bade hym forto be broghte forþeto us S.P.D.. Of whom, whanne hise accusars stode bifore me, I fonde no cause of þo whiche I supposed illeyuel S.P.D.. Bot summe questionsquestyoun S.P.D. of his super|sticione þei hade agayne hym, and specially of one Iesu, þat
es deed, whom Poule affermed forto life. Ande for I was in doute of þis question, I asched if he wolde go vntoto S.P.D. Ieru|salem and be iuged þore of þisehym, crossed through, with þese þynges in marg. 1st corr. S. þese þinges, P.. Ande Poule appeled, & forto kepe hit vntoto S.P.D. þo knowynge of þo Auguste, I bade kepe hymom. S.P. to I sende hym vnto þoom. S.P.D. Cesar. Ande Agrippa saide to Festus, I wolde alsso here þat man. 7Ande Festus ansuered77-7 om. S.P., Tomorne þow schalte here hym. Ande vponon S.P.D. þo toþer daye, whanne Agrippa ande þo men of Beronye wore comen with grete ȝerneyngeȝernynges P., ande wore enterdto, expunged, follows, S. þo audy|torye, wiþ þo tribunes ande þo principal men of þo cyte, at þoom. P. bidynge of Festus Poule was broghte forþe. Ande Festus saide, Kenge Agrippa, ande ȝhe alle þat ben here wiþ vs, ȝhe sene þis man, of whom alle þo multitude of þo Iewes speke vntoto S.P.D. me at Ierusalem, aschande & criande þat he schulde no lenger life. Ande I fonde no þinge þat he wore worþi þe deþe fore. Ande for he haues appeled, I haue demed to sende hym vntoto þe S.P.D. Auguste. Bot in certayne what I may write to my lorde haueI haue S.P.D. I noghte. Ande for þis cause I haueom. P. broghte hym forthe vntoto S.P.D. ȝowe, and specially vntoto S.P.D. þo kenge Agrippa, þat Ihaue, expunged, follows, P. may asche hym bifore ȝowe, ande þat I may knowe what I schal write. For wiþouten resone me þenkeþynkeþ S.P.D. to sende hym bownden, ande noghte forto telle þo cause.

Andein marg. Cm 26 in a later hand, C. xxvi co on erasure, XVIth century hand, S. þo kenge Agrippa saide vntoto S.P.D. Poule, Hit es sufferde þat þow speke for þiseluen. Þanne Poule spredde hise hende obrodeabrood follows spred, S.P.D., and gafe his skille, ande saide, Of alle þo þingesþ on erasure, S. kyngis D. þat I am accused of þo Iewes, kenge Agrippa, I suppose me blessed ande cleneknele S.P.D. bifore þe, siþen I schal defende me today. Ande specyally siþen þow knowes alle þoom. S.P.D. customes þat ben amonge þohem P. Iewes, ande alsso þo questionscustomes S.P.D. þat ben amonge hem: wherfore I preye þe þat
þow here me paciently. Ande alsso forsoþe my lyfe fro my ȝowþe, ande fro þo bigynnynge in my nacyone, in Ierusalem, alle þo Iewes knowe; knowande me fro þo bigynnynge, if þei wolde bere wytnes, þat efter þo certayne secte of oure relygione I haue lifed a Pharisene. Ande nowe in þo hope of biheste þat was made vntoto S.P.D. oure fadires of oure Lorde God, I stonde subjecte to þo dome; in þo whiche oure twelue tribes, nyghte ande daye seruande, hopen to come. Of þo whiche hope, kenge Agrippa, I am accused of þo Iewes. Bot whatte es demed incredibil anentes ȝowe, if God raiserere S.P.D. þo deed? Ande I alsso supposed, þat me awghte to do many contrary|ouse þinges agayne þo name of Iesu of Nazarene. Ande I spardeclosyd S.P.D. in prisone many halowes; and þis I did in Ierusalem, for suche power I toke of þo princes [of prestis]S.P.D.; ande whanne þei wore slayne, I bare þo sentence. Ande punysch|ande hem customabuly by alle þo synagoges, I gartemaked S.P.D. hem fortoto S.P.D. blaspheme. Ande ȝitte I was more wode agaynes hem, ande pursewed hem to oute nacyons. In þo whiche, when I wente vntoto S.P.D. Damaske wiþ þo power & letters of princes of prestes, in þo myddes of þo daye, in þo waye I sawe, kenge Agrippa, fro heuen, passande þo schynynge of þo sunne, a lyghte þat vmschoneaboute schon S.P.D. me and hem þat wore wiþ me. Ande whanne we alle felle vntoto S.P.D. þo erthe, I harde a voice spekande to me in þe tunge of Hebrewe, Saule, Saule, whi pursewes þow me? Hit es harde to þe to keskyce S.D. kynse P. agayne þo broddeprikke S.P.D.. Ande I saide, Who erte þow, Lorde? Ande he saide, I am Iesu whom þow pursewes. Bot rise vppe, he saide, ande stonde vponon S.P.D. þi fete: for forom. S.P.D. þis cause I appered vntoto S.P.D. þe, forto make þe a mynister ande wytnes of þinges þat þow haues sene, and of þo in whom I schal appere to þ[e]S.P.D. þo C.; delyuerande þeþes P. fro pupuls ande nacyons, to whom noweI now S.P.D. I sende þe, forto opun þo eyghne of þo blynde, þat þei turne fro þo derkenes vntoto S.P.D. þo lighte, fro þe pouer of þo fende to God, ande þat þei take remyssion of synnes, ande lote amonge
halowes bi þo faiþe þat es in me. Wherfore, kenge Agrippa, I was noghte vntrowthfulle to þo heuenly visione: bot to hem þat wore at Damaske firste, ande siþenom. S.P.D. to þem þat wore at Ierusalem, I schewed hit, ande bi alle þo contre boþe to þo Iewrye ande to þo nacions, þat þei schulde do penawnce, ande þat þei schulde be turned vntoto S.P.D. God, doynge þo worþi frutes of penawnce. For þis cause þo Iewes, whan I was in þo temple, wolde haue slayne me, ande toke me. Ande ȝitte vntoto S.P.D. þis daye I stande, hulpun wiþ þo grace of God, witness|ande boþe to þo lesse ande to þo more, no þinge sayande more þanne Moyses ande þo prophetes saide forto kome; þat Criste was p[a]ssibulpossibul C.; passybyl S.P.D. Vulg. si passibilis Christus., & þat he was firste of þo resurreccione of þo deed, forto schewe lyghte vntoto S.P.D. þo puple ande to þo naciones. Ande whanne he spake þus ande schewed resone and skille for hym, Festus saide wiþ a grete voyce, Poule, þow fonnesþu fonnys repeated in marg. 1st corr. S.; mycheþi m. S.P.D. letturere turnes þe vntoto S.P.D. folyfoltschupe S.P.D.. Ande Poule saide, Gode Festus, I fonne noghte, bot I speke wordes of soburnes and soþefastenes. For þo kenge knowes of þise, to whom I speke stabuly; I suppose þat none of þise es vnknowne to hym; for none of þise was done in hiddelshyddyl S.P.D. (or, in hernes). Ande þo kenge Agrippa trowestrowest S.P., st on erasure, S. vntoto S.P.D. þo pro|phetes; I wote þat þow trowes. Ande þo kenge Agrippa saide vntoto S.P.D. Poule, In lytel þou makes a skille þat I am Cristen. Ande Poule saide, I ȝernedesyre S.P.D. bifore God in lytel ande in myche, noghte onely þe, bot alsso alle þat heren me todaye, forto be made suche as I am, outetaken þise bondes. Ande þo kenge, ande þo mayre, ande þo men of Beronye, and þoo þat sate wiþ hem, rose vp; and wente biside ande speke togider & saide, No þinge haues þis man done þat es worþi þo deþe or bondes. Ande Agrippa saide vntoto S.P.D. Festus, Þis man myghte haue ben laten go, if he hade noghte appeled vntoto S.P.D. þeom. S.P. Cesarcapitulum follows, C..

Andein marg. Cm 27m in a later hand, C. xxvii co in a XVIth century hand, S. whanne hit was demed þat he schulde schippe into Ytalye, ande beom. P. takenbytaken S.P.D. vntoto S.P.D. þo centurion of þo companye of Auguste whos name was Iulye, we wente into a schippe of Hardumetyneadrowmyntyne S.P.D. Vulg. navem Adrumetinam.. Ande whanneom. S.P.D. we biganne to sayle, we bere vppe aboute þo places of Asye; ande with vs dwelled Aristarcus Mecedonye of Thessalonye. Ande þo nexte day we come untoto S.P.D. Sidon: and Iulye tre[t]edS.P.D. treded C. Poule manly, and lete hym go to hise frendes, and forto do hise owne cure. Ande whanne we wente fro þeþenþeyn S.D. þen P., we vndursayled Ciper, for þo wyndes wore contrariouse. Ande we, saylande þo see of Cylyce and Pamphile, in twelue days we come vntoto S.P.D. Listram of Lycie. Ande þore þo centurion fonde a schippe of Aly|sawnder, schippande into Ytalye; & he putte vs in hit. Ande whanne we hade sailed slouly many dais, ande vneþes wore comen agayne Gwyde, for lettynge of þo wynde, we sayled vnto Crete biside Salomon; ande vneþe saylande biside into a place þat es called Gode Porte (or, hauen), to þo whiche es nerenyȝ S.P. þo cyte of Thessal[a]S.P.D. Thessa|lonye with onye expunged, C.. Ande whanne longe tyme ande myche þan was passed, ande was no forþer siker schippynge ande saylynge, for þat þei haden longe fasted, Poule comforþed hem, sayande, Men, I see þat wiþ iniurye ande myche harme noghte onely of þo charge þat es of þo schippe ande of þo schippe, [bot of oure lyues]S.P.D. vacant space of ¾ inch, C., bigynnes oure schiprode to be. Þo centurio trowed vntoto S.P.D. þo guuernere of þo schippe ande to þo schipman more þanne to Poule[s] sayngespoules seyenge S.P.D.. Ande for þei haden noghte habul hauenynge forto wynter inne, þei toke þer cownsel to go fro þeþenþen S.D. þeyn P., if þei myghte onom. S.P.D. any wise come vntoto S.P.D. Phenyce, forto wynter at þo hauen of Crete, þo whiche was berande towarde Affriche, ande& to S.P.D. Chore. Bot whan þo souþe wynde blewe, whanne þei supposed to holde þer purpose, ande hade gone fro Assere ande hade passed Crete, noghte myche efter come
agayne hem a norþe-heste wynde. Ande whanne þo schippe was vppe-taken, ande myghte noghte enforce agayne þo wynde, we gafe þo schippe to·e schyp to repeated in marg. 1st corr. S. þo wynde, ande þo wynde bere vs. Ande so we come vnto an ile þat es named Cawdacanda S.P.D.. Ande vneþe myghte we gete þo kokbote: and whanne þis was hade away, þei vsedom. S.P. helpinge, byndande þo schippe; dredande þat neom. S.P.D. þei schulde falle into sandesondy S.D. þe sondy P. Vulg. timentes ne in Syrtim inciderent. place: ande so þei wore borne, while þe vessel was keste downe. [Ande] we wore& we were S.P.D. wore we C. schaken wiþ a grete tempeste; ande þoat þe S.P.D. toþer [day]P; in marg. 1st corr. S. om. C.D. þei keste oute of þo schippe þinges þat wore þerinne. Ande vponom. S.P.D. þo þridde day þei keste oute þeom. S.P.D. armorye of þo schippe wiþ þer hende, for noþer sonne nor mone nor sternessterrys S.P.D. appered bi many dais. Ande grete tempeste was, ande þan was alle hope of oure hele away. Ande whanne we longe hade fastud, Poule stode ymyddes and saide, It behouedbyhoueþ P., ȝhe men, forto herehere with d added and hafe in marg. C. me (or, fortohere me or forto om. S.P.D. haue harde me), noghte to haue passed fro Crete, ande forto haue wonnen þis losselost S.P.D.. Bote ȝitte bes of godeom. S.P.D. herte: for losselost S.P.D. schalom. P. þer noneom. S.P.D. be ofom. S.P.D. none of ȝoure lifes, bot only of þo schippe. For þis nyghte stode bi me þo awngel of God, whos I am, ande vntoto S.P.D. whom I serue, ande saide, Poule, drede þe noghte, forto vntoom. S.P.D. þo cesar þe bihoues to come. Ande lo, God haues giuen vntoto S.P.D. þeon erasure, 1st corr. S. ȝow D. allealle lyfes S.P. þat ben in þo schippe wiþ þe. Ande þerfore, men, bes of gode herte: for I trowe vntoto S.P.D. my God, þat so schal it be as hit was saide vntoto S.P.D. me. Ande into an ile schal we come. Bot efter þo fourten[d]efourtenþe S.P.D. nyghte was comen, and we wore schippande in A-drye, aboute þoom. S.P.D. mydde-nyghte þo schipmen supposed þat þei see a contre. Ande þei put þer plumbe into þe see to knowe þo depnes ofof þe S.P. water; ande þei fonde twenty paces. Ande whanne þei wore a lytel þen, þei fonde XV pases. Ande for þei dredde þat þei schulde falle into scharpe places, þei sende foure ankers oute of þoom. D. schippe,
ande ȝerneddesyryd S.P.D. þat dayþe d. P. wore comen. Ande whan þo schipmen wolden hafe fledde oute of þo schippe, ande hade put oute þo bote of þe schippe into þe see as forto keste þer ankers, Poule saide 4vnto þo centurion ande to þe knyghtes44-4 om. S.P.D., Bot if ȝhe be stille in þo schippe, ȝhe may noghte be sauedsaue S.P.D.. Thanne þo knyghtus kutteden away þo cordes ofþo cordes of om. S.P.D. þo boot, ande suffured hit to falle away. Ande whanne lyghte biganne fortoto S.P.D. come, Poule preyde hem alle þat þei schulde ete sumwhat, ande saide, Þis es þo fourtende daye þat ȝhe hauen ben fastande, ande no mete haue ȝhe eteneten or om. S.P. (or, taken). Wherfore I pray ȝowe to take summe meate for ȝoure hele: for a heer of none of ȝoure hedes schal perische. Ande whanne he hade saide þis, he toke brede ande þanked God in alle þer sighte. Ande whanne he hade broken þo brede ande biganne forto to S.P.D. ete, þei wore made þo more herty ande toke mete alsso. Þo men þat wore in þe schippe wore two hundrethe seuenty ande sexe. Ande whanne þei haden eten þer fille, þei allegid þo schippe, ande keste þo whete into þo see. Ande whanne day was comen, þei knew [noghte] þo londeno lond S.P.D.. Bot an arme þei bihelde, in þo whiche þei see as hit wore a banke. Ande þider þei þoghte, if þei myghte, to keste þo schippe. Ande whanne þei hade drawen vppe þo ankurs, þei putte hem vntoto S.P.D. þe see, slakande þo iunctures fro þo gubernaclegubernacles P, es added in a later hand, S., & raisedreryd S.P. a lytel sayle. Ande bi þo blaste of þo wynde þei wente vntoto S.P.D. þo banke. Ande whanne we wore fallen into a place þer two sees mette, þei enpechedenpersched S.P.D. þo schippe; ande þo forþer partye of þo schippe stodeom. S.P. stille. Bot þo schippe lowsed for strenkthe of þo see. Ande þo knyghtes gafe counseile, þat þoo þat wore vndure kepinge in þo schippe schulde be slayne, and þat þei schulde noghte skape awaye. Ande þo centurion, for he wolde þat Poule wore saued, for|bedde so to do. Ande he bade þat þooeche S.P. þat couþe swymme schulde firste go vntoto S.P.D. þo see, ande so skape ande come vntoto S.P.D.
þo londe. Ande oþer toke bordes, and summe toke oþer þinges þat wore of þo schippe. Ande so bifelle, þat þei alle skaped vnto þo londe saufefollows scaped, S.P.D., & none perisched.

Andein marg. Cm 28m in a later hand, C. ye xxviii ce in a XVIth century hand, S. whanne we were skaped, þanne knewe we þat þo londe þat wein marg. 1st corr. S. were onne was called þo ile of Mutilene. Ande þo barbarise schewed myche manhede vntoto S.P.D. vs, for þei kindeld a fire, ande refresched vs, for þe rayne ande þo colde þat was þanne. Ande whanneom. P. Poule hade gider[ed]gaderyd a multitude of S.P.D. stikkes, ande hade layde hem vpon þoon þe S.D. on D. fire, a nedder come from þo hete, and smote into his honde. & whanne þo barbarise se þo beste hongande hyngande S.P.D. inon S.P. hise honde, þei saide togider, For|sothe he þis es a mansleare, for þofe hehe be S.P.D. skaped fro þo see, he es noghte suffurde no lenger to lyfe. Ande Poule smote þo beste into þe fire, ande hade none harme. Ande þei supposed þat he schulde bolneswelle S.P.D., ande sodenly falle downe ande dighe. Ande whanne þei longe hade abiden, and seghe þat he hade none harme, þei turned ande saide þat he was God. Ande in þo places wore þe manersmaystris S.P.D. of þo prince of þat ile, whos name was Publyus; þo whiche receyued vs, andeom. S.P.D. benyngly re|freschedom. S.P.D. vs three dais. Ande þo fader of þis prince laye in þo fiuoures ande in þo yuel þat es called dissintery: vntoto S.P.D. whom Poule enterde. Ande whanne he hade layde vponon S.P.D. hym his hondes, he helud hym. Ande whanne þis was done, alle þat wore in þo ile ande wore seke come vntoto S.P.D. hym, ande wore helud. Ande men of þat ile worschipped vs with myche worschippe, ande gafe vs þat vs nedid vntoto S.P.D. oure efte|schippinge. Ande efter three monythes we schipped ininto S.P.D. a schippe of Alysawnder, þo whiche hade wynterde in þat ile, ande hade fairnes of castelsVulg. cui erat insigne Castorum.. Ande whanne we wore comen to Syracuse, þere we dwelled three dais. Ande fro þeþenþen S.P. þeyn D. we passed abowte, ande come vnto Regyum: ande efter þo mydday whanne þo souþe blewe, þo secunde day we
come to Puteolos: where we fonde breþer, ande þei preyd vs fortoto S.P.D. dwelle wiþ hem seuen dais: ande so come we vntoto S.P.D. Rome. Ande whanne þo breþer þere harde of oure comynge, þei come agayne vs vntoto S.P.D. þo merket of Appii, þo senator; ande whanne Poule se hem, he þanked God, ande toke gode traiste. Ande whanne we wore comen vntoto S.P.D. Rome, Poule was suffurd to dwelle wiþouten þo castels bi hymseluen wiþ oneoute S.P.D. knyghte to kepe hym. Ande efter þo thridde daye he called togider þo firste of þo Iewes: ande whanne þei wore comen togider, he saide vntoto S.P.D. hem, Ȝhe menmyn P., breþer, I haue done no þinge agayne þo pupil of þo Iewes, or agayn eldarelderys S.P.D. doynge. Ande fro Ierusalem I am bitaken bownden into þo hende of þo Romaynes; & whanne þei hade aschinge of me, þei wolde haue laten me go, for þei fonde no cause of deþe in me. Ande for þo Iewes agayn-saide þat I schulde noghte be delyuerde, þerfore was I gartenedyd to S.P.D. forto appele vntoto S.P.D. þo Cesar; noghte forto accuse my nacione. Ande for þis cause I praide forto see ȝowe, ande forto speke wiþ ȝowe: forwhi for þo hope of Israel I am vmgyuenvmgyuen or om. S.P.D. (or, bounden) with þis cheyne. Ande þei saide vntoto S.P.D. hym, We toke neuer lettures fro þo Iewry ofwiþ crossed through and of inserted above the line, D. þe, nor none comande to vs haues tolde vs any dede or illeyuel S.P.D. of þe. Bot we prey þeþe þe C., þat we may here of þeof þe in marg. C., what þow can ande felys. For of þoþis S.P.D. secte es knowne þat in iche place hit es withstande. Ande whanne he hade sette hem a daye, many come vntoto S.P.D. hise hostage þer he dwelled; vntoto S.P.D. whom he expowned, witnessande þo kengdome of God, ande makande skilles to hem of Iesu, of þo lawe of Moisy, ande of þo prophetes, fro þo morne vnto þo euento euen S.P.D.. Ande summe trowed vnto þooto þat S.P.D. þat he saide, ande summe trowed noghte. Ande whanne þei wore not assentande togider, þei lernedlernyd of crossed through with wenten wey in marg. in a later hand, S. wentyn here wey P. of Pouleseyenge follows, P. saynghe in a later hand, in marg. S. o worde þat welesecond e erased, S. þo Holigoste speke by Isaye þo prophete vntoto S.P.D. oure fadirs, sayande, Go to þis puple,
ande saye vntoto S.P.D. hem, Ȝhe schal here wiþ ere, ande ȝhe schal noghte vnderstande; ande ȝhe seande schal se, ande ȝhe schal noghte biholde: for þo hertehertys S.P.D. of þis puple es hardendehardyd S.P.D., ande wiþ eres heuely þei han harde. Ande þer eyne þai hanom. S.P.D. lokked togider; þat in aunter þei se noghte wiþ eyne, ande here with eres, ande vndurstonde with herte, forto turne hem, þat I hele hem. Ande þerfore be hit knowne vntoto S.P.D. ȝowe, þat þisis S.P.D. helfulle þingeses erased, S. es sende vntoto S.P.D. naciones: ande þei schal here hit. Ande Poule dwelled alle þat two ȝhere in þat place þat he hired, ande receyued alle þat come to hym, þo Iewes, ande þo nacionesgrekes P, on erasure, 1st corr. S. þat wore calledclepyd S.P.D. gentiles, prechande þo kengdame of God, ande techande þingesom. S.P.D. þat ben of oure Lorde Iesu Criste wiþ fulle traiste wiþouten lettyngeExplicit follows, C.S.P., in marg. nearly erased, D. MS. C. ends here..

Matheuheading, Mathew D. seiþ in þe firste chapytyl on þis wyse in þe book of þe kynrede of Iesu Crist, þe sone of Dauid, þe sone of Abra|ham. Abraham gate Ysaac, & Ysaac gate Iacob. Iacob gate Iudam & his breþeren. Iudas gate Phares & Zaram of Thamar. Phares gate Esron. Esron gate Aram. Aram gate Amynadab. Amynadab gate Naason. Naason gate Salmon. Salmon gate Booz of Raabra on erasure, S. rachab D.. Booz gate Obed of Ruth. Obed gate Iesse. Iesse gate Dauid þe kyng. Dauid þe kyng gate Salomon of hire þat was Vryes wyf. Salomon gate Roboam. Roboas gate Abyam. Abyas gate Asa. Asa gate Iosaphath. Iosophath gate Ioram. Ioram gate Ozyam. Ozyas gate Ioathan. Ioathas gate Achas. Achaz gate Ezechyam. Ezechyas gate Manassen. Manassen gate Amon. Amon gate Iosyam. ,Iosyas gate Iechonyam. Iechonyas gate Salatyel. Salatyel gate Zorobabel. Zorobabel gate Abiud. Abiud gate Eliachym. Eliachym gate Azor. Azor gate Sadoc. Sadoc gate Achym. Achym gate Eliud. Eliud
gate Eleasar. Eleasar gate Mathan. Mathan gate Iacob. Iacob gate Ioseph þe housbonde of Marye, of whom was bore Iesus þe whuche is clepyd Crist. Alle þe kynredys fro Abraham to Dauid beþ fourtene; and fro Dauid to þe goynge oute of Babilon [fourtene; and fro þe goynge out of Babilon]D. to Crist fourtene. Soþly þe generacyoun (or, kynrede) of Crist was on þis manere: whan Marye þe moder of Iesu was weddid to Ioseph, or þei come to-gyder scheȝhe P. was founde hauynge in hire wombe of þe Holy Gost. For-soþe Ioseph hire housbonde, for he was ryȝtwys, he wolde not opynly sclawnder hire, but pryuely he wolde haue left hire. Soþly whyle he was þenkyngeþinkynge D. þese þinges for-to leue his wyf, loo, an aungel of oure Lord apperyd to hym in sleep, seyenge, Ioseph, þe sone of Dauid, ne wyle þ[ou]D. þe S.P. not drede to take Marye þy weddid wyf: forsoþe þat þing þat is bore in hire is of þe Holy Gost. Soþly scheȝhe P. schal bere a sone, & þou schalt nempne his name Iesus; forsoþe he schal make his puple safe fro þe synnys of hem. Soþly þis was done, þat þat þing schulde be fulfild þe whuche was seyd by þe prophete, seyenge on þis wyse, Lo, a mayden schal haue in hire wombe, & scheȝhe P. schal bere a sone, & his name schal be clepyd Emanuel; þat is, God is wiþ us (or, God schal be wiþ us). Soþly Ioseph rysynge up fro his sleep dide as þe aungel comawndid hymto him D., & he tooke Marye his wyfe; and he knewe hire not (þat is to seye, fleschly)gloss om. P. tulto D. scheȝhe P. bare hire sone first bygete: & sche clepyd his name Iesus.

HerforeWerfore P. whan Iesus was bore in Bethlem of þe Iewery in þe dayes of kyng Heroude, loo, þe kynges come fro þe est to Ierusalem, seyenge, Where is he þat is bore þe kyng of Iewys? soþly we sawe a sterre of hym in þe est, & we come to wurschupe hym. Soþly kyng Heroud herynge was troublyd in herte, & alle Ierusalem wiþ hym. & he gederyd alle þe princes of prestis & þe wyse men of þe puple, & he enqueryd of hem where Crist schulde be bore. And þei seyde to hym, In Betleem of þe Iewrye: for-why so it is
wryte by þe prophete, & þou Betleem, in þe lond of þe Iewrye, þou art not leest in princes of þe Iewry (þat is to seyeP. say in marg. later hand, S. om. D., Þou cyte Betlem, þou art not holde to be lest among alle þe cytees of þe Iewry, but most of dignite): for soþly out of þe schal goo a dewke (a ledere), þe whuche schal gouerne my peple Israel. Þan pryuely Heroud callyd þe kynges, & bysyly he enqueryd of hem þe tyme of þe sterre þe whuche apperid to hem; & he seyde sendenge hem into Betlem, Goo ȝe, & bysyly enquere ȝee of þe chylde; þat whan ȝe haue founden hym, telle ȝee me aȝeyn, þat I come & wurschupe hym also. Þese þre kynges, whan þei had herd þe kyng Heroud, þei wente þer weye; & lo, þe sterre þat þei sawe in þeom. D. est wente byfore hem, vnto suche tyme þat it come & stode aboue where þe chyld was. Soþly þei seynge þe sterre were ioyeful; & wiþ greta gret D. ioye þei entrede in-to þe hous & fownden þe chyld wiþ Mary his moder; & þei feldenfellen P. down worschypynge hym; & þei openyde þer tresoris & offrede to hym ȝyftys, gold & encense & myrre; & toke in slepe an answere þat þei schulde not turne aȝeyn by Herode. By a-noþer weye þei turnyd aȝeyn in-to her cuntrey. & whan þei were gon aȝeyn, lo, an angel of oure Lord apperyd to Ioseph in his sleep, seyenge, Ryse up & take þe chyld & his modir, & fle into Egypt, & be þere vn-to suche tyme þat I warne to þee: for-soþe it is for-to come þat Herode sekeþ þe chyld to loseleese P. (or, to sle) hym. Þan Ioseph rysynge toke þe chyld & his moder in þe nyȝt, & he wente in-to Egypt; & he was þere vnto þe deyenge of Herode: þat þatþt he P. schulde be fulfylde þat was seyde of God by þe prophete, seyenge, Fro Egypt I callyd my sone. Þan Herode, seynge þat he was bygylyd of þe kynges, he was ful wroþ, & sende in-to Betlem, & slow alle þe chyldren þat were in Betlem & in alle þe costys bysyde, þat were of two ȝeer & wiþinne, after þe tyme þat he hadde souȝt of þe kynges. & þanne was fulfillyd þat was seyd by Ieremye, A voyce was herd in hye, gretynge & mychil waymentynge, Rachel wepynge her sones; and
scheȝhe P. wolde not be comfortyd for þei were noȝt (quic)underlined, S.P.D.. Þus whan Herode was deed, loo, an aungel of oure Lord appered to Ioseph in sleep in Egypt, seyenge, Ryse & take þe chyld & þe moder of hym, & go in-to þe lond of Israel: for soþly þei beþ deed þat souȝte þe chyldes lyf. & Ioseph roos & toke þe chyld & his moder, & he come into þe lond of Israel. Soþly he herynge þat Archelausarchelanus S.P. n expunged, S. regned in þe Iude for Herode his fadir, he dredde for hym to go þider. & Ioseph was amonestyd in his sleep by an aungel how he schulde go in-to þe partys (þat is, to þe cuntrey) of Galyle, & come & duellyd in a cytee þe whuche is called Nazareth: þat þat þing schulde be fulfylde þat was seyd by þe prophetys, For|soþe, he schal be called Nazarene (þat is to seye, holy).

SoþlyCm 3m in marg. S. Cm 3 D. in þo dayes Ion baptist come, prechynge in þe wyldernes (or, in þe desert) of þe Iewrye, & seyenge, Do ȝe penawnce; for soþly þe kyngdom of heuene schal come nyȝ. Soþly þis is he of whom it was seyd by Ysaye þe prophete, seyenge, A voyce of a cryere in wildernesse, make ȝe redy þe weye of oure Lord. Make ȝe ryȝt stretisþe str. D. (or elles, streyȝte þe weyes) of hym. Soþly he Ion had cloþinge of þe heer of camels, & a gyrdil of a skyn aboute his lendes; soþly his metete above the line, S. was hony-sokkles & hony of þe wode. Þan wente out to hym Ierusalem, & al þe Iewry, & al þe cuntrey aboute Iurdane; & þei were baptyzed of hym in Iordan, schryuynge here synnys. Soþly he seynge many of þe Pharysees & of þe Saduceus comynge to þe baptem, he seyde to hem, Ȝe kynredes of þe nedderis, who schewyd to ȝow for-to fle fro þe wraþþe þat is for-to come? Do ȝe worþi fruyte of penawnce: & wyle ȝe not sey wiþinne ȝoure-self (þat is, in ȝoure hertys), We haue a fader Abraham: soþly I sey to ȝow, þat God is myȝty of þise stonys to rererere up P. þe sones of Abraham. Soþly now þe ax is sett to þe rote of þe tree: þerfore eche tree þe whuche makeþ not good fruyt it schal be kutt downe, & it schal be sent in-to þe fyre. For-soþe I baptyze ȝow in water
in-to penawnce: soþly he þat is for-to come after me is stal-worþere þan I, whooswhas D. schoo I am not worþi to berecrossed out, with vnbynde in marg. in a later hand, S. vnbynde P.: soþly he schal baptyze ȝow in þe Holy Gost & in fyre: whoswhas D. wyndelcrossed through, with wynnwe in marg. in a later hand, S. wynuwe P. is in his honde, & heom. P. schal clense fully his korne; & he schal gedere his korne in-to his berne, & soþly þe chaff he schal brenne in a fyre þat may not be slekked. Þanne come Iesus fro Galyle in-to Iordan to Ion, þat he schulde be baptyzed of hym. Soþly Ion forbeed hym, seyenge, I fel to be baptyzed of þee, & þou comest to me? Soþly Iesus ansuerynge seyde to hym, Suffre now: for on þis manere it bysemeþ us for-to fulfylle al ryȝtwysnesse. Þan he lyte hym (orlyte hym or crossed through, S. om. P., suffred hym). Soþly Iesus baptyzed wente soone up fro þe water: & lo, þe heuenes were opene, & he saw þe Spiryte of God comynge down as a doufe upon hym; & lo, a voyce of heuene seyenge, Þis is my Sone wel loued, in whom I am wel plesed.

Þanne Iesus was led in-to desert þorow a spiryte þere he schulde be temptyd of þe deuel. And whanne he had fastyd fourty dayes & fourty nyȝtys, afterward he hungred. & þe temptere comynge to hym seyde to hym, If þou art Godes sone, sey þat þise stones be maade loues. Crist answerynge seyde, It is wryte þat not onlyche in breed lyueþ man, but in eche word þat comeþ of Godes mouþ. Þan þe fende toke hym in-to þe holy cyte; & putte hym aboue þe penacle of þe temple, & seyde to Crist, If þou art Godes sone, sendþt he schulde make D, in S. crossed through with send in marg., in a later hand. þy-selfhymself D., corrected to þyself, S. adownea on erasure, S. downe D.: soþly it is wryte of þee, for God bad his aungelys of Crist to kepe þeon erasure, S. him D. in here hondys, as in awntyr þou herte þi foot to þe stone. Iesus seyde to hym, Eft it is wryte, Þou schalt not tempte þe Lord þi God. Eft þe fend toke hym in-to a ful hyȝ hille, & he schewed to hym alle þe kyngdomes of þe worlde, & þe ioye of hem; & seyde to hym, Alle þese þinges I schal ȝeue þeeto þee D., ȝif þou falle & loute [to]P me. And þanne seyde Iesus to þe fend, Go
awey, Sathanas; for it is wryte, Þe Lord þi God þou schalt worschupe, & to hym one þou schalt serue. Þan þe fend lefte Crist; & lo, goode aungelys comyn to hym & serued to hym. Whan Iesus herde þat Ion was put in-to prysoun, he ȝede in-to Galyle; & þeom. P. cyte of Nazareth lefte, he come & duellyd in Capharnaum, by-syde þe see, in þe cuntreyes of Zabulon & of Neptalym: þat it schulde be fulfylde þat was seyde by Ysaye þe prophete, Lond of Zabulon & lond of Neptalym, þe wey of þe see byȝonde Iordane, of þe folke of Galyle; þe folke þe whuche ȝede in derkenesse sawe gret lyȝt, & to þe syttynge in þe rewme of schadowe of deeþ, lyȝt was rysen to hem. After þat Iesus bygan to preche, & seyde, Do ȝe penawnce; for soþly, þe kyngdom of heuene schal come nyȝ. & soþly Iesus wente by-syde þe se of Galile. He sawe two breþeren, Symon þe whuche is cleped Peter, & Andrew his broþer, puttynge a nett in-to þe see; soþly þei were fyscheris. & he seyde to hem, Come ȝe after me, & I schal make ȝow to be fyscherys of men. & þei a-noon lefte þer nettes & þe schyp, & sueden hym & he wente forþ frofro twice, D. þen & saw oþer two, Iame þe sone of Zebede, & Ion his broþer, in schype wiþ Zebede þer fader, makynge redy þer nettys; & he clepyd hem. Soþly þei left þer nettys & her fader, & folowed hym. & Iesus wente aboute alom. P. Galyle, prechynge & techynge hem in here synagoges þe gospel of þe kyngdom of heuene, & helynge alle sorowes & alle sekenesse in þe peple. & þe knowynge of hym wente in-to al Sirry: & þei offred to hym alle hauynge yuel, in dyuers sekenes & tor|mentys taken, & þo þat hadde fendus wiþ-inne hem, & hem þat were lunatyke, & men þat had þe palsy, & he helyd hem. & many cumpanyes sueden hym, & men of Galyle, & of Decapoly (þat is to seye, of þat cuntrey þat hadde ten cytees)underlined, S.P., & of Ierusalem, & of þe Iewry, & of men fro ouer Iordane.

Soþly Crist seynge þe peple, he wente up in-to an hylle: & whan he had sette hym downe, his discyplys come to hym: ,& he openynge his mowþe tauȝttauȝt in marg. 1st corr.; in text tauthe in a late hand on erasure, S. tauȝte P. techinge D. hem, seyenge, Blessyd be
pore in speryte: for here is þe rewme of heuenes. Blessyd be þe mylde: for þei schal haue þe lond of lyf. Blessyd be þei þat waylen: for þei schal be comfortyd. Blessyd be þei þat hungren & þrusten ryȝtwysnes: for þei schal be fulfyllyd. Blessyd be mercyful men: for þei schal swe mercy. ,Blessyd be men of clene herte: for þei schal se God. Blessyd be pesyble men: for þei schal be cleped Godes chyldren. Blessyd be þeyȝe D. þ. y added later, S. þat suffren purswynge for ryȝtwysnes: for here is þe rewme of heuenes. Blessyd schal ȝe be whan þat men schal curse ȝow, & whan þei haue purswed ȝow, & whan þei haue seyd al yuel aȝeyns ȝow, lyȝenge, for me. Ioye ȝe, & be glad: for ȝoure hyre is muche in heuene: soþly so þei haue purswed þe prophetis þat were byfore ȝow. Ȝe beþ salt of þe erþe: & ȝif þe salt vanysche awey, in what þing schal þe erþe be saltyd? þis salt is not worþi after, but to be cast oute & be defoulyd of men. Ȝe ben lyȝt of þe world. A cytee sett on an hylle may not be hyd. Nor men lyȝte not a lanterne & putte it vndir a buschel, but þei sette it on a kandelsteke, þat it ȝeue lyȝt to alle þat beþ in þe hous. & so schyne ȝoure lyȝt byfore men, þat þei se ȝoure goode werkes, & so þanke ȝoure Fadir þat is in heuene. Wele ȝe not gesse þat I come to loselese P. þe lawe ne prophetys: I come not to vn-do hem, but for-to fylle hem. Soþly I seye to ȝow, To þat heuene & erþe passe, an i ne a tytyl schal not passe fro þe lawe byfore alle þinges be done. Þerfore who doþ not on of þe leeste comawndementis, he schal be cleped leest in þe kyngdom of heuene; and soþly he þat doþ þes comawnde|mentes & techeþtechiþ hem D., he schal be cleped greet in þe kyngdom of heuene. Soþly I sey to ȝow, But if ȝoure ryȝtewysnes habounde more þan ofof scribis P, in late hand, in marg. S. þeseþe P; þese...lawe underlined, S.P. wyse men of þe lawe & ofabove the line, S. om. D. þe Pharyseus, ȝe schal not entre in-to þe kyngdom of heuene. Soþly ȝe haue herd þat it is seyd to men of þe olde lawe, Þou schalt not sle; forsoþe hein margin, S. þat sleþ, he schal be coupable in þe dome; soþly I sey to ȝow, þat who-soþat P. is wroþ
to his broþer, he schal be gylty toon erasure, 1st corr. S. in D. þe dome; soþly he þat haþ seydseyþ for haþ seyd, P. to his broþer, Raca, he schal be gylty toon erasure, 1st corr. S. in D. þe counseyl; soþly he þat haþ seydseyþ for haþ seyd, P. to his broþer, Þou foole, he is worþi þe fyre of helle. Þerfore if þou brynge þi ȝifte to þe auter, & þere þou hast byþouȝt þee þat þi broþer haþ sum þinge aȝeyns þee, leeue þi ȝifte þere byfore þe auter, & go ferst to be reconsyled to þi broþer (þat is, be at on wiþ þi broþer), & þanne þou schalt come & offre þi ȝifte. Be þou assentynge soone to þyn enemy, þe whylis þou art in þe wey wiþ hym, en awnter þyn enemy take þee to þe domus-man, & þe domes-man bytake þee to þe jayleer, & þou be putt in-to prysown. Soþly I sey to þee, Þou schalt not go oute fro þi prysoun, to þou hafe ȝeue aȝeyn þe leste ferþing. Ȝe haue herd þat it was seyd to þe olde men, Þou schalt not do auowtrye: soþly I sey to ȝow, þat eche man þat haþ sey a womman & coueytecoueytiþ D. for-to haf hire, he haþ dondoþ P. auowtrye wiþ hire in his herte. If it soso it P. be þi ryȝt eyȝe sclawndir þee, drawe it oute, & caste it fro þee: for soþly it is more spedynge to þee þat one of þi membres per-sche, þan al þi body be sente in-to helle. & ȝif þi ryȝt hond sclawnder þee, kutte it a-wey, & caste it fro þee: for soþly it spedeþ to þee, þat raþere on of þi membris persche þan al þi body go in-to helle. Soþly it is seyd to olde men, Whoso lefeþ his wyf, hym byhoueþ ȝefe to hire a lybel of forsakyng: soþly yit (changed into y) is (dotted out) sey with erasure of d, S. sey to ȝow, þat eche man þat lefeþ his wyf, outetake cause of fornycasyoun, he makeþ hire to do avowtrye: & he þat weddeþ hire þat is left of hire housbonde, heom. D. doþ avowtrye. Eft ȝe hafe herd þat it was seyd to þe olde men, Þou schalt not forswere þee, for þou schalt ȝefe to God þi swerynge: but soþly it is seydI sey D. to ȝow noȝt to swere in eny manere; neyþer by heuene, for it is þeD ends with for it is þe written as catchwords at the bottom of fol. 7b. trone of God; neyþer by þe erþe, for it is scaffold of his feet; noyþer by Ierusalem, for it is þe cyte of þe grete Kyng. Nor þou schalt not swere by þin heuyd, for þou mayst not make one heer whȝit or blak.
Soþly ȝoure worde schal be, ȝe, ȝe; or nay, nay; soþly what so is more þan þis, it is of yuel. Ȝe hafe herd þat it was seyd, Eyȝe for eyȝe, & a toþ for a toþ (þat is to seye, a man schulde be punysched in þe same membre in þe whuche he disseyfede his neyȝebores)gloss underlined, S.P.: but soþly I sey to ȝow nouȝt toom. P. wiþstonde þe yuel: but whoso smyteþ þee in þe ryȝt cheke, ȝif to hym þeþt P. toþer. & whoso wyle stryue wiþ þee in þe dome, & take fro þee þi kote, lefe þou to hym also þi palle. & whoso angreþ þee a þousande paas, go wiþ hym oþer two þousande. And whoso wyle borowe of þee, ne turne þou not awey. ,Ȝe hafe herd þat it was tolde to olde men, Þou schalt loue þi frend, & þou schalt hate þin enemy. But soþly I sey to ȝow, Loue ȝe ȝowre enemyes, do ȝe good to hem þat haten ȝow, & preye ȝe for hem þat purswen ȝow, & chalange ȝow falsly; þat ȝeom. P. be þe sones of ȝoure Fadir þat is in heuene, þat makeþ his sunne sprynge on goode men & yuele, & reyneþ up-on iuste men & vniuste. For if ȝe louen hem þat loueþ ȝow, what meede schal ȝe haue? siþ puplycans don þus. & if ȝe greten only ȝoure breþeren, what schal ȝe do more? Ne don not heþene men þus? Þerfore be ȝe parfyte, as ȝoure Fadur of heuene is parfyte.

& take ȝe heede þat ȝe do not ȝoure ryȝtwysnesse byfore men, to be seyn of hem: for elles schal ȝe haue no mede at ȝoure Fadir þat is in heuene. And þerfore whan þou dost þyn almes, nele þou not trumpe byfore þee, as ypocritys don in synagoges & stretis, for-to be wor|schuped of men. Soþly I sey to ȝow, Þei haue resseyuyd here mede. But whan þou dost þyn almes, loke þi lyft syde wyte noȝt what þi ryȝt syde doþ: þat þyn almes be in hyd: & þi Fader þat seþ in hyd schal ȝeue þee hyremede P..

Andnew paragraph with initial, S.P. whan ȝe preyȝen, ȝee schal not ben as ypocrytys, þat louen to stonde in churches & in kornerys of stretys to preyȝe, for-to ben seyn holyunderlined, S. of men. Soþly I sey to ȝow, Þese men han resceyued here mede. But þou, whan þou schalt preye, entre in-to þi couche, & schytt þe dore, & pray þy Fader, and þy Fader þat seeþ in hyd schal ȝelde þee þi meede. Soþly ȝe prayenge wele ȝe not speke mychyl, as
heþyn menh...n men on erasure, in a later hand, S. doþ, for soþly þei wene þat þei schule be herd in hire myche speche. Þerfore wele ȝeom. P. noȝt be lyckenyd to hem; for-why ȝowre heuenly Fader wot what þing is nedeful to ȝow, byfore þat ȝee aske hym. Þerfore ȝee schal preye on þis manere: Oure Fader þat art in heuene, halewed be þi name. Þi kyngdom come to us. Þi wylle be don, as in heuene, & in erþe. Oure eche dayes breed ȝeue us to day. & forȝeue us oure dettys, as we forȝeue oure dettourys. And neexpunged, S. om. P. lede us not in temptacyon, but delyuere us of yuel.

DIV1.HEAD: APPENDIX I. The Catholic Epistles of MS. Bodl. Douce 250.

DIV3.P: Iamys þe seruaunt of God & of oure Lord Iesu Criste, to þe twelue kynredis þat beþ spred a-brode, gretynge wel. My deere breþeren, wite ȝee & hopeþ alle ioye whanne þat ȝe been in many temptacyonus, wite ȝee wel þat prouynge of ȝoure feiþ worcheþ pacyence. Pacience soþeliche haþ a parfyte worke, þat ȝee be parfit & hole, faylynge in no þinge. & whuche of ȝow so haþ nede of wysdom, aske of God þat ȝeueþ plentyuously to alle, & withstonde him nouȝte, & it schal be ȝoue to him. Aske he soþely in feiþ, nouȝte faylynge: for soþely he þat is faylynge (þat is, faylynge in þe feiþ)Underlined in red ink. he is lyke to þe flowynge of þe see þe whuche is meuyd wiþ þe wynde & bore a-boute. & þerfore trowe he noȝt þat is suche a man eny þinge to take of God. A man of double wille is vnstable in alle weyes. Soþely make he ioye þat is a meke broþer in his hye state, a riche man soþely make ioye in his mekenesse. For as þe floure of þe heyȝe schal he passe. Soþely þe sunne wiþ his hete dryeþ the heyȝe; [& hi]sMS. defaced here. floure fallith, & þe fayrnesse of his semblante peryschiþ: so schal þe riche man in his weyes wexe drye.

Blessid is þat man þat suffreþ temptacyon: for whanne he is prouyd, he schal take þe coroune of lyf þat God haþ byhote to hem þat louen him. No man whan he is temptud seiþ, I am tempted of God: soþely God is an vntemptar of wickede men, soþely he tempteþ no man. But echone for-soþe is temptyd, of his desyris wiþ-drawen, & oute of him|self ledde. & so whan wille haþ conseyuyd, it bryngeþ forþ synne: soþely synne whan it is endyd engendereþ deeþ. & þerfore, my lefe breþeren, ne wele ȝee noȝt erre. Alle þe beste þing þat is ȝeue & alle parfite ȝefte it is from a-boue, comynge down from þe Fadir of lyȝte, wiþ whom is no chaungynge, ne no derknesse of synne. Soþely wiþ his good fre wille he gate us þurgh þe word of soþfastnesse, þat we be some bygynnynge of his creature. Wyte ȝee, my deere loued breþeren, be euery man smert for-to here & late for-to speke & late vn-to yre: soþely þe wraþþe of man wurcheþ noȝt þe riȝtwisnesse of God. & þerfore kastynge a-wey alle vnclennesse & abundaunce of malice, [in]MS. &. myldenesse takeþ to drynke þe word, þat may saue ȝoure soulis.

Beþ also doeres of þe word & wyrcheres, but not only þe hereres, disceyuynge ȝoure-selfe. For who-so is herere of Godes worde, & not doere, he may be lykkened to a man þat byldeþ þe semblaunt of his birþe in a myroure: he byhelde him soþly, & ȝede a-wey, & a-noon he haþ forȝete what he was. For-soþe he þat lokeþ in þe lawe of parfite frenesse, and dwelliþ þer-inne, he is not maked a forȝetful hyrer, but a doere of þe worke: here in his deede he schal be blessid. Soþely who-so wenyþ him-self þat he be religyous, noȝt wiþ-holdynge his tunge but disseyuynge his herte, veyne is his religyoun. Clene religioun & vnfiled as to God & þe Fadur is þis, to vysite fadurles children, & wydows in here tribulacyoun, & from al þis worlde to kepe hem clene, vnfouled.Capitulum ii follows.

My breþeren, ne wele ȝe noȝt be oute-takeres of persones (þatgl... in margin. is, take mannys persone in more state a-ȝens God for his hye kyn, ne for his riches, ne powere in þis worlde, hauynge feiþ þat God takeþ more hede to hem for here gentil kyn, or here grete richesse, or here muchel myȝt, or here sotil witte þan he doþ to þe pore þat loueþ him as welle)g. & þerfore if eny man come in-to ȝoure siȝt (that is, in-to ȝoure cumpenye þat beþ Godes religiouse men in what degre so ȝe be)underlined in red ink., þe whuche haþ gold rynge on his fynger & schynynge cloþus, & anoþer pore man in symple & feble cloþinge come also to ȝow; & ȝe take hede to him þat is in schynynge cloþinge, & ȝe sey to him, Sitte þou here wel a-boue; & soþely to þe pore ȝe seye, Þou stonde þere, or sitte vndir þe stole of oure fete; in þis ȝoure-self beþ demed, & ȝee beþ maked iustises of ȝoure wickede þouȝtes.

Hereþ & take hede, my ful welle loued breþeren; ne haþ not God chosen þe pore in þis worlde to be riche in þe feiþ, & eyres of þe kyngdom, þat God haþ by-hyȝt to alle þat him loueþ. & soþly ȝee vnworschupe þe pore. Ne ouerlye nouȝt þe riche ȝow þorow here power? & þei drawe ȝow to domes. Ne blasfeme þei nouȝt þe goode name þat is ouer ȝow called? (þat is, cristene men of Criste)underlined in MS.. Nouȝt forþi if þou fulfille þe kynges lawe of heuene aftir holy writte, Þou schalt loue þi neyȝebore ryȝt as þi-self, þan þou doost wel, soþeli if ȝee any mennys persones accepte, þan ȝee doon gret synne, & ȝee schal be blamyd of God as trespaseres aȝeyn þe lawe. Who-so-euere soþly keepe al þe lawe, & trespaseþ in o þinge, þat is forbodyn in þe lawe, he is maked gilty of alle. For he þat bad ȝow not synne in leccherye, he bad þat þou schuldest not slee. If þat þou do no leccherye, and sleist any man, þou art þanne trespasere & brekere of þe lawe. So speke ȝee, & so dowte ȝee, so þat by þe lawe of frenes (þat is, þe lawe of mercy)underlined in MS. ȝee schal mowe be demed. For soþly to him þat dooþ no mercy schal be do[m]e wiþ-oute mercy: but soþly mercy ouergoþ dome. What schal profyte to man, my lef breþeren, ȝif eny seye þat he haþ feiþ, & he soþely haue nouȝt þe deede? ne may not feiþ saue him? Soþly if eny broþer or sister ben naked, & neden eche day sustynaunce, and if eny of ȝow sey to hem, Goþ forþ in pees, & be ȝee hole & ȝee fedde; & ȝee ȝeue hem nouȝt þat nedeful is to here body, what schal it profyte hem?
Ryȝt so feiþ, if it haue nouȝt deedis, it is dede in it-self. But some seiþ, Þou hast feiþ, & I haue dedis: schewe me þi feiþ wiþ-outen werkes, & I schal schewe þe my feiþ þorow my werkes. Þow trowest þat þer is o God, þou doost weel: & deueles trowe it & quaken. Þou veyne man, wilt þou wite, how þat feiþ wiþ-outen werkes is deed? Abraham oure fadur ne was he noȝt þorw his werkes maked ryȝtwyse, offerrynge Ysaac his sone on an auter? Lo, hou feiþ was wrouȝt þorow his deedis, & þorow werkes feiþ is endid; & þe scripture is fulfillid þat seiþ, Abraham trowed to God, & it is putt him to riȝtwisnesse; & he is clepid Godis freend. Now ȝe se how þat man is maked riȝtwyse þorow his werkes, & nouȝt only þorow feiþ. On þe same wyse also Raab þe hore ne is sche not maked riȝtwyse þorow here werkesnota in margin., takynge messageres, & by oþer weye kastynge a-wey wickednesse? Soþly riȝt as þe body wiþ-outen þe soule is deed, so is feiþ wiþ-outen good werkes deed.

My deere breþeren, ne wyle ȝe not be maked many maystris, wytynge þat ȝee take þe more dome. We alle forsoþe haue offendid in many þingis. Who-so trespasiþ not in his word, he is here a parfyte man; he may al-so wiþ a brydul lede a- boute al his body. Soþely if we putte brydulis in mowþes of horses to make hem to be at oure wille, we beren a-boute al þe body of hem. & thouȝ it so be þat scheppis be grete & wiþ grete wyndis þei been dreuen, soþly wiþ a lytul stere, wiþ hasty gouernynge of him þat ledeþ it, it is bore a-boute. Riȝt so þe tunge soþly a litul membre it is, & gret þinges it makeþ hyȝe. Loo, how litul fyre how grete a wode it brenneþ! And oure tunge is fyre, is alle manere of wickednes; þe tunge is ordeyned in oure membris, þe whuche defouliþ al þe body; & it brenneþ þe roote of oure birþe in flawme of helle fyre. Soþely alle þe kyndes of bestes, & of foulès, & of nedderis, & of alle oþere, beþ maked tame & beþ tamed of mankynde: soþely tunge no man may make tame, ful of vnpeisyble yuel & deedly venym. In it we blesse oure Fadur God, & in it we mysseye men, þat aftir þe ymage of God beþ maked: & of þat same mowþe goþ forþe blissynge & cursynge. My breþeren, it is not by|houeful þat þese þinges so be. Ne oute of þe hole of a welle ne goþ noȝt forþe bittir watir & swete to-gedur? My breþeren, þe fyge-tre ne may not brynge forþe grapes, or þe vyne-tre fyges: so no more may salt watur make swete watur. Who-so is wyse & wel tauȝt a-monges ȝow, schewe he of his goode lyuynge his werke in myldenesse of wysdome. Ȝif þat ȝee haue bittur loue & stryuynges in ȝoure hertis, ne make ȝee no ioye & be lyeres aȝens soþfastnes. Soþely þis wysdom is not comynge from a-boue, but erþely, bestlyche, deuellyche. Forsoþe wherso enuye is & strif, þer is vnstabulnes & eche schrewed deede. Soþely þat wytte þat is of a-bouen first forsoþe it is clene, & aftur þat peysyble, mylde to a-moneste, assentynge to þe goode, ful of mercy & of good fruyte, schew|ynge wiþoute fals colourynge. Soþely þe fruyte of riȝtwysnes is sowen in pees to hem þat dooþ pees.

Where-of comeþ bataylis & stryues amonges ȝow? ne comeþ þei
not of ȝoure desyris þat fyȝtten in ȝoure membres? Ȝee desyre & ȝee ne haue it noȝt: ȝe slee, & ȝee haue enuye, & ȝee may not gete it: ȝee streuen & ȝeuen batayle, & ȝee ne haue it nouȝt wherfore þat ȝee aske. Ȝee asken & ȝee gete it not, for as muchel as ȝee yuel aske, to dwelle stille in ȝoure desyres. Auoutoures, ne wite ȝee not þat loue of þis worlde is enmy to God? whoso-euere þerfore wolde be frend of þis worlde, he is ordeynyd þe enmy of God. Or ellis wene ȝee þat holy write be seyde in-veynelyche? to enuy desyreþ þe sperit þat in ȝow dwelleþ. Soþely þe more grace he ȝeueþ. Wherfore seiþ holy writte, God wiþstondiþ þe proude, soþely to meke he ȝeueþ grace. Be ȝee þerfore sogettes to God: & soþly wiþstondeþ þe deuel, & he schal flee fro ȝow. Neyȝeþ ny to God, & wole come to ȝow. Makeþ clene ȝoure synful hondis, and clenseþ ȝoure hertes þat beþ of double wille. Be ȝe nedy, & makeþ sorowe, & wepeþ, & turneþ ȝoure lauȝtre in-to sorowe, & ȝoure ioye in-to mornynge. Make ȝow meke in þe syȝt of God, & he wole make ȝow hye ain life wiþ outen endea-a underlined in MS.. Ne bakbyteþ none of ȝow oþer, my dere breþeren; who-so bakbyteþ his broþer, or demeþ his broþer, he bakbyteþ þe lawe, & demeþ þe lawe: soþely if þow deme þe lawe, þow art not a doere of þe lawe, but a domes|man. On þer is ȝeuer of þe lawe & a domes-man, þe whuche may boþe saue & lese: þow soþly, what art þow þat demest þi neiȝebore? Lo, ȝee þat now seye, To day or to morowe schal we goo in-to þat cytee, & soþely a ȝere wele we þer dwelle, & to marchaundise, & þer we wile gete wyn|nynge: þat knoweþ not what to morwe schal falle. Soþelyche whuche is oure lyfe? Nouȝt but breþe þat lytul whyle lasteþ & scheweþ, & also sone it is ended. Þerfore ȝe may seye, If God wule, or, If I leue we schal do þis or þat. Now ȝee make ioye in ȝoure prides, soþeliche alle suche ioye is wicked. Þerfore whoso can do wel & doþ not, it is synne to him.

Do ȝee now, riche men, make sorwe & wepeþ in ȝoure wrecchednes þe whuche schal come vn-to ȝow. Roten beþ maked ȝoure richesses, and ȝoure cloþus wiþ mothes beþ frete. Ȝoure golde & ȝoure seluer rust haþ ouer-goo; & þe ruste of hem schal be a-geynus ȝow in wittnes & schal ete ȝoure flesche as it were þe fyre. Ȝee make ȝow a tresorye of wraþþe in þe laste dayees. Lo, þe hire of ȝoure hyrid men & of ȝoure seruauntis þat þei traueiled fore in ȝoure seruice, þe whuche fro hem ȝe haue wiþ-holden & defrauded, crieþ: & þe cry of hem entrede in-to þe eres of God almyȝty. Fat fedde ȝee beþ upon erþe, & in leccheries ȝe nursched ȝoure hertes in day of sleynge. Ȝee brouȝte forþe & slowe þe riȝtwyse, & he wiþstod ȝow nouȝt. & þerfore, breþeren, beþ sufferynge for þe comynge of oure Lord. Lo, þe tilyere abideþ þe precyouse frute of þe erþe, pacyently abidynge to it haue taken sesoun & þe temperaunce. & þerfore be ȝee sufferynge, & make stalworþe ȝoure hertus, for þe comynge of oure Louerd schal come ny nyȝte. Ne make ȝee no sorwe, breþeren, echone wiþ oþur, þat ȝe be not demed: lo, þe iustyse by-fore þe ȝate stondeþ. Takeþ ensample, my breþeren, of yuel wyndynge, & of þe longenesse, & of traueyle, & þe
suffrynge of prophetis þat spaken in þe name of God. Lo, we blessen hem þat suffrede. Ȝee haue herd þe sufferynge of Iob, & þe ende of oure Lord ȝe seyȝ: for oure Lord is mercyful & forȝeuere. Byfore alle þinge, my breþeren, ne wyle ȝe not swere neiþer by heuene, ne be erþe, ne noon oþer manere othe: loke þat ȝoure word be ȝe, ȝe, nay, nay; þat ȝee falle not vndur dome. If eny of ȝow be heuyed, pray he wiþ stable herte, & ioye he in his heuynes. If eny of ȝow falle seke, brynge he in þe prestes of þe churche, & þat þei preye for him, ennoyntynge him wiþ oyle in þe name of oure Lord: & þe preyȝere of feiþ schal saue þe seke, & oure Lord schal uppreyse him; & if he be in synne, þei beþ forȝeue him. & þerfore schryue ȝow eche to oþur ȝoure synnys, & prayeþ to-gedere, þat ȝe may be safe. Muche soþely auayleþ bysy preyere of þe riȝtwyse. Helye was a man like vnto us, þat myȝte fele noye & suffre, & wiþ prayere he preyed þat it schulde not reyne up-on erþe; & it reyned not þre ȝere and syxe moneþes. & eft he preyede; & heuene ȝaf reyne & þe erþe ȝaf his fruyte. My breþeren, soþely who of ȝow erreþ fro soþfastenesse, & whoso him amendeþ, hym oweþ to wyte, þat he þat made þe synful to be turned fro þe erroure of his weye schal saue his soule fro deeþ, and hydeþ þe mechelnesse of his synnes þat wole turn to him.

TRAILER.HI1: Here endeþ þe pisteles of seynt Jame[s]. And Petrus pisteles now bygynne. Þis is þe firste pistel.

DIV3.P:
Petre, þe apostul ofa large hole in the MS. here. Iesu Criste, vn-to þe chosen comelynges þat beþ spred a-brode of Ponti, of Galathie, of Capadocie, of Asye, and Bythune, aftur þe byfore-knowynge of God þe Fadur, in holynes of spiryte, in buxomnes, in sprenkelynge of þe blode of Iesu Criste. Grace be vn-to ȝow, & pees be multiplied. Blessid be God & þe Fadur of oure Lord Iesu Criste, þe whuche þorow his grete mercy eft-gate us a-ȝeyn in-to a leuynge hope þorow þe resureccyoun of Iesu Criste fro deeþ, in-to þat heritage þat may not be defouled, ne fordone, but is euerelastynge kept in heuene in ȝow, þat in þe vertu of God be keped by feiþ in-to hele maked redy þat on þe laste day schal be schewid; in þe whuche ȝe schul make ioye. Now if it byhoueþ ȝow a litil to be heuyed in dyuerse trybulacyons, þat þe prouynge of ȝoure feiþe be more precious þan gold is þat is proued wiþ þe fyre, þat ȝoure feiþe be founde in worschupe & ioye & honoure in-to þe schewynge of Iesu Crist: whom, if ȝe him not see, ȝee loue him: in whom now þat ȝee see not & trowe; whom, whan ȝee schulde him see, he schal be ȝoure ioye, ȝoure comfort þat may not be tolde, & þat schal be glorifyed, bryngynge aȝeyn þe ende of ȝoure feiþe, hele of ȝoure soulis. Of whuche hele þe prophetes enquered & souȝte, þe whuche prophecyed grace þat was to come in vs: sechynge in what tyme it schulde syngny|fye; þe sperite of Crist, þat was in hem, schewid hem þat beþ in Cristes passyoun what ioye þei schulde haue aftur. & þei mynystrid vn-to ȝow þe þinges þat now beþ schewyd vn-to ȝow by hem þat haue preched vn-to
ȝow þorow þe Holy Gost sent fro heuene; in whom angelis desyre to be|holde. Wherfore drawe uppe ȝoure herte fro wordly lustes, & beþ sobre & parfyte & tristiþ þer-inne, þat is, in schewynge þat grace þat is offrud to ȝou in þe reuelacyon of Iesu Crist; as sones of buxomnes, not lyke to ȝoure firste desyres of ȝoure vnknowynge, but aftir him þat cleped ȝow holy. & be ȝee holy in al ȝoure conuersasyoun; for it is wretyn, Be ȝee holy, for I am holy. & if ȝe clepe him Fadur þat, wiþ-oute rewarde-takynge of eny persone, demeþ echone aftur his deedis, leueþ in drede þe tyme of ȝoure duellynge heere: wetynge weel þat ȝee be noȝt bouȝt wiþ roten seluer, or golde þat soone wyle ruste & rote, of ȝoure veyn lyuynge, þat ȝee of ȝoure formere fadres tooken; but wiþ þe precyouse blood, as of þe lombe wiþ-outyn filþe þat may not be defoulyd, of Iesu Criste. He was knowen of God or euere þe worlde were maade, & afturwarde he was schewyd in þe laste tymys of þe worlde for ȝowe: þat þorow him ȝee be made trewe in God þat reysid him froo deeþ, & ȝafe to him ioye wiþ-outen ende, þat ȝoure feiþe & ȝoure hope schulde be in God, chastysynge ȝoure soules in buxomnes of charite, in loue of breþurhede. Loueþ echone oþur bysyli in lowenes of herte: eft-borne nouȝt of sede þat may be roten, but of þat þat may not be roten, þorow þe word of lyuynge God & lastynge wiþ-outen ende. For al flesch is but as muke or hey, & alle þe ioye of it is as þe floure of hey or of mucke. Þe hey wexiþ drye, & þe floure þer-of felle: but soþely þe word of God lasteþ wiþ-outen ende. And þis word it is þat is preched a-monges ȝow.

Wherefore doþ a-wey alle malice & alle treccherye & alle feynynges & enuyes & alle bakbytynges, as children þat be now bore, koueytynge resonable mylke, wiþ-outen trecherye, þat ȝee helfully wexe þer-wiþ: but not forþi ȝee haf tasted how swete oure Lord is.

Drawe ȝow to him þat is þe leuynge stone, reproued of men, but chosen soþely of God, & honoured; & ȝe as quyke stones beþ maked in worke, in gostly houses, holy presthode, to offure gostly offrynges þat beþ acceptable to God þorow Iesu Criste. Wherfore is conteynyd in holy writtysay in margin., Lo, I schal putte in Syon a stone hyȝest cornarde, precyous and chosen, & eche þat troweþ in him schal not be confounded: þerfore to ȝou þat troweþ, honour: to hem þat troweþ not he is made a stone þat was reproued, & kaste a-wey of hem þat housed, heere he is maked a heued stone in þe corner, (þat is, þat makeþ boþe one in charite)underlined. & he is a stomblynge stone, & to sporne aȝeyn, & a stone of sclawndre to hem þat stumblen þer|aȝeyn þorow worde, & troweþ not; in whom þei beþ putte (þat is, in whom is here dome or þeire sauacyoun putte)underlined.. Ȝe soþeliche beþ a chosen kynrede, ryal presthode, a holy folke, peple i-chose (þat is, gete þorw passyoun & bore þorw bapteme)underlined.; þat ȝe schulde schewe þe vertu of him þat cleped ȝow fro derknesse in-to his merueilouse lyȝt; þe whuche some tyme were not his folke, now soþely ȝe beþ Godes folke; þe whuche some tyme folwyd not aftur mercy, now soþely ȝe folwe þer-aftur.

My deere frendes, I beseche ȝow as comelynge[s] & pilgrymes, þat ȝe
absteyne ȝow fro fleschely desyres, þe whuche stryuen aȝeyn þe sowle; hauynge ȝoure conuersacyoun good a-mong þe gentylis; (þat is, a-mong þe puple þat is not trewely turned, to teche hem boþe in lyuynge & also in ȝoure soule)underlined. þat whanne þei speke yuel of ȝow by-hynde ȝow and sey ȝe beþ yuel-doeris, þat þei may byholde ȝoure good deedis, & so þat þei may wor|schupe God in þe day of vysitynge. Beþ sogettis to alle mannes creature (þat is, to eche man or womman þat is Godes creature)underlined., for God (þat is, for Godes loue in þinges þat beþ lefful wiþ þe wille of God)underlined.: oþur to a kynge, as he þat is ouer þe; oþur to dukes, as to hem þat beþ fro hem sentte to vengeaunce of yuel doeris, & soþely preysynge to good doaris. For so is þe wille of God, þat ȝe make hem þat doþ wel to wexe dombe (þat is, to holde hem stille wiþ-outen preysynge of here good deede, or, on þis wyse)underlined. þat ȝe þat do wel make dou[m]ecf. 2 Pet ii 16; MS. doune. þe vnkonyngenesse of vnwyse men (þat is to mene, þat ȝe þorw ȝoure good lyf & ȝoure good speche & sufferynge ȝyfe suche ensample to þe vnwise recheles, þat þei may take ensample, & so of here yuel wordes & deedus waxe dombe)underlined.; as ȝe þat beþ fre, & not as þei þat haue filþe of chorlhede (þat is, bondage to synne)underlined., & hauynge frenesse of malice, but as þe seruawntes of God. Beþ sogettis to alle creatures of mankynde, for loue of God; worschupeþ ȝoure kynges & her mynystris in alle drede to ȝoure lordes, not only to þe goode & debonere, but also vn-to trwawntes. Soþly þis is grace, for who suffereþ for con|syence of God (þat is, for þat he wul not do aȝeyn consience, leuynge þe wille of God)underlined. heuynesse or wo sufferiþ in vnriȝtwysnesse, þe whuche is grace, if þat ȝe synne & þerfore be smeten in þe necke, ȝe suffre it (& þat riȝtwysly)underlined.. But if þat ȝe do wel & þanne paciently suffre (heuynesse & wronges)underlined., þis is grace a-nentis God (þat is, þat grace ȝe haue of God)underlined.. & soþely here-to ȝe ben clepid: for Crist sufferid for ȝow, leeuynge ensample þat ȝe folowe his trace: þat neuere dide synne, ne neuere was trecherie in his mouþe founde: þe whuche whan he was mysseyde, he mysseyde not a-ȝeyn; whan þat he schulde suffre, he curside notunderlined. aȝeynunderlined.; he soþly tooke him-self to þe iuge þat demyd him vnriȝtwisly; þe whuche bar oure synnys in his body (peyne, wowndes & wo, þat he for oure synne suffrede)underlined. up-on þe rode-tre: þat we to synnys schulde be dede, & soþly lyue riȝtwisly: þorow whos peyne ȝee beþ helud. Soþly ȝe were as scheep strayȝenge a-boute (departynge from þe flocke)underlined., but now ȝe beþ turned to þe hurde & þe bischop of ȝoure sowlis.

And wymmen on þe same manere be maked sugettis to here housbondes, so þat who-so troweþ not to ȝoure worde þat þei may be wonnen wiþ-outyn worde þorow þe goode conuersacyoun of ȝoure wymmen; by|holdynge in drede ȝoure holy conuersacyoun, of whom ne be þei noȝt wiþ-oute (þat is, be not þe wymmen wiþ-outen schewynge ensample)underlined. wiþ þe here of here heued, or wiþ serkylyng a-boute wiþ golde, or wiþ bysy arayynge of cloþus. But of þat þat is hydde wiþ-inne in mans herte (þat is, þat þei araye her herte wiþ-inne to þe siȝt of God, schewynge oute to þe folke her holy dedus in mekenes & lowenes)underlined. in vnfilynge reste (of here
body & soule)Underlined. of ony ese, & a demure spyryte þe whuche is riche & cely in þe syȝt of God. So soþly some tyme holy wymmen, & hopynge in God, enourned hem, sogettes to here housebondes. As Sare was buxom to Abraham, clepynge him her lorde: whos douȝttres ȝe beþ, wel doynge & not dredynge eny perturbacion or lettynge. Men also þat beþ duellynge wiþ ȝowre wymmen, aftur witte & connynge reweled, absteyne ȝow fro ȝoure wyues þat beþ þe more freyle, doynge wurschupe vn-to hem, as to hem þat beþ eyres of grace of lyf; þat oure preyeris be not lettud. Beþ alle of o wylle in feiþe in ȝoure preyeris, hauynge pyte (& compassyoun echone of oþur)Underlined., loueres of breþurhede, merciful, mylde, & meke: not ȝeldynge euyl for euyl, or mysword for mysword, but euen þer-aȝeyn blysse hem þat cursiþ ȝow, or myssey; for in þat ȝee beþ clepyd (þat is, ȝe be ordeynyd euere to blysse)Underlined., þat ȝee may haue þe blyssynge þorow herytage. Soþly whoso wole loue his lyf, & see goode dayes, wiþ-drawe his tunge fro yuel, & his lyppis þat þei speke no trecherye: bowe him a-wey fro wikkidnes, & do good; seke pees & folowe it. For þe eyȝen of God loke up-on þe riȝtwyse, & his eris be redy to here preieres; soþly þe semblawnt of God (þat is, þe heuy chere)Underlined. is up-on hem þat worcheþ þe yuel. & who is he þat ȝow schal noye, if ȝe folowe me perfytly (& be Godes amynysteris)Underlined. & what so-euere þat ȝee suffre for riȝtwysnesse, in þat ȝe beþ blessed. Ne be ȝe not a-ferid of drede of hem, þat ȝe beþ not lettud ne disturbled; but hald wel ȝee Crist oure Lord in ȝoure hertus; euer redy to make satis|faccyoun to alle þat axkeþ ȝou resoun þer þat in ȝow is þorow hope & feiþ. But wiþ a mesurid drede haue euere a good conciense, þat in þat at þei bacbite ȝow, as ȝe ware yuel-doaris, þat þei may be confoundid, þat blamen ȝowre goode conuersacioun & lyfynge in Crist. Forsoþe muche bettur it is if þe wel-doaris suffre aftir þe wille of God, þan al þe lykynge of þe yuel-doaris; for onys Crist was for oure synnes deed, þe riȝtwyse for the vnriȝtwise, to offre us to God; deed soþly in flesche & lyuynge in spirite, et cetera.

Arme ȝow in þouȝt of þe passioun þat Crist suffrode in his flesche. Beþ ȝe wyse, & wakeþ in praieres; hauynge eche wiþ oþur in ȝoureself lastynge charite. For charite hiduþ þe multitude of synne. Holdiþ hospitalite to-gedere wiþ-outen gruchynge; echone aftur þat he haþ taken grace, scheweþ it vn-to oþur as good dispenderis of þe many-fold grace of God; who-so spekeþ as þe wordis is of God; whoso mynysteriþ as þorow þe vertu þat God mynysteriþ to him: þat God in alle þinges be worschupid by oure Lord Iesu Criste, vn-to whom is honoure & ioye and lordschupe, in worlde wiþ-outen ende, amen.

My deere breþeren, wele ȝe not traueyle in hete & brennynge þat stereþ ȝow to temptacyon, as þat some newe þinge falle vn-to ȝowe: but com|munynge to-gedere in Cristis passyon (þat is, echone stere oþur whan he is toward eny temptacyoun, wiþ mynde of þe passyoun of Crist)Underlined., make ȝe ioye, þat in þe schewynge of his ioye ȝe mowe make ioye, beynge euere myry. If ȝe be schamed or reproued in þe name of oure Lord Iesu Criste,
& ȝe it gladly suffre, blessud schal ȝe be: for þat at is of þe honoure & of þe vertu of God, & he þat is his sperite, schal vpon ȝow reste; of oþur he is blasfemyd, of ȝow be he worschupyd. Suffere noon of ȝow as a manslear doþ, or a þeef, or an yuel, wordly man, or as a coueytour of oþur mennes goodes: but soþly if ȝe be not a-schamed to suffre as he þat is a cristen man, þan ȝe schul glorifye God in þis name. For it is tyme þat þe dome bygynne of þe hous of God: if it soþly first bygynne of us, what schal be here ende þat trowe not to þe gospel of God? & if vnne-þus schal a riȝtwys man be sauyd, þe wikkid & þe synner where schal þei appere? Also & þei þat suffre aftur þe wille of God, þei be-take here soules in here goode deedus vn-to here trewe makere.

I byseche þerfore þe olde þat beþ wiþ ȝou, I, þat am on of ȝoure elderis, & a wittnes of þe passyouns of Crist, þe whuche is comm[u]n[er]MS. commin. of his ioye þat schal be schewed in tyme þat is to come, þat ȝe feede Godes flokke in þat at ȝee may, purueyinge for hem, not constreyned but by ȝoure fre wille, aftur Godes techynge; ne for no hauynge of foule wordly wynnynge, but wilfully (& gladly)Underlined.; not as lordis in þe clergye, but a forme (& ensample)Underlined. to the flokke of good lyuynge; and whan þe prynce of hirdus schal appere (þat is, Crist on þe day of dome)Underlined., ȝe schal take a gloriose croune of ioye. & þe same manere ȝe þat be ȝonge be þe sogettes to ȝoure elderis. And scheweþ alle to-gedere mekenes a-mong ȝow: for God þe proude wiþstondiþ, & to þe meke he ȝeueþ grace. And þerfore meke ȝow vndur þe myȝt[y] honde of God, þat he make ȝow hye in tyme of his visitacioun; puttynge in him al ȝoure bysynes, for he haþ kepynge of ȝow. Beþ sobre & wakeþ, for ȝoure enmy þe deuele as it wore a romynynge lyon goþ aboute, sechynge whom he may swelowe: whom ȝe schul wiþstonde, stalworþe in þe feiþ, wytynge þat ȝee mowe suffre þe same passyoun þat he doþ þat is in þe worlde (for eny strenkþ þat ȝe haue of ȝow-self)Underlined.. & þerfore soþly God of al grace þat haþ callid ȝow in-to his euere-lastynge ioye in Iesu Crist, he schal fulfille (þe myȝt þat ȝow wanteþ)Underlined., conferme (ȝoure þouȝte)Underlined., & make it sad. In him by ioye & honoure euere wiþ-outen ende. Amen. By oure trewe broþer Syluane, as I suppose, schortly I haue wryton vnto ȝow, prayinge & wyttnessynge þat þis is þe verrey grace of God, in þe whuche loke þat ȝe stonde. Þe chosun churche þat is in Babiloyne greteþ ȝow weel, & Marke my sone. Greteþ wel to-gedere echone oþur in holy kyssynge. Grace be to ȝow alle þat beþ in Iesu Criste. Amen.

Symon Petre, the seruawnte & þe apostul of Iesu Crist, to hem þat haue taken feiþ euen wiþ vs, in ryȝtwisnesse of oure God & oure saueoure Iesu Crist: grace be to ȝow, & pees be fulfillyd in þe knowynge of oure Lord. How þat alle þinges beþ ȝeuen to ȝow, þorow þe vertu of God, þe whuche beþ nedeful, & beþ ȝeue to ȝow to lyf & to pyte, by knowynge or
þorowȝ kunnynge of him þat clepeþ ȝow þorow his owne ioye & his vertu; by þe whuche vertu moste & precyous byhestes he haþ ȝeuen ȝow; þat þorow him ȝe be maked felowis of þe kynde of God, fleynge þe corrupcyoun of desyres þat beþ in the worlde. And þerfore putteþ al ȝoure bysynesse to vse vertu in ȝoure feiþ, in vertu to haue connynge, soþly in kunnynge abstynence, pacyence, in pacyence onlyche of pyte, in pyte loue of breþur|hede, in br[e]ur[hede]MS. broþur. loue of charite: Soþly if þis be ȝoure lederis & wiþ ȝow, þei wele [not] leue ȝow voyde, [ne] wiþ-outen fruyt in þe knowynge of oure Lord Iesu Crist. Soþly whoso is not redy to þis, soþly he is blynde, & suffereþ temptacyon to muche to haue power in him, forgetynge to muche þe clensynge of his olde synnys. Wherfore, my dere breþeren, beþ þe more bysy, þat þorow ȝoure goode werkes þat ȝe do & fulfylle ȝowre certeyn clepynge & chesynge (þat is, þat ȝe fulfylle þe dedus þat ȝe beþ chosen and clepyd to)Underlined.. Soþly if ȝe þus do, & ȝoure clepynge fulfille, þan ȝe schul not synne. And þanne schal abundynglyche (þat is, plenteouslyche)Underlined. be ȝeuen to ȝow, wher-þorow ȝe schul haue entre in-to þe euere-lastynge kyngdom of oure Lord & Iesu Crist oure saueoure. Wher|fore I schal bygynne to meue ȝow & telle ȝow eueremore of þes þinges, þat ȝe soþly be in þem stabled & confermed in soþfastnes. Soþly me þinkeþ it riȝtwis, as longe as I schal dwelle in this wonyngestede, (þat is, þe whyle I lyue)Underlined. to rere ȝow (þat is, to stere ȝow) in warnynges & techynges. Serteyn I am þat smert & hasty is þe doynge dowen of my tabernacle (þat is, I am certeyn þat hastely & sone schal come þe tyme of my departynge of body and of soule)Underlined., after þat at oure Lorde Iesu Criste haþ ordeynyd to me. & I schal ȝeue ȝow enchesoun þat I may haue ȝow aftur my deed, þat ȝe haue in mynde þes þynges þat I telle ȝow in my lyfe. Ȝe schul not folow þis techynge, as it were yuel tauȝt fabules we haue maad knowen vn-to ȝow: þe vertu & þe for-knowynge of God. But I wele þat ȝe be byholderes of his grete dedus: takynge of God the Fadur honoure & ioye, þorow þe voice þat come glydynge fro heuene, fro þe fadur to þe sone, seyinge on þis wyse fro his fulgrete ioye, Here is, or, þis is my deere sone, in whom muche lykyng Iche haue hadde; heere ȝe him. & þis voice we herde fro heuene brouȝte, whanne we were wiþ him in þe holy hylle. & we haue þe more ful trewþe & word of prophecye, & in þat ȝe do wele þat ȝe take heede þer-to, as to a lanterne lyȝtenynge in a derke place, forto þe day schyne, & lucifer, the grete sterne, be resen in ȝoure hertis, þat schyneþ so briȝt. Soþely al tyme prophecye is not ȝeuen aftur mannes wille: but alle þe holy seyntes þorow þe Holy Gost spaken þat were enspyred of him.

Ther were soþly also fals prophetus a-mong þe folke, ryȝt as a-mong ȝow schul be mayster lyeris, þat bryngen vppe newe sectis (þat is, newe religyon & newe gyses)Underlined. of dampnacyoun, & þat Lord þat bouȝte hem schul þei denye, chesynge hem a ledere of loste & dampnacyoun. & many schul folowe aftur here leccheryes (þat is to seye, þer schal come in holy churche maysterus þat schul mayntene lesynges, boþe of lerid & lewyd, peruertynge
þe trewe lawes, & turnyng soþe to false & false vn-to soþe; & þes schulen brynge newe ordris & sectus, costomes and degyses, turnynge here religyoun out of þe ryȝte rewle, vnschapynge þer body wiþ newe manere of degyse, conformynge hem to þe worlde and leuynge godes rewle; & make hem a bonde of lost & dampnacyoun. & many schul folowe þer leccherye; of men of holy churche þat schulde be Godes prophetes schal by-come prophetis of þe deuel. & oþer grete & smale, þat schal se her leccherie & her foule dedis, schal folowe here ensample and so wende to helle)Underlined. by þe whuche þe weye of soþfastnes schal be blasfemed (þat is, þe whuche schul soþfast techynge & heleful lore putt dowen & despice, & mayntene & aferme þe lawe of lust & synne)Underlined.. & þorow auaryce (þei schul be erandebereris & depraueris to lette ȝow) in ȝoure wordis, & ȝoure deedus þei schul bye & sylle (þat is, in þat ȝe teche þe peple þe peryl of yuel lyf to make hem to haue drede, in þat þei schul bye & sylle her synne for syluer & for golde)Underlined., to whom þe dome now ne somtyme sessiþ noȝt, & here dampnacyoun slepeþ nouȝt. Soþly if God sparud not to þe aungeles þat synnede, but bytoke hem to be drawen wiþ þe romynynge deueles of helle, whan þei deuelis bycome, echone to drawe oþur, euere þere to be turmentid, kepid vn-to þe dome. & origynale worlde he sparud not, but al it fordide, safe Noe & þo þat wiþ him were, wiþ þe grete flode. And þe cytees of Sodome & Gomorre turnyd it in-to poudre [þ]orowMS. rorow. his vpturnynge, & dampnede hem alle, ȝeuynge hem ensample þat aftur wolde do yuele; & þe ryȝtwyse Loth þat wiþ þe wickede was ouerlyen, & holdun dowen wiþ here vnriȝtwyse lyfynge, God him fayre delyuerede: soþly þorow syȝt & herynge ryȝt-wyse he was dwellynge a-monges hem, þat from day to day his ryȝt-wyse soule wiþ wickede dedus þei turmented. God wolde his ryȝtwyse from temptacyoun delyuere, and soþly þe wicked vnto þe day of dome in peyne & turmentis hem kepede; & soþly more hem þat aftur here flesche in desyres of vnclennes walke; to haue any lordschupe þei dispice it (þat is, eny lord to haue ouere hem)Underlined.; bolde þei be, & drede not to gadere to hem lykynge companyis, gyses & sectes newe for-to ordeyne, þe whuche be blasphemaris; siþen þat angelis beþ of more vertu & strengþ, þei take no mynde of þat dredeful dome þat schal be ȝeue aȝeyn hem. Þei soþly as it were vnresonable bestes, þat þorow sleyȝtus be taken or þei wite, so þe blasphemaris in here fylþe schal preche, takynge [þe mede] of vnriȝtwisnes. For þei wende þe lustus of þis worlde & þe fylþe & þe lykynges hadde ben delices, folowynge in þer lykynges, in þer festus doynge lecherye, hauynge here [ey]ȝenMS. aȝeyn. ful of a-uoutries, wiþ|outen sessynge of here synne; hauynge rowe soules & vnstable; & vsynge þer hertes in auaryce; childeren of malyson, ȝoden omysse, forsakynge ryȝt weye, & folwed þe weye of Baalam, þe whuche loued mede of wickednes; soþly blamed he was of his wodnesse of a doume beste—as who seiþ, he spak not as resonable man, but as a doume beste þat vndur synne was ȝoked—vndur ȝokke, spekynge wiþ mannes voyce & of his vn-wytte of þe prophete was him forbode, seyinge on þis wyse,
Þis beþ welles wiþ-outen watur, & cloudes þrowen aboute wiþ stormes (þat is, þei þat schulde haue watur of wysdom & techynge as men of holy churche, þei been alle drye, & þe cundyte of grace renneþ nouȝt to hem: but beþ cloudes derke wiþ synne, þrowen a-boute wiþ stormes of tempta|cyon. Þus vndurstonde I þis.)Underlined. in þe whuche dymnes of derkenes is kept; spekynge proude þinges of vanyte, deseyuynge hem in desyres of leccherye of flesche þat tristeþ to hem; & opynly lyfen in here errour, by-hotynge to hem frenes, & by hem-selue bounde & seruantes of corupcyon. Soþly of whom-so eny is ouercomen & þus defoulyd, his seruant he is. Soþly who-so feleþ þe fylynges of þe worlde in knowynge of oure Saueoure & oure Lord Iesu Criste, & efte in þe same ben ouercome, þanne þat lattere fallynge is wors vnto hem þan þe firste was. Soþly betre it were to hem not to knowe þe weye of ryȝtwisnesse, þan, aftur þat þei haue knowen it, to turne awey þer-fro aftur þat it is ȝeuen us in holy comawndement. Soþly to hem falleþ þe trewe prouerbe þat is seyde. Lyke þei ben to an hounde þat turneþ aȝeyn to ete þat he haþ spewe, and also to þe sowe þat wascheþ hyre in þe podel wiþ mukke al fyled.

My dere breþeren, I wryte þis vnto ȝow to be ȝoure secunde pistil in þe whyche I stere ȝoure ful clere myndes þorowe biddynge & bysekynge, þat ȝe þenke vpon þe wordis þat Crist haþ spoken vnto ȝowe and of þe apostelus wordes, & also of þe prophetes, & of þe comawndementis of oure Lord & oure Sauyour. & wyte ȝe wel þat first þer schal come in þe laste dayes bygyleris to disceyue, þat schal rewel hem aftur þeir owne lustus & þer lykynges, & bschul seye (þat is, of Crist to helpe & to deme)b-b Underlined. Where is his byheste, or where is his comynge? Seþen þat þe olde fadrus were deede, ȝut alle þinge lastuþ þus fro þe bygynnynge of eche creature. But þei haue no mynde how þat he made heuene & erþe, see & londe, & alle þorow his worde. Þorow þe whuche word he distroyede þanne þorow flowynge water al þe worlde, saue a fewe þat were kept. Soþly þe heuenys þat now ben & erþe wiþ þe same worde—þat is, to heuene schal be fordon & erþe schal brenne—beþ maked a-ȝeyn, & kepte vnto þe fyre on þe day of dome, & vnto þe day of lesynge & peryschynge of þe wickede men. But o þinge, my dere breþeren, be knowen to ȝow & not hyde, þat o day wiþ God is as it were a þousande ȝeere, & a þousande ȝere but as it were o day. God taryeþ not in þinges þat he haþ byhette as some folke wene; but sufferyngelyche he abyduþ vs, willynge þat none perysche: but he wile þat alle be turned to penawnce in a-mendynge of here lyf. Soþfastly þe day of God sodeynly schal come as a þef vnwarned, in whos comynge hastyly heuenes schul passe (þat is, heuenly soules schul passe fro þe dredeful dome vnto þe blisse of heuene)Underlined., þe elementes soþly þorow hete schul be vndone, & þorow brennynge of fyre þei schul be wastud, þe erþe soþly & alle þinges þat schal be þere-inne, alle þei schul be brent. Þerfore syþen alle þes beþ to be vndone, how nedeful is it þanne to us to be holy in lyfynge & pyte, abydynge & makynge us redy aȝeyn þe dredful comynge of oure Lord Iesu Criste, þorow whom heuenes brennynge
schul be vndone, & þe elementis þorow brennynge of fyre schul fayle. Soþfastly newe heuenes & newe erþe we abyde & his byhestes, in þe whyche ryȝtwysnes dwelliþ. Wherfore abydynge þes þinges, my dere breþeren, bysy ȝow to be founden a-nentes him in pees vnsoyled & vnfouled, & trowiþ wel þat þe longe a-bydynge of oure Lord Iesu Crist is for oure hele, ryȝt as oure dere broþur Poule, aftur þe witte þat was ȝeuen him, wrote vnto ȝow; & as he in alle his pistelys spake of þes þinges, in þe whyche somme beþ harde to vndurstonde, þat þei þat be vnstable & vn-tauȝt deprauen, as þei don oþur wrytynges, vnto þeire oune dampnacyon. And þerfore, ȝe my breþeren, knowiþ it byfore, kepeþ ȝoure-self, þat þorow þe errour of hem þat beþ vnwyse ȝe be nouȝt deceyuyd, fallynge fro ȝoure firste strengþe. But beþ wexynge in grace & in þe knowynge of oure Saueoure Iesu Crist; to him be ioye & worschupe, worlde wiþ-outen ende. Amen.

HEAD.HI1: Here bygynnyþ þe first pystyl of seynt Ion þe a-postele.

DIV3.P: The lyf þat was wiþ-outen ende fro þe bygynnynge, þe whuche we herde, and wiþ oure eyȝen sawe, þat we byholde, & oure hondis him handlede, of þe whuche word of lyfe we haue drawe, & we him sawe, & bere wittnes, & schewe vnto ȝow þe lyf euerelastynge (þat is, Crist Godis sone)Underlined. þat was wiþ þe Fadur & to us apperud: þat we haue herde & seyne we schewe it vn-to ȝow, þat ȝe mowe haue felowschupe wiþ vs, & þat oure felowschepe be wiþ þe Fadur and wiþ his sone Iesu Crist. & þis haue we wryte vnto ȝow þat ȝe make ioye, & þat ȝoure ioye be fulle. & þis is þe schewynge þat we herde of him, & we schewe it vnto ȝow: for God is þe lyȝt, & þer is in him no manere of derknes. If we seye þat we haue felowschepe wiþ him, & we in derknes walke, we lye & doþ not soþfastnes. Soþly if we walken in lyȝte, so as he is in lyȝte, þanne haue we felouschype to-gedur, & þe blode of Iesu Crist his soneMS. sonne. makeþ vs clene of alle synne. If þat we seye we haue no synne, we diceyue vs-self, & soþfastnes is not in vs. If þat we schryue us of oure synnes, God is trewe & ryȝtwyse, & forȝeueþ oure synnes, and he schal make vs clene of alle manere of wickednes. If þat we seye we synned nouȝt, we make him a lyere, & his word is not in vs.

My children, þis I write to ȝow, þat ȝe synne not. But whoso-euere haþ synned, we haue Iesu Crist oure ryȝtwyse avocat byfore þe Fadur: & he is socoure and helpe for oure synnes; soþly not only for oures, but also for al þe worlde, þat wiþ trewe trowþe wile to him clepe. And in þat we wote þat we haue knowen him, if þat we kepe his biddynges. Whoso seiþ þat he knoweþ God, & kepeþ not his biddynges, he is a lyere, & soþfastnes is not in him.
