Soþly whoso-euere kepuþ his word, verreyly, in him is Godes charite parfyte. & in þat we knowe þat we dwelle in him, if þat we be parfyte in him. Whoso seiþ þat he in him dwelleþ, as he haþ go mote he go. My dere frendes, I wryte vnto ȝow not
a newe byddynge, but an olde comawndement þat ȝe haue had fro þe bygynnynge: eftsones I write a newe mawndement to ȝow here, þat is soþ in him & in ȝow; for derkenesse now beþ passed, and now schyneþ verrei lyȝt. Whoso seiþ þat he is in lyȝte, & hatuþ his broþur, he is in derkenes. Whoso loueþnot follows, crossed through. his broþer he dwelleþ in lyȝte, & sclaundur is not in him. Soþly whoso hatiþ his broþur, in derknesse he is, & in derknesse he goþ, & wote not whydur he goþ, for derknesse haþ blyndid his eyȝen.

SonesChap. ii. begins here in MS., I wryte vnto ȝow, þat for his name ȝoure synnes beþ forȝeue ȝow. I write to ȝow, fadrus, for ȝe haue knowen him þat is wiþ-owten ende. I write to ȝow, ȝonge men, for ȝe haue ouercome þe wicked. I wryte to ȝow, ȝonge children, for ȝe haue knowen ȝoure Fadur. I wryte to ȝow, fadrus, for ȝe haue knowynge of God. I write to ȝow, ȝonge men, for ȝe beþ stronge, & Godes [word] dwelleþ in ȝow, & wickednes ȝe haue ouercome. Ne wil ȝe not loue þe worlde, neyþur þe þinges þat in þe worlde beþ. For who-so loueþ þe worlde, þe charite of þe Fadur is not in him. For al þat is in þe worlde, it is a desyre of þe flesche & desyre of eyȝen, & pride of lyf, þe whuche is not of þe Fadur, but of the worlde it is. & þe worlde schal passe wiþ alle his lykynges & desyres: who-so doþ þe wille of God, he dwelleþ wiþ-outen ende. My leue sones, it is þe laste oure; & as ȝe haue herd þat Antecrist comeþ; now beþ many Antecristes maked, wherfore we wote þat it is þe laste oure. Þei ȝede forþ fro vs, but þei were not of vs; for soþly hadde þei ben of vs, soþly þei had dwellid wiþ us: but þat þei schul mow be knowen, for þei ne beþ not alle of us. But ȝe haue ennoyntynge of þe Holy Goste, & alle þinges ȝe haue knowen. I wrote not þis to ȝow as vnto hem þat knewe not soþfastnesse, but as to hem þat knewe it, and wherfore al lesynge is not of soþfastnes. Who is a lyere, but he þat denyeþ þat Iesus is Crist? He þis is Ante|criste, þat denyeþ þe Fadur & þe Sone. Alle þat denyeþ þe Sone, denyeþ þe Fader (þat is, he denyeþ þat he is a fader, for no fader may be wiþ-outen a sone or a chylde)Underlined.; who-so is a-knowe þe Fader, he is a-knowe þe Sone; & whoso is a-knowe þe Sone, a Fader he haþ. Þat at ȝe fro þe bygyn|nynge haue herde, in ȝow mote it dwelle. Ȝif it dwelle in ȝow þat ȝe fro þe bygynnynge haue herde, þan ȝe schul dwelle in þe Fader & in the Sone. & þis is þe byheste þat þe Sone haþ byhette ȝow, lyf euere-lastynge (þat is, of Criste)Underlined.. Þise þinges I wryte vnto ȝow of hem þat deceyue ȝow. & ȝee þe ennoyntynge þat ȝe toke of him, it mote dwelle in ȝow. & ȝe ne haue not nede þat eny teche ȝow: but his ennoyntynge techiþ ȝow of alle þinges, it is soþ, & it is no lesynge. & as he haþ tauȝte ȝow, so dwelleþ þerinne. & whanne þat ȝe schal appere, haue we feyþ|fulnes, & be we not confoundid of him in his comynge. If ȝe wite þat he is ryȝtwyse, wete ȝe forsoþe þat alle þat doþ ryȝtwysnesse is bore of him.

Seeþ what charite þe Fadur haþ ȝeuen to us, þat we Godes sones be nemnyd. & we knowe & wite wel, þat þerfore þe worlde knewe ȝow not:
for it knewe not him. My dere frendes, now we be Godes sones, & ȝit was it not schewid what þat we schul be. Soþly we wote, whan þat he schal appere we schul be lyke vnto him; for we schul se him riȝt as he is. & echone þat haþ þis lykenesse in him, he halweþ him, so as he is holy. Alle þat doþ synne, he doþ also wickednes: for synne is wickednes. And wite ȝe þat he appered to do a-wey synne of þe worlde, & no synne is in him. Alle þat in him dwelleþ synneþ nouȝt: & alle þat synneþ seeþ him not, ne knoweþ him nouȝt. My children, late noone disceyue ȝow: whoso doþ riȝtwisnes he is riȝtwis, as he riȝtwise is: whoso doþ synne of þe deuel it is; for fro þe bygynnynge þe deuel synneþ. In þat apperud Godes Sone, þat he wolde vndo þe deuelis werkes. Alle þat beþ bore of God doþ not synne, for his seed in him dwelleþ: & he may not synne, for of God he is bore. In þis beþ Godes sones schewed & þe fendus sones: whoso is not riȝtwyse he is not of God, & he þat loueþ not his broþur. For þis þe schewynge þe whuche ȝe haue herde fro þe bygyn|nynge, þat eche of ȝow loue oþur: nouȝt as Caym þat of wickednes was, & sleare of his broþur. & for what þing slowe he him? For his dedus were wicked, & his broþeres riȝtwyse. Ne wondreþ ȝow nouȝt, breþeren, if þe worlde ȝow hate. We wote þat we beþ translatud fro deþ vnto lyf, for þat we loue oure breþeren. He þat loueþ not dwelleþ in deþ. Whoso|euere hateþ his broþer he is a man-sleare: & wyte ȝe þat eche mansleare haþ not lyf euerelastynge in him dwellynge. In þat we haue knowen þe charite of God, for he putte his soule for us: & we owe for oure breþeren to putte oure soules. He þat haþ þe goodes of þis worlde, & seeþ his broþer haþ nede & helpeþ him not, how dwelleþ þe charite of God in him? My children, loue we nouȝt [wiþ] worde, neiþer wiþ tunge, but wiþ deede & soþfastnes. In þat we knowe þat we beþ of soþfastnes, if we amoneste & make meke oure hertes in his syȝte. For if oure herte reprehende vs nouȝt, God is more þan oure herte, & he knoweþ alle þinges. My dere frendus, if oure herte reprehende vs not, we haue feiþfulnes to God; & what-so-euere we aske of hym, we schal it haue, for þat we kepe his bydynges, & do þe þinges þat beþ plesynge byfore him. & þat is his comaundement, þat we trowe in þe name of his sone Iesu Crist, & þat we loue echone oþur, as he haþ vs comawndid. & whoso kepeþ his comaunde|mentis in him he dwelleþ, & he in him. & in þat we wote þat he dwelleþ in vs, þorow þe spyryt þat he haþ ȝoue vs.

My dere frendes, ne trowe ȝe not to eche spyryte, but proue þe spyrytes if þei be of God: for many false prophetes ȝede in-to þe worlde. In þat is þe speryt of God knowen: for eche spyryte þe whuche is a-knowe þat Iesu Criste haþ comen in flesche—þat is, boþe God & man—he is of God. & eche spirite þat vndoþ Iesu Criste, he is not of God: but þis is Ante|crist of þe whuche ȝe haue herde. For he comeþ, & now ryȝt he is in þe worlde. My children, ȝe beþ of God, & in him ȝe haue ouercomen: for God is grettere þat is in ȝow þan he þat is in þe worlde. Þei beþ of þe worlde, & þerfore of þe worlde þei speke, & þe world hem heriþ. We beþ of God: whoso kneweþ God hereþ ȝow; he þat is nouȝt of God heruþ ȝow nouȝt. & in þat we knowe þe spirite of soþfastnes & þe spirite of
erroure. My dere breþeren, loue we us to-gidere: for charite is of God; & eche þat loueþ his broþur of God he is bore, & God he knowiþ. He þat loueþ nouȝt knewe not God: for God is charite. In þat appered þe charite of God in vs: for he sente his owne sone in-to þe worlde, þat we lyue by him. & in þat is charite not as we haue loued God, but for þat he first loued vs, & sente his sone an helpe for oure synnes. My dere breþeren, if God haue loued vs, & we schulde eche loue oþur. No man saw God euere (or, eny tyme)Underlined.: if we loue to-gidere, God in vs dwelleþ, & his charite is in vs parfyte. In þat we knoweþ þat we in him dwelleþ & he in vs, for of his Spirite he haþ ȝeue vs; and we haue seye & bere witnesse, þat þe Fadur sente his sone Saueoure of þe worlde. Whoso is a-knowe þat Iesus is Godes sone, God dwelleþ in him, & he in God. & we haue knowe & we trowe to þe charite þat God haþ in vs. God is charite; & he þat dwelleþ in charite, he dwelleþ in God, & God in him. In þat is charite parfyte wiþ vs, þat we haue feiþ in þe day of dome; for ryȝt as he is & we beþ in þis worlde. Drede is not in charite: but parfyte charite putteþ oute drede, for drede haþ peyne; soþly whoso drediþ, he is not parfite in charite. & þerfore loue we God, for first God loueþ us. Whoso-euere seiþ þat he loueþ God, & hateþ his broþur, he is a lyere: þe whuche soþly loueþ noȝt his broþur whom þat he seiþ, how may he loue God whom þat he seeþ nouȝt? & þat biddinge we haue of God, þat whoso loueþ God, he loueþ his broþer.

Alle þat troweþ þat Iesus is Criste þorowȝ God he is bore: & eche þat loueþ him þat gate, loueþ him þat of him is bore. In þat we knowe þat we loue Godes children, whan whe loue God, & we do his byddynges. Þis is soþly charite of God, þat we kepe his biddynges: & his biddynges ne beþ not greuous. For alle þinge þat is bore of God (or, þorowȝ God)Underlined. ouercomeþ þe worlde: & þis is þe victory þat ouercomeþ þe worlde, oure feiþ. Who is it þat ouercomeþ þe worlde? noon but he þat trowiþ þat Iesus is Godus sone. Þis is he þat come by water & blode, Iesus Criste; nouȝt only in water, but in watur & blode. & it is þe spyrite þat beruþ witnes þat Crist is soþfastnes. For þre þer beþ þat witnes bere in heuene, þe Fadur, þe Sone & þe Holy Goste: and þes þre beþ one. & þre þer beþ þat ȝeueþ witnes in erþe, Spirite, water, & bloode: & þre beþ one. Ȝif we take witnes of men, more is þe witnes of God; for þatMS. þat for. [is] þe witnes of God þat is more, for he bar witnes of his sone. Whoso troweþ in Godes Sone, he haþ þe witnes of God in him. He þat troweþ not in þe Sone he makeþ him a lyere, for he troweþ not in þe witnes þat God witnessiþ of his Sone. And þis is þe witnesse, for lyfe euere-lastynge he haþ ȝeue to us, & þat is þe lyfe in his Sone. He þat haþ þe Sone haþ lyfe; whoso haþ not þe Sone (of God)Underlined., he haþ not lyfe. Þis I wryte vn-to ȝow, to make ȝow to wyte þat ȝe haue lyfe euere-lastynge þat troweþ in þe name of Godes Sone. & þis is þe feiþfulnes þat we haue to God, for what þinge so we vse axse aftur his wille, he hereþ us: & we wote þat he hereþ us, what-so we axe: & we wote þat we haue þe axsynges, þat we
haue him axsyd. He þat wote þat his broþur synneþ synne þat is not to þe deeþ, axse for him, & God schal ȝeue lyfe to him þat synneþ not to þe deeþ. Soþly þer is synne vn-to þe deeþ (þat is, euere contynuynge in sȳnne, & endynge in dispeyre, þat is, wanhope)Underlined.: none, I sey, prey for him. Eche wickednesse is synne, & it is synne vn-to þe deeþ. We knowe þat eche þat is bore of God (or, þorow God)Underlined. ne synneþ not—þat is, wilfully in deedly synne—but getynge kepeþ him, & þe wicked toucheþ hym not (þat is, þe yuel spirite ouercomeþ him noȝt)Underlined.. We wote þat of God we beþ bore, & alle þe worlde is putte in wickednes. & we wote þat Godes Sone come & ȝaf us witte to knowe verrey God, & þat we be in his verrey Sone, Iesu Criste. He þis is verrey God & lyfe euere-lastynge. My children, kepeþ ȝow fro mawmetrye (and symulacris)Underlined..
